A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.The AFP Client does not properly clean the environment before executing commands in certain situations. A local user can create files or execute commands with system privileges.
CVE-2007-0729.extra: A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-0734.title: AirPort Extreme Base Station with 802.11n Discloses Filenames to Remote Users and Allows Incoming IPv6 Connections
CVE-2007-0734.body: A vulnerability was reported in the AirPort Extreme Base Station. A remote user on the local network can view filenames. A remote user can send IPv6 packets to connected systems.When the AirPort Disk feature is used, a remote user on the local network can view filenames on a password-protected disk [CVE-2007-0734].The device supports incoming IPv6 connections in the default configuration [CVE-2007-1338]. A remote user can send IPv6 packets to connected hosts.Only the AirPort Extreme Base Station with 802.11n is affected.
CVE-2007-0734.extra: A remote user on the local network can view filenames of files on the password-protected AirPort Disk.A remote user can send IPv6 packets to connected hosts.

CVE-2007-0734.title: Mac OS X Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-0734.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A local user can execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges. A local user can capture console keystrokes.The IOKit HID interface allows a local user to capture console keystrokes, including passwords and other potentially sensitive information [CVE-2007-0724]. Apple credits Andrew Garber of University of Victoria, Alex Harper, and Michael Evans with reporting this vulnerability.Apple indicates that a fix for this HID vulnerability was including in the Mac OS X v10.4.9 update but was not delivered to all systems. The CoreServices daemon allows a local user to send interprocess communications to its Mach task port [CVE-2007-0732]. This may allow a local user to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges. Systems prior to Mac OS X v10.4 are not affected.A remote user can create a specially crafted UFS disk image that, when processed by fsck, will trigger a memory corruption error and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2007-0734].Libinfo may not properly report errors to applications that use libinfo [CVE-2007-0735]. A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. Apple credits Landon Fuller of Three Rings Design with reporting this vulnerability.If the portmap service is enabled, a remote user can trigger an integer overflow in the RPC library [CVE-2007-0736]. Apple credits the Mu Security Research Team with reporting this vulnerability.If Internet Sharing is enabled, a remote user can send specially crafted RTSP packets to trigger a buffer overflow in 'natd' [CVE-2007-0741].WebFoundation allows a cookie set by a subdomain to be accessed by the parent domain [CVE-2007-0742]. A remote user may be able to access potentially sensitive information. Systems prior to Mac OS X v10.4 are not affected. Apple credits Bradley Schwoerer of University of Wisconsin-Madison with reporting this vulnerability. URLMount passes the username and password information required to mount remote filesystems via SMB servers as command line arguments [CVE-2007-0743]. A local user may be able to obtain this information. Apple credits Daniel Ball of Pittsburgh Technical Institute, Geoff Franks of Hauptman Woodward Medical Research Institute, and Jamie Cox of Sophos Plc with reporting this vulnerability.A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP packet when initializing an audio/video conference to trigger a heap overflow in the VideoConference framework and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-0746].When a WebDAV filesystem is mounted, the load_webdav program may not properly clean the environment [CVE-2007-0747]. A local user can create files or execute arbitrary commands with system privileges.
CVE-2007-0734.extra: A local user can execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges.A local user can capture console keystrokes.A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2007-0776.title: Mozilla Firefox Memory Corruption in Layout Engine, SVG, and Javascript Engine May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-0776.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user may be able to cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error, causing the browser to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Thunderbird and SeaMonkey are also affected.Jesse Ruderman, Martijn Wargers, and Olli Pettay reported crashes in the layout engine [CVE-2007-0775].Tom Ferris reported a heap overflow in SVG triggered by wide stroke widths, affecting only Firefox version 2.x [CVE-2007-0776].Brian Crowder, Igor Bukanov, Johnny Stenback, moz_bug_r_a4, and shutdown reported potential memory corruption errors in the JavaScript engine [CVE-2007-0777].
CVE-2007-0776.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will cause the target user's browser to crash or execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2007-0777.title: Mozilla Firefox Memory Corruption in Layout Engine, SVG, and Javascript Engine May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-0777.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user may be able to cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error, causing the browser to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Thunderbird and SeaMonkey are also affected.Jesse Ruderman, Martijn Wargers, and Olli Pettay reported crashes in the layout engine [CVE-2007-0775].Tom Ferris reported a heap overflow in SVG triggered by wide stroke widths, affecting only Firefox version 2.x [CVE-2007-0776].Brian Crowder, Igor Bukanov, Johnny Stenback, moz_bug_r_a4, and shutdown reported potential memory corruption errors in the JavaScript engine [CVE-2007-0777].
CVE-2007-0777.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will cause the target user's browser to crash or execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2007-0778.title: Mozilla Firefox Cache Collision May Let Remote Users Obtain Cached Web Page Contents
CVE-2007-0778.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user may be able to obtain information from the target user's browser cache.Two web pages can collide in the disk cache, causing portions of the longer document to be appended to the shorter document. A remote user may be able to exploit this to obtain information from the target user's web cache.Seamonkey is also affected.Aad reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-0778.extra: A remote user may be able to obtain cached information from the target user's browser.

CVE-2007-0780.title: Mozilla Firefox Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Local File Access
CVE-2007-0780.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can create specially crafted URLs or HTML that, when loaded by a target user, may cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.The browser does not properly process invalid trailing characters in HTML tag attributes. This may foil web sites content filters that attempt to remove certain attributes such as event handlers.The browser assumes that child frames should inherit the character set of the parent window rather than the default setting used for top-level pages. Sites that accept user content but do not specify the character set or encoding to be used may be able to conduct cross-site scripting attacks.In addition, blocked popups can be used to conduct cross-site scripting attacks or access local files in certain cases.Stefan Esser, shutdown, Michal Zalewski, and others reported these vulnerabilities.http://www.hardened-php.net/advisory_032007.142.html
CVE-2007-0780.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with certain sites, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user may be able to access local files.

CVE-2007-0882.title: Solaris in.telnetd Grants Access to Remote Users
CVE-2007-0882.body: A vulnerability was reported in Sun Solaris in the telnet daemon. A remote user can bypass authentication and gain access to the target system.A remote user can invoke telnet and set their username to '-f<username>' to gain remote access to the specified username account on the target system.On February 28, 2007, Sun reported that at least one worm is known to be actively exploiting this vulnerability.Kingcope discovered this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.com-winner.com/0day_was_the_case_that_they_gave_me.pdf
CVE-2007-0882.extra: A remote user can gain access to the target system.

CVE-2007-0896.title: Sage Reader Extension Input Validation Hole Permits Script Injection Attacks
CVE-2007-0896.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Sage extension for Firefox. A remote user can inject arbitrary scripting code.The software does not properly filter HTML code from RSS feeds before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted feed that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.The original bug report is available at:http://mozdev.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=16320JPCERT reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-0896.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary scripting code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-0898.title: Clam AntiVirus MIME Parameter Directory Traversal Bug Lets Remote Users Overwrite Certain Files
CVE-2007-0898.body: A vulnerability was reported in Clam AntiVirus. A remote user can oerwrite certain files on the target system.The software does not properly validate user-supplied input in the MIME header id parameter. A remote user can supply a specially crafted value containing '../' directory traversal characters to overwrite files on target system with the privileges of the clamd scanner process. Data from the MIME message body will be written to the specified file.The vendor was notified on February 7, 2007.iDefense reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-0898.extra: A remote user can overwrite files on the target system with the privileges of the clamd scanner.

CVE-2007-0906.title: PHP Buffer Overflows and Format String Bugs Permit Code Execution and Denial of Service
CVE-2007-0906.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in PHP. A remote or local user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system or cause denial of service conditions.Several buffer overflows exist in some PHP functions [CVE-2007-0906]. The PHP session extension, the str_replace() function, and the imap_mail_compose() functions are affected. A remote user may be able to submit specially crafted values to a program that uses the affected function to trigger an overflow and execute arbitrary code.A buffer underflow in the sapi_header_op() function may let users cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2007-0907].The wddx extension can be exploited using certain WDDX input packets to view random portions of heap memory [CVE-2007-0908].A remote user under control of a database table accessed via the odbc_result_all() function can supply specially crafted data to trigger a format string flaw and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2007-0909].Unspecified vulnerabilities may allow a user to overwrite certain super-global variables [CVE-2007-0910].A user can supply specially crafted data to the zend_hash_init() function to cause the function to enter an infinite loop and consume excessive CPU resources until a timeout is reached [CVE-2007-0988].
CVE-2007-0906.extra: A remote or local user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote or local user may be able to cause denial of service conditions.The specific impact depends on the applications using PHP.

CVE-2007-0908.title: PHP Buffer Overflows and Format String Bugs Permit Code Execution and Denial of Service
CVE-2007-0908.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in PHP. A remote or local user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system or cause denial of service conditions.Several buffer overflows exist in some PHP functions [CVE-2007-0906]. The PHP session extension, the str_replace() function, and the imap_mail_compose() functions are affected. A remote user may be able to submit specially crafted values to a program that uses the affected function to trigger an overflow and execute arbitrary code.A buffer underflow in the sapi_header_op() function may let users cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2007-0907].The wddx extension can be exploited using certain WDDX input packets to view random portions of heap memory [CVE-2007-0908].A remote user under control of a database table accessed via the odbc_result_all() function can supply specially crafted data to trigger a format string flaw and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2007-0909].Unspecified vulnerabilities may allow a user to overwrite certain super-global variables [CVE-2007-0910].A user can supply specially crafted data to the zend_hash_init() function to cause the function to enter an infinite loop and consume excessive CPU resources until a timeout is reached [CVE-2007-0988].
CVE-2007-0908.extra: A remote or local user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote or local user may be able to cause denial of service conditions.The specific impact depends on the applications using PHP.

CVE-2007-0918.title: Cisco IOS IPS Feature Set Lets Remote Users Deny Service or Evade Intrusion Detection
CVE-2007-0918.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the Intrusion Prevention System (IPS) feature set. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can evade intrusion detection.A remote user can send specially crafted fragmented IP packets to evade signature detection. The vulnerability resides in signatures that use regular expressions.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsg15598 to this vulnerability.The following versions are affected by this packet evasion vulnerability (when the IPS feature set is enabled): * 12.3T, except versions 12.3(2)T, 12.3(4)T, and 12.3(7)T * 12.4 * 12.4T * 12.4XEA remote user can exploit a flaw in the ATOMIC.TCP signature engine to cause the target device to crash. Signature 3123.0 (Netbus Pro Traffic) is one of the affected signatures.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsa53334 to this vulnerability.The following versions are affected by this denial of service vulnerability (when the IPS feature set is enabled): * 12.3T, except versions 12.3(2)T, 12.3(4)T, and 12.3(7)T * 12.3XQ, 12.3XR, 12.3XS, 12.3XW, 12.3XX, 12.3XY * 12.3YA, 12.3YD, 12.3YG, 12.3YH, 12.3YI, 12.3YJ, 12.3YK, 12.3YM, 12.3YQ, 12.3YS, 12.3YT, 12.3YX, 12.3YZ * 12.4 * 12.4MR * 12.4T * 12.4XA, 12.4XBA customer reported the ATOMIC.TCP regular expression vulnerability to Cisco. Cisco discovered the packet evasion vulnerability.
CVE-2007-0918.extra: A remote user can cause the target device to crash.A remote user can evade signature detection.

CVE-2007-0947.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Bugs Let Remote Users Modify Files or Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-0947.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger one of these flaws and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted call to the 'chtskdic.dll' COM object can cause remote code execution [CVE-2007-0942]. The CLSID of the affected object is: BE4191FB-59EF-4825-AEFC-109727951E42A specially crafted call to the CTableCol::OnPropertyChange() method can cause remote code execution [CVE-2007-0944]. The vendor was notified on October 3, 2006.A certain property method can be exploited to cause remote code execution [CVE-2007-0945].Certain HTML objects can be exploited to cause remote code execution [CVE-2007-0946, CVE-2007-0947].The 'mdsauth.dll' component of Microsoft Windows Media Server can be exploited to overwrite arbitrary files [CVE-2007-2221].Microsoft credits TippingPoint and the Zero Day Initiative, JJ Reyes of Secunia Research, and cocoruder of Fortinet Security Research with reporting some of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-0947.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-0957.title: Kerberos kadmin/KDC Stack Overflow in krb5_klog_syslog() Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-0957.body: A vulnerability was reported in Kerberos in the administration daemon and the KDC. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted data to trigger a stack overflow in the krb5_klog_syslog() function and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service, which typically runs with root privileges. This can compromise the Kerberos key database.The vulnerability resides in the kadm5 library. As a result, third party applications that use the library may be affected.The vendor credits iDefense with reporting this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-0957.extra: A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system, typically with root level privileges.

CVE-2007-0981.title: Mozilla Firefox 'location.hostname' Property Lets Remote Users Bypass Domain Security Restrictions
CVE-2007-0981.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can bypass domain security restrictions.A remote user can create HTML to write a specialy crafted hostname value to the 'location.hostname' DOM property that, when processed by Firefox, will be interpreted differently by different parts of the browser's code. A hostname containing a null character ('\x00'), such as 'evil.com\x00foo.example.com', may be interpreted by the DOM code as part of the 'example.com' domain and interpreted by the DNS resolver code as 'evil.com'.As a result, a remote user can create HTML that can set cookies in an arbitrary domain and modify the 'document.domain' property to bypass the same-origin policy for XMLHttpRequest() access and cross-frame and cross-window access.A demonstration exploit is available at:http://lcamtuf.dione.cc/ffhostname.htmlThe original bug report is available at:https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=370445Michal Zalewski reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-0981.extra: A remote user can bypass domain security restrictions.

CVE-2007-0988.title: PHP Buffer Overflows and Format String Bugs Permit Code Execution and Denial of Service
CVE-2007-0988.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in PHP. A remote or local user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system or cause denial of service conditions.Several buffer overflows exist in some PHP functions [CVE-2007-0906]. The PHP session extension, the str_replace() function, and the imap_mail_compose() functions are affected. A remote user may be able to submit specially crafted values to a program that uses the affected function to trigger an overflow and execute arbitrary code.A buffer underflow in the sapi_header_op() function may let users cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2007-0907].The wddx extension can be exploited using certain WDDX input packets to view random portions of heap memory [CVE-2007-0908].A remote user under control of a database table accessed via the odbc_result_all() function can supply specially crafted data to trigger a format string flaw and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2007-0909].Unspecified vulnerabilities may allow a user to overwrite certain super-global variables [CVE-2007-0910].A user can supply specially crafted data to the zend_hash_init() function to cause the function to enter an infinite loop and consume excessive CPU resources until a timeout is reached [CVE-2007-0988].
CVE-2007-0988.extra: A remote or local user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote or local user may be able to cause denial of service conditions.The specific impact depends on the applications using PHP.

CVE-2007-0994.title: Mozilla Firefox JavaScript URI in IMG SRC Attribute Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-0994.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create HTML that sets the src attribute of an IMG tag to a specially crafted javascript: URI that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.This vulnerability was introduced in 1.5.0.9 and 2.0.0.1.moz_bug_r_a4 reported this vulnerability.The browser allows javascript: URIs in IMG tags to be executed even if JavaScript execution is disabled in the global preferences.moz_bug_r_a4 and Anbo Motohiko independently reported this vulnerability.Thunderbird is not affected.
CVE-2007-0994.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-0995.title: Mozilla Firefox Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Local File Access
CVE-2007-0995.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can create specially crafted URLs or HTML that, when loaded by a target user, may cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.The browser does not properly process invalid trailing characters in HTML tag attributes. This may foil web sites content filters that attempt to remove certain attributes such as event handlers.The browser assumes that child frames should inherit the character set of the parent window rather than the default setting used for top-level pages. Sites that accept user content but do not specify the character set or encoding to be used may be able to conduct cross-site scripting attacks.In addition, blocked popups can be used to conduct cross-site scripting attacks or access local files in certain cases.Stefan Esser, shutdown, Michal Zalewski, and others reported these vulnerabilities.http://www.hardened-php.net/advisory_032007.142.html
CVE-2007-0995.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with certain sites, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user may be able to access local files.

CVE-2007-0998.title: Xen QEMU Monitor Mode Lets Local Users Read Arbitrary Files
CVE-2007-0998.body: A vulnerability was reported in Xen. A local user can view files on the target system.The monitor feature in the VNC server code in QEMU allows a local user to map arbitrary files to the CDROM device and then view the mapped files with root privileges. Systems with QEMU monitor mode enabled are affected.
CVE-2007-0998.extra: A local user can view arbitrary files on the target system.

CVE-2007-1036.title: JBoss Default Configuration Lets Remote Users Gain Administrative Access
CVE-2007-1036.body: A vulnerability was reported in JBoss. A remote user can access the administrative interface in default configurations.By default, JBoss servers are configured to permit remote users to access the administrative interface.Ben Dexter reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1036.extra: A remote user can gain administrative access.

CVE-2007-1062.title: Cisco Unified IP Conference Station Credential Caching Bug Grants Administrative Access to Remote Users
CVE-2007-1062.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified IP Conference Station. A remote user can gain administrative access on the target device.The device does not properly maintain the state of administrator login sessions and caches administrative credentials. A remote user can load a management URL within a certain period of time after a valid administrator has logged out to access the administrator HTTP interface without logging in.If the HTTP interface has never been accessed by a valid, authenticated administrator, then the system is not vulnerable.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsg26788 to this vulnerability.Cisco credits Christian Reichert, Christian Blum, and Jens Link of Intact Integrated Services with reporting this vulnerabililty.
CVE-2007-1062.extra: A remote user can gain administrative access to the target device.

CVE-2007-1083.title: VeriSign Managed PKI Stack Overflow in ConfigChk ActiveX Control Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1083.body: A vulnerability was reported in VeriSign Managed PKI. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow in the VerCompare() method of the ConfigChk ActiveX control (VSCnfChk.dll) and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Version 2.0.0.2 of 'VSCnfChk.dll' is affected and prior versions may also be affected.The CLSID of this control is 08F04139-8DFC-11D2-80E9-006008B066EE.David D. Rude II of iDefense discovered this vulnerability.The vendor was notified on December 22, 2006.The original advisory is available at:http://labs.idefense.com/intelligence/vulnerabilities/display.php?id=479[Editor's note: iDefense is owned by VeriSign.]
CVE-2007-1083.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-1083.title: VeriSign Go Secure! Stack Overflow in ConfigChk ActiveX Control Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1083.body: A vulnerability was reported in VeriSign Go Secure! A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow in the VerCompare() method of the ConfigChk ActiveX control (VSCnfChk.dll) and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Version 2.0.0.2 of 'VSCnfChk.dll' is affected and prior versions may also be affected.The CLSID of this control is 08F04139-8DFC-11D2-80E9-006008B066EE.David D. Rude II of iDefense discovered this vulnerability.The vendor was notified on December 22, 2006.The original advisory is available at:http://labs.idefense.com/intelligence/vulnerabilities/display.php?id=479[Editor's note: iDefense is owned by VeriSign.]
CVE-2007-1083.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-1083.title: VeriSign Secure Messaging for Microsoft Exchange Stack Overflow in ConfigChk ActiveX Control Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1083.body: A vulnerability was reported in VeriSign Secure Messaging for Microsoft Exchange. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow in the VerCompare() method of the ConfigChk ActiveX control (VSCnfChk.dll) and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Version 2.0.0.2 of 'VSCnfChk.dll' is affected and prior versions may also be affected.The CLSID of this control is 08F04139-8DFC-11D2-80E9-006008B066EE.David D. Rude II of iDefense discovered this vulnerability.The vendor was notified on December 22, 2006.The original advisory is available at:http://labs.idefense.com/intelligence/vulnerabilities/display.php?id=479[Editor's note: iDefense is owned by VeriSign.]
CVE-2007-1083.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-1115.title: Opera IFRAME Character Encoding Inheritence Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-1115.body: A vulnerability was reported in Opera. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A specially crafted page that uses the UTF-7 character encoding can include a different site within an iframe, where the different site may inherit the UTF-7 encoding. A remote user can exploit this by creating specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code may be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the target site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor credits Stefan Esser with reporting this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1115.extra: A remote user may be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with certain sites, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-1201.title: Microsoft Office Web Components DataSource Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1201.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Office. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a flaw in the parsing of DataSource values and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CLSIDs of the affected COM object are: 0002E533-0000-0000-C000-000000000046, 0002E530-0000-0000-C000-000000000046Visual Studio .NET 2002 and 2003 are affected.Microsoft BizTalk Server 2000 and 2002 are affected.Microsoft Commerce Server 2000 is affected.Internet Security and Acceleration Server 2000 is affected.Yuval Ben-Itzhak of Finjan reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1201.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-1202.title: Microsoft Word Array and RTF Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1202.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Word. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Word document that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted array or rich text properties can trigger code execution.Microsoft Works Suite 2004, 2005, and 2006 are also affected.Microsoft Word 2007 is not affected.Microsoft credits iDefense Labs with reporting the RTF parsing vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1202.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-1204.title: Windows XP Universal Plug and Play Lets Remote Users on the Local Subnet Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1204.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows Universal Plug and Play (UPnP). A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user on the local subnetwork can send a specially crafted HTTP request to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.Windows 2000, 2003, and Vista are not affected.Microsoft credits Greg MacManus of iDefense Labs with reporting this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1204.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-1206.title: Windows Kernel Memory Mapping Permission Error Lets Local Users Gain System Privileges
CVE-2007-1206.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows Kernel. A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.The Windows Kernel does not properly set permissions when mapping a memory segment. As a result, a local user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system with system privileges.Microsoft credits eEye with reporting this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1206.extra: A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-1209.title: Windows Vista Client-Server Run-time Subsystem Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-1209.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Windows Vista Client-Server Run-time Subsystem. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.The Client-Server Run-time Subsystem does not properly manage system resources. A local user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system with elevated privileges.Microsoft credits eEye with reporting this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1209.extra: A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-1211.title: Windows Kernel WMF Image Processing Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-1211.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Windows Kernel. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create a specially crafted Windows Metafile (WMF) image that, when loaded by the target user, will cause the target user's system to crash and potentially restart.The vendor credits iDefense with reporting this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1211.extra: A remote user can cause the target user's system to crash and potentially restart.

CVE-2007-1214.title: Microsoft Excel Specially Crafted BIFF Records, Set Font Values, and Filter Records Permit Remote Code Execution
CVE-2007-1214.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Excel. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Specially crafted BIFF records, set font values, or filter records can be used to trigger the flaw.Microsoft credits Manuel Santamarina Suarez, working with TippingPoint and the Zero Day Initiative, with reporting the Excel BIFF Record vulnerability and Greg MacManus of iDefense Labs for reporting the Excel Filter Record vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1214.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-1217.title: Linux Kernel libcapi Buffer Overflow Lets Local Users Deny Service and May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-1217.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Linux Kernel. A local user can cause denial of service conditions. A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can trigger a buffer overflow in the libcapi bufprint() function in 'capiutil.c' to cause a system crash or potentially execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges.
CVE-2007-1217.extra: A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can cause a system crash.

CVE-2007-1218.title: Tcpdump Off-by-One Heap Overflow Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-1218.body: A vulnerability was reported in tcpdump. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted 802.11 frame to trigger an off-by-one heap overflow in the function parse_elements() function in 'print-802_11.c' and cause the process to crash.Moritz Jodeit reported this vulnerability.[Editor's note: The report did not indicate whether code execution is possible or not. Also, CVE indicates that the overflow may be stack-based.]
CVE-2007-1218.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-1227.title: McAfee Virex 'VShieldExclude.txt' File Symlink Flaw Lets Local Users Obtain Root Privileges
CVE-2007-1227.body: A vulnerability was reported in McAfee Virex. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.A local user can specify files that should be excluded for scanning by modifying a configuration file within the '/Library/Application Support' directory. A local user can modify the file to cause the scanner to fail to detect viruses on the local system.A local user can also delete the '/Library/Application Support/Virex/VShieldExclude.txt' file and then create a symbolic link (symlink) from a critical file on the system to the '/Library/Application Support/Virex/VShieldExclude.txt' file. Then, when the system next boots, the VShieldCheck process will write to the symlinked file with root privileges. A local user can exploit this to obtain root privileges on the target system.Kevin Finisterre of Netragard Research discovered this vulnerability.The vendor was notified on November 6, 2006.The original advisory is available at:http://www.netragard.com/html/recent_research.html
CVE-2007-1227.extra: A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-1228.title: IBM DB2 Local Fenced Processes Can Access Restricted Directories
CVE-2007-1228.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM DB2. A local user can access restricted directories on the target system.A local fenced userid can access directories on the target system that the userid should not be able to access.
CVE-2007-1228.extra: A local fenced user can access restricted directories on the target system.

CVE-2007-1253.title: Blender 'kmz_ImportWithMesh.py' Script Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Python Commands
CVE-2007-1253.body: A vulnerability was reported in Blender. A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.The 'kmz_ImportWithMesh.py' script makes an unsafe eval() function call. A remote user can create a specially crafted '*.kml' or '*.kmz' file that, when imported by the target user, will execute arbitrary Python commands on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor was notified on February 19, 2007.Stefan Cornelius of Secunia Research discovered this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://secunia.com/secunia_research/2007-39/advisory/
CVE-2007-1253.extra: A remote user can cause arbitrary Python commands to be executed on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-1257.title: Cisco Catalyst 6000 and 6500 and Cisco 7600 Network Analysis Module SNMP Spoofing Lets Remote Users Gain Access
CVE-2007-1257.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Catalyst 6000 and 6500 series and the Cisco 7600 series when a Network Analysis Module is installed. A remote user can gain full control of the target device.A remote user can spoof SNMP packets between the Network Analysis Module (NAM) and the Catalyst device to gain complete control of the target device.Catalyst 6000 and 6500 series and Cisco 7600 series systems are affected if they have a NAM installed. Both IOS-based and CatOS-based systems are affected.Systems that do not have a NAM are not affected. NAMs for Cisco Branch Routers (NM-NAM) are not affected.This vulnerability was introduced in CatOS versions 7.6(15) and 8.5(1).Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCsd75273, CSCse52951, and CSCse39848 to this vulnerabilitly.Cisco discovered this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1257.extra: A remote user can gain full control of the target device.

CVE-2007-1262.title: SquirrelMail Input Validation Holes in HTML Filter Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-1262.body: A vulnerability was reported in SquirrelMail. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The HTML filter does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied e-mail before displaying the e-mail. A remote user can send a specially crafted e-mail that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the SquirrelMail software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Certain 'data:' URLs, character sets, and image tags can be used to exploit these vulnerabilities.The vendor credits Mikhail Markin, Tomas Kuliavas, and Michael Jordon with reporting these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-1262.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the SquirrelMail software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-1270.title: VMware ESX Server Double Free Error May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1270.body: A vulnerability was reported in VMware ESX Server. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a double free error and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-1270]. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.A local user can trigger a buffer overflow to potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system or cause the target application to crash [CVE-2007-1271].These vulnerabilities were discovered by the vendor during an internal security audit.
CVE-2007-1270.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-1276.title: Webmin Input Validation Hole in 'chooser.cgi' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-1276.body: A vulnerability was reported in Webmin. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The 'chooser.cgi' script does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in certain filenames before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted filename that will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Webmin software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2007-1276.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Webmin software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-1285.title: PHP Nested Array Processing Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-1285.body: A vulnerability was reported in PHP. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can submit a specially crafted variable with a deeply nested array to cause deep recursion in the variable destruction routines in the Zend Engine. The PHP application may crash.The original advisory is available at:http://www.php-security.org/MOPB/MOPB-03-2007.htmlStefan Esser discovered this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1285.extra: A remote user can cause the target application to crash.

CVE-2007-1309.title: Novell Access Manager SSL VPN 'policy.txt' File Can By Modified By Remote Authenticated Users to Bypass VPN Network Access Controls
CVE-2007-1309.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell Access Manager. A remote authenticated user can bypass VPN network access controls.A remote authenticated user can change the permissions of the 'policy.txt' file to read-only while a VPN session is active, disconnect, and then edit the file. When the user reconnects and authenticates, the user can bypass any network access controls invoked by the VPN session.
CVE-2007-1309.extra: A remote authenticated user can bypass VPN network access controls.

CVE-2007-1313.title: NETxEIB OPC Server Lets Remote Users Modify Memory to Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1313.body: A vulnerability was reported in the NETxEIB OPC Server. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to access arbitrary memory and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.US-CERT indicates that neutralbit reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1313.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-1347.title: Microsoft Windows Explorer OLE Parsing Bug Lets Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-1347.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows Explorer. A user can cause denial of service conditions.A user can create a specially crafted Microsoft Word document that, when processed by Windows Explorer, will trigger a memory corruption error in 'Ole32.dll' and cause Explorer to crash. Moving the cursor over the file or viewing the file properties can trigger the crash.The original advisory is available at:http://www.milw0rm.com/exploits/3419A demonstration exploit is available at:http://www.milw0rm.com/sploits/03062007-Explorer_Crasher.tarMarsu (MarsupilamiPowa at hotmail.fr) reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1347.extra: A user can cause the target user's Windows Explorer to crash.

CVE-2007-1349.title: mod_perl Input Validation Flaw in PerlRun Module Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-1349.body: A vulnerability was reported in mod_perl. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.The Apache::PerlRun module does not properly escape user-supplied data in the PATH_INFO variable before using the data in evaluating a regular expression. A remote user can request a specially crafted URL to potentially cause mod_perl to consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.Randal L. Schwartz reported this vulnerability in March 2007.The original advisory is available at:http://www.gossamer-threads.com/lists/modperl/modperl/92739
CVE-2007-1349.extra: A remote user can cause excessive resource consumption on the target system.

CVE-2007-1351.title: X11 Overflows Let Local Users Gain Root Privileges
CVE-2007-1351.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in X. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can trigger an integer overflow in the processing of BDF fonts to execute arbitrary code on the target system with root privileges [CVE-2007-1351].A local user can trigger an integer overflow in 'fonts.dir' to execute arbitrary code on the target system with root privileges [CVE-2007-1352].A local user can trigger an integer overflow in the XC-MISC extension to execute arbitrary code on the target system with root privileges [CVE-2007-1003].Sean Larsson of iDefense Labs discovered the XC-MISC extension vulnerability. iDefense reported the other two vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-1351.extra: A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-1358.title: Apache Tomcat Input Validation Hole in Processing Accept-Language Header Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-1358.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apache Tomcat. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The server may not not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'Accept-Language' header before displaying the input. A remote user can create cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser in certain cases. The code will originate from the site running the Tomcat software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.This can be exploited via "older" versions of the Flash player, where Flash files can make requests with arbitrary header values.Masato Anzai and Toshiharu Sugiyama reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1358.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Tomcat software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-1362.title: Mozilla Seamonkey Lets Remote Users Set Cookie Values to Deny Service
CVE-2007-1362.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Seamonkey. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will set an exceptionally long cookie value, causing the target user's browser to consume excessive memory and disk resources. A specially crafted cookie path and name value may allow a remote user to set a secure cookie from a non-secure site.Nicolas Derouet reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1362.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-1362.title: Mozilla Firefox Lets Remote Users Set Cookie Values to Deny Service
CVE-2007-1362.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will set an exceptionally long cookie value, causing the target user's browser to consume excessive memory and disk resources. A specially crafted cookie path and name value may allow a remote user to set a secure cookie from a non-secure site.Nicolas Derouet reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1362.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-1441.title: Blackberry OS WML Link Processing Lets Remote Users Temporarily Deny Service
CVE-2007-1441.body: A vulnerability was reported in Blackberry OS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create a WML page that contains a specially crafted string value within a link. When the page is loaded, the browser will enter a temporary denial of service state, causing the device to become temporarily unavailable.The vulnerability resides in the 4thPass browser.The BlackBerry Pearl 8100 model is affected.Michael Kemp discovered this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1441.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-1466.title: libwpd Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1466.body: A vulnerability was reported in libwpd. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted WordPerfect document that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer overflow or heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user or the application using libwpd.The WP6GeneralTextPacket::_readContents() function, WP3TablesGroup::_readContents() function, and WP5DefinitionGroup_DefineTablesSubGroup::WP5DefinitionGroup_DefineTablesSubGroup() functions are affected.The vendor was notified on January 11, 2007.iDefense reported the WP6GeneralTextPacket vulnerability.and Sean Larsson from iDefense Labs discovered the other vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-1466.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-1468.title: Rational ClearQuest Input Validation Bugs in Attachments and in the Summary Page Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-1468.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Rational ClearQuest. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can upload a specially crafted file as an attachment to a defect submission. When loaded by a target user, it will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Rational ClearQuest Web software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The summary page is also affected.James Clarke discovered this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1468.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Rational ClearQuest Web software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-1476.title: Symantec Anti Virus SYMTDI.SYS IOCTL Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-1476.body: A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Anti Virus Corporate Edition. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can send a specially IRP to cause an IOCTL handler function to overwrite memory and cause the driver (and system) to crash.Norton AntiSpam, Norton AntiVirus, Norton Internet Security, Norton Personal Firewall, and Norton System Works are also affected.The vendor was notified on March 15, 2007.Matousec Transparent security Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1476.extra: A local user can cause the target system to crash.

CVE-2007-1499.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1499.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Specially crafted COM objects, CSS tags, code to install multiple language packs, code to access an uninitialized or deleted object, and code to launch a Speech Control ActiveX control can trigger remote code execution.A remote user can also create a URL that will modify the "Navigation to the webpage was canceled" page to spoof content in a browser window.Microsoft credits iDefense, Tom Cross of ISS, Sam Thomas, TippingPoint, Will Dorman of CERT/CC, and cocoruder of Fortinet Security Research with reporting these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-1499.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system or spoof content within the browser.

CVE-2007-1536.title: file Heap Overflow in file_printf() May Let Local Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1536.body: A vulnerability was reported in file. A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can trigger a heap overflow in the file_printf() function to cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system with the privileges of the user running the file application.The vendor credits Jean-Sebastien Guay-Leroux with discovering this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1536.extra: A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-1562.title: Mozilla Firefox FTP PASV Implementation Permits Port Scanning
CVE-2007-1562.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause Firefox to conduct portscans.In response to an FTP PASV command from the target user's Firefox client, the remote connected FTP server can return a port number and different IP address, causing the Firefox client to connect to the specified IP address and port number.A remote user can create a specially crafted web page that, when loaded by the target user, will cause the target user's browser to connect to a malicious FTP server and then scan the ports specified by the malicious FTP server, including scanning systems that are on the target user's internal network and scanning ports on the Firefox banned port list.SeaMonkey is also affected.Mark at bindshell.net reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://bindshell.net/papers/ftppasv
CVE-2007-1562.extra: A remote user can cause Firefox to conduct portscans.

CVE-2007-1563.title: Opera FTP PASV Implementation Permits Port Scanning
CVE-2007-1563.body: A vulnerability was reported in Opera. A remote user can cause Opera to conduct portscans.In response to an FTP PASV command from the target user's Opera client, the remote connected FTP server can return a port number and different IP address, causing the Opera client to connect to the specified IP address and port number.A remote user can create a specially crafted web page that, when loaded by the target user, will cause the target user's browser to connect to a malicious FTP server and then scan the ports specified by the malicious FTP server, including scanning systems that are on the target user's internal network.Mark at bindshell.net reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://bindshell.net/papers/ftppasv
CVE-2007-1563.extra: A remote user can cause Opera to conduct portscans.

CVE-2007-1564.title: KDE Konqueror FTP PASV Implementation Permits Port Scanning
CVE-2007-1564.body: A vulnerability was reported in KDE Konqueror. A remote user can cause Konqueror to conduct portscans.In response to an FTP PASV command from the target user's Konqueror client, the remote connected FTP server can return a port number and different IP address, causing the Konqueror client to connect to the specified IP address and port number.A remote user can create a specially crafted web page that, when loaded by the target user, will cause the target user's browser to connect to a malicious FTP server and then scan the ports specified by the malicious FTP server, including scanning systems that are on the target user's internal network.Mark at bindshell.net reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://bindshell.net/papers/ftppasv
CVE-2007-1564.extra: A remote user can cause Konqueror to conduct portscans.

CVE-2007-1593.title: VERITAS Storage Foundation Veritas Volume Replicator Administration Service Can Be Crashed By Remote Users
CVE-2007-1593.body: A vulnerability was reported in VERITAS Storage Foundation. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted packets to TCP port 8199 of the Veritas Volume Replicator administration service to consume excessive CPU resources on the target system or cause the target service to crash.The administration service will restart automatically.The vendor was notified on November 11, 2006.CIRT.DK reported this vulnerability to iDefense.
CVE-2007-1593.extra: A remote user can cause the Veritas Volume Replicator administration service to crash.

CVE-2007-1659.title: PCRE Regex Processing Bugs May Let Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1659.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in PCRE. A local or remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote or local user may be able to supply a specially crafted regular expression to trigger a memory in PCRE.The impact depends on the application that uses the library. Applications that parse untrusted regular expressions may be vulnerable.Unmatched \Q\E sequences with orphan \E codes can cause code execution [CVE-2007-1659].Certain character classes can trigger code execution [CVE-2007-1660].Tavis Ormandy reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-1659.extra: A local or remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-1660.title: PCRE Regex Processing Bugs May Let Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1660.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in PCRE. A local or remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote or local user may be able to supply a specially crafted regular expression to trigger a memory in PCRE.The impact depends on the application that uses the library. Applications that parse untrusted regular expressions may be vulnerable.Unmatched \Q\E sequences with orphan \E codes can cause code execution [CVE-2007-1659].Certain character classes can trigger code execution [CVE-2007-1660].Tavis Ormandy reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-1660.extra: A local or remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-1666.title: IDA Pro Authentication Bypass Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1666.body: A vulnerability was reported in IDA Pro. A remote user can bypass the password authentication feature and execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can bypass the password authentication feature due to a flaw in the processor_request() function. This allows the remote user to execute arbitrary code on the target system with the privileges of the user running the debugger on the target system.The vendor was notified on March 20, 2007.This vulnerability was reported to iDefense by enhalos.
CVE-2007-1666.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-1667.title: X11 libx11 Integer Overflow Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-1667.body: A vulnerability was reported in libx11. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create a specially crafted image that, when processed by the target application, will trigger an integer overflow in XGetPixel() and cause the target application to crash.This was reported in a Debian bug report.
CVE-2007-1667.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-1723.title: Secure Computing IronMail Multiple Input Validation Holes Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-1723.body: A vulnerability was reported in Secure Computing IronMail. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.Several scripts on the administration console do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted HTTP request that, when loaded or submitted by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the IronMail device and will run in the security context of that device. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.Multiple scripts and parameters are affected.The vendor was notified on February 27, 2007.Javier Olascoaga reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.514.es/2007/03/siaadv07004_multiples_vulnerab.html
CVE-2007-1723.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the IronMail device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-1747.title: Microsoft Office Drawing Object Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1747.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Office. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a Microsoft Office file with a specially crafted drawing object that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Office 2000, 2003, XP, and 2007 are affected (although some components of those versions of the Office suite are not affected). Office 2004 for Mac is also affected.
CVE-2007-1747.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-1748.title: Microsoft Windows DNS Service RPC Stack Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1748.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Windows DNS service RPC interface. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted RPC packet to the RPC interface of the DNS server to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target DNS service, which runs with Local System privileges by default.A remote authenticated user can also exploit this vulnerability via TCP/UDP ports 139 and 445.The name resolution function running on port 53 is not affected.The vulnerable code resides on Windows server systems, not client systems.Windows 2000 Professional SP4, Windows XP SP2, and Windows Vista are not affected.This vulnerability was originally reported as being actively exploited in limited situations. On April 17, 2006 (UTC), Microsoft reported seeing a new attack that "does not appear widespread."Some demonstration exploit code is available at:http://www.milw0rm.com/exploits/3737http://www.milw0rm.com/exploits/3740http://www.milw0rm.com/exploits/3746Carnegie Mellon reported this vulnerability to Microsoft.
CVE-2007-1748.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-1751.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1751.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Specially crafted COM objects, CSS tags, code to install multiple language packs, code to access an uninitialized or deleted object, and code to launch a Speech Control ActiveX control can trigger remote code execution.A remote user can also create a URL that will modify the "Navigation to the webpage was canceled" page to spoof content in a browser window.Microsoft credits iDefense, Tom Cross of ISS, Sam Thomas, TippingPoint, Will Dorman of CERT/CC, and cocoruder of Fortinet Security Research with reporting these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-1751.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system or spoof content within the browser.

CVE-2007-1754.title: Microsoft Office Publisher Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1754.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Office Publisher. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.Publisher does not properly clear out memory resources when writing application data from disk to memory. A remote user can create a specially crafted Publisher page (.pub page) that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Microsoft credits eEye Digital Security with reporting this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1754.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-1793.title: Norton Personal Firewall 'SPBBCDrv.sys' Driver Lets Local Users Deny Service and Potentially Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-1793.body: A vulnerability was reported in Norton Personal Firewall. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.The firewall software hooks several System Service Descriptor Table (SSDT) functions but does not properly validate user-mode input. Calls to the NtCreateMutant and NtOpenEvent functions are affected. A local user can supply specially crafted values to trigger an error in the 'SPBBCDrv.sys' driver and cause the target system to crash.A local user may also be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel level privileges. However, the report did not confirm code execution.Matousec reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.matousec.com/info/advisories/Norton-Multiple-insufficient-argument-validation-of-hooked-SSDT-functions.php
CVE-2007-1793.extra: A local user can cause target system to crash.A local user may be able to obtain kernel level privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-1793.title: Norton Internet Security 'SPBBCDrv.sys' Driver Lets Local Users Deny Service and Potentially Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-1793.body: A vulnerability was reported in Norton Internet Security. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.The firewall software hooks several System Service Descriptor Table (SSDT) functions but does not properly validate user-mode input. Calls to the NtCreateMutant and NtOpenEvent functions are affected. A local user can supply specially crafted values to trigger an error in the 'SPBBCDrv.sys' driver and cause the target system to crash.A local user may also be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel level privileges. However, the report did not confirm code execution.Matousec reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.matousec.com/info/advisories/Norton-Multiple-insufficient-argument-validation-of-hooked-SSDT-functions.php
CVE-2007-1793.extra: A local user can cause target system to crash.A local user may be able to obtain kernel level privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-1793.title: Symantec Client Security Input Validation Flaw in SPBBCDRV.SYS Device Driver Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-1793.body: A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Client Security. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can send specially crafted parameter values to the NtCreateMutant and NtOpenEvent functions of the 'SPBBCDRV.SYS' device driver to cause the target system to crash.Matousec-Transparent reported this vulnerability.[Editor's note: This vulnerability was originally reported in April 2007 as affecting Norton Personal Firewall and Norton Internet Security. See Alert ID 1017837 and 1017838.]
CVE-2007-1793.extra: A local user can cause the target system to crash.

CVE-2007-1793.title: Symantec AntiVirus Corporate Edition Input Validation Flaw in SPBBCDRV.SYS Device Driver Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-1793.body: A vulnerability was reported in Symantec AntiVirus Corporate Edition. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can send specially crafted parameter values to the NtCreateMutant and NtOpenEvent functions of the 'SPBBCDRV.SYS' device driver to cause the target system to crash.Matousec-Transparent reported this vulnerability.[Editor's note: This vulnerability was originally reported in April 2007 as affecting Norton Personal Firewall and Norton Internet Security. See Alert ID 1017837 and 1017838.]
CVE-2007-1793.extra: A local user can cause the target system to crash.

CVE-2007-1793.title: Norton AntiSpam Input Validation Flaw in SPBBCDRV.SYS Device Driver Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-1793.body: A vulnerability was reported in Norton AntiSpam. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can send specially crafted parameter values to the NtCreateMutant and NtOpenEvent functions of the 'SPBBCDRV.SYS' device driver to cause the target system to crash.Matousec-Transparent reported this vulnerability.[Editor's note: This vulnerability was originally reported in April 2007 as affecting Norton Personal Firewall and Norton Internet Security. See Alert ID 1017837 and 1017838.]
CVE-2007-1793.extra: A local user can cause the target system to crash.

CVE-2007-1793.title: Norton System Works Input Validation Flaw in SPBBCDRV.SYS Device Driver Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-1793.body: A vulnerability was reported in Norton System Works. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can send specially crafted parameter values to the NtCreateMutant and NtOpenEvent functions of the 'SPBBCDRV.SYS' device driver to cause the target system to crash.Matousec-Transparent reported this vulnerability.[Editor's note: This vulnerability was originally reported in April 2007 as affecting Norton Personal Firewall and Norton Internet Security. See Alert ID 1017837 and 1017838.]
CVE-2007-1793.extra: A local user can cause the target system to crash.

CVE-2007-1797.title: ImageMagick DCM and XCM Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1797.body: A vulnerability was reported in ImageMagick. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user or target application, will trigger an integer overflow or heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user or target application that uses the ImageMagick library.A specially crafted Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DCM) file can trigger a heap overflow in the ReadDCMImage() function.A specially crafted X Windows Dump (XWD) file can trigger an integer overflow in the the ReadXWDImage() function. The 'colors' and 'comment' parameters are affected.The vendor was notified on February 28, 2007.iDefense reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1797.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user or application, will execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-1819.title: HP Mercury Quality Center 'Spider90.ocx' ActiveX Control Buffer overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1819.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP Mercury Quality Center. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow in the 'Spider90.ocx' ActiveX control used by HP Mercury Quality Center and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted 'ProgColor' parameter value can trigger the overflow.The vulnerable control has the following CLSID: 98C53984-8BF8-4D11-9B1C-C324FCA9CADEThe vendor was notified on February 16, 2007.Eric Detoisien and and Titon & Ri0t of Bastard Labs discovered this vulnerability. iDefense reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1819.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-1859.title: XScreenSaver LDAP Authentication Error Lets Physically Local Users Bypass the Password Feature
CVE-2007-1859.body: A vulnerability was reported in XScreenSaver. A physically local user can bypass the password authentication feature.When the target system uses a remote LDAP directory service for authentication and the LDAP service is unavailable for a long period of time, a physically local user can unlock the screen using an arbitrary password.The vulnerability is due to a flaw in the way XScreenSaver parses a getpwuid(getuid()) function call.Alex Yamauchi reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1859.extra: A physically local user can bypass the screen saver password feature.

CVE-2007-1860.title: Tomcat JK Connector May Let Remote Users Access Restricted Resources
CVE-2007-1860.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apache Tomcat JK Connector. A remote user may be able to access protected resources.A remote user can supply a specially crafted URL to access a different (and potentially restricted) resource on Tomcat.
CVE-2007-1860.extra: A remote user may be able to access restricted resources.

CVE-2007-1864.title: PHP libxmlrpc Buffer Overflow May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1864.body: A vulnerability was reported in PHP. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a heap overflow in the PHP xmlrpc extension and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.Stanislav Malyshev reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1864.extra: A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-1922.title: Winamp MATLAB/ScreamTracker/Impulse Tracker File Memory Corruption Errors Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1922.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Winamp. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted MATLAB sound file (.mat file) that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in 'LIBSNDFILE.DLL' and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted ScreamTracker 3 music file (.s3m file) can trigger a memory corruption error in 'IN_MOD.DLL', permitting remote code execution.A specially crafted Impulse Tracker (.IT file) can trigger a memory corruption error in 'IN_MOD.DLL', permitting remote code execution.Piotr Bania discovered these vulnerabilities.The original advisories are available at:http://www.piotrbania.com/all/adv/nullsoft-winamp-libsndfile-adv.txthttp://www.piotrbania.com/all/adv/nullsoft-winamp-s3m_module-in_mod-adv.txthttp://www.piotrbania.com/all/adv/nullsoft-winamp-it_module-in_mod-adv.txt
CVE-2007-1922.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-1938.title: Ichitaro Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-1938.body: A vulnerability was reported in Ichitaro. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Ichitaro document that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.This vulnerability is being actively exploited.
CVE-2007-1938.extra: A remote user can create a document that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-1993.title: HP-UX Portable File System Lets Remote Users Gain Root Access
CVE-2007-1993.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP-UX when running Portable File System. A remote user can gain elevated privileges.A remote user can send two specially crafted packets via UDP to trigger a buffer overflow in 'pfs_mountd.rpc' and execute arbitrary code with root privileges.The vendor was notified on October 25, 2004.HP credits iDefense Labs with reporting this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1993.extra: A remote user can gain root privileges on the target system.
