CVE-2007-1995.title: Quagga bgpd Server Can Be Crashed By Remote Users
CVE-2007-1995.body: A vulnerability was reported in Quagga. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote peer user can send an UPDATE message with a specially crafted Multi-Protocol reachable/unreachable NLRI attribute to cause the target bgpd service to crash.
CVE-2007-1995.extra: A remote user can cause the bgpd service to crash.

CVE-2007-2022.title: Adobe Flash Player on Opera Has a Vulnerability with Unspecified Impact
CVE-2007-2022.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Adobe Flash Player when used with Opera on Linux, Solaris, or FreeBSD. The impact was not specified.Adobe has assigned a severity rating of "important" to this vulnerability.The vendor credits Mark Hills with reporting this vulnerability.The related Opera advisory is available at:http://www.opera.com/support/search/view/858/

CVE-2007-2037.title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Lets Remote Users Modify the Configuration and Deny Service
CVE-2007-2037.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in the Cisco Wireless LAN Controller (WLC). A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can modify the configuration. Access control lists may not be properly enforced.The WLC uses common values for the SNMP read-only and read-write community strings. A remote user can user these values to access SNMP services. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCse02384 to this vulnerability.A remote user can send specially crafted Ethernet data to cause the target WLC to crash. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsc90179 to this vulnerability.A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target WLC's network processing unit to lock up. Specially crafted SNAP packets, 802.11 data, and packets with unexpected length values in certain headers can trigger this flaw. The WLC must be restarted to return the network processing unit to normal operations.The 2000 Series WLC, the 2100 Series WLC, and the Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Module are not affected by these network processing unit vulnerabilities.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsg36361, CSCsg15901, and CSCsh10841 to these vulnerabilities.A remote user with physical access to the console port can use a hard-coded password to access the Cisco Aironet 1000 Series and 1500 Series Lightweight Access Points. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsg15192 to this vulnerability.The WLC version 4.0 may not properly load access control lists when rebooted. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCse58195 to this vulnerability.The following products are affected by the above listed vulnerabilities:Wireless LAN Controllers * Cisco 4400 Series Wireless LAN Controllers * Cisco 4100 Series Wireless LAN Controllers * Cisco 2100 Series Wireless LAN Controllers * Cisco 2000 Series Wireless LAN Controllers * Cisco Wireless LAN Controller ModuleWireless Integrated Switches and Routers * Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series Wireless Services Module (WiSM) * Cisco Catalyst 3750 Series Integrated Wireless LAN Controllers * Cisco Wireless LAN Controller ModuleCisco Aironet Access Points * Cisco Aironet 1000 Series * Cisco Aironet 1500 SeriesCisco discovered these vulnerabilities while investigating customer support issues.
CVE-2007-2037.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can access SNMP services to view and modify the configuration.A remote user may be able to bypass access controls.

CVE-2007-2063.title: SSH Tectia Server Insecure File Permissions May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-2063.body: A vulnerability was reported in SSH Tectia Server. A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.The SSH Tectia Server may be run as a started task with an empty umask on some z/OS installations. As a result, some HFS files may be created with world-writable permissions.A local user may be able to exploit this to gain elevated privileges.
CVE-2007-2063.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-2108.title: Oracle Database and Other Products Have Unspecified Vulnerabilities With Unspecified Impact
CVE-2007-2108.body: Numerous vulnerabilities were reported in Oracle Database and other Oracle products. The impact was not specified by the vendor.Oracle released their Critical Patch Update for April 2007, addressing numerous vulnerabilities in Oracle Database, Oracle Secure Enterprise Search, Oracle Application Server, Oracle Collaboration Suite, Oracle E-Business Suite, Oracle Enterprise Manager, Oracle PeopleSoft Enterprise PeopleTools, Oracle PeopleSoft Enterprise Human Capital Management, JD Edwards EnterpriseOne Tools, and JD Edwards OneWorld Tools.The following product versions are affected: * Oracle Database 10g Release 2, versions 10.2.0.2, 10.2.0.3 * Oracle Database 10g Release 1, versions 10.1.0.4, 10.1.0.5 * Oracle9i Database Release 2, versions 9.2.0.7, 9.2.0.8 * Oracle Secure Enterprise Search 10g Release 1, version 10.1.8 * Oracle Application Server 10g Release 3 (10.1.3), versions 10.1.3.0.0, 10.1.3.1.0, 10.1.3.2.0 * Oracle Application Server 10g Release 2 (10.1.2), versions 10.1.2.0.1 - 10.1.2.0.2, 10.1.2.1.0, 10.1.2.2.0 * Oracle Application Server 10g (9.0.4), version 9.0.4.3 * Oracle10g Collaboration Suite Release 1, version 10.1.2 * Oracle E-Business Suite Release 11i, versions 11.5.7 - 11.5.10 CU2 * Oracle E-Business Suite Release 12, version 12.0.0 * Oracle Enterprise Manager 9i Release 2, versions 9.2.0.7, 9.2.0.8 * Oracle Enterprise Manager 9i, version 9.0.1.5 * Oracle PeopleSoft Enterprise PeopleTools versions 8.22, 8.47, 8.48 * Oracle PeopleSoft Enterprise Human Capital Management version 8.9 * JD Edwards EnterpriseOne Tools version 8.96 * JD Edwards OneWorld Tools SP23 * Oracle9i Database Release 1, versions 9.0.1.5, 9.0.1.5 FIPS * Oracle9i Database Release 2, versions 9.2.0.5 * Oracle Database 10g Release 2, version 10.2.0.1Oracle has provided no specifics regarding the nature of these vulnerabilities.Oracle Database products contain 17 vulnerabilities, three of which can be exploited by remote users without authentication. Two vulnerabilities apply to Oracle Database client-only installations (that do not have the Oracle Database installed).The affected Database components include: Advanced Queuing, Advanced Replication, Authentication, Change Data Capture (CDC), Core RDBMS, Oracle Agent, Oracle Instant Client, Oracle Streams, Oracle Text, Oracle Workflow Cartridge, Rules Manager, Expression Filter, Ultra Search, and Upgrade/Downgrade.Oracle Application Server contains seven vulnerabilities, two of which can be exploited by remote users without authentication.Oracle Collaboration Suite contains two vulnerabilities. None can be exploited remotely without authentication.Oracle E-Business Suite contains 11 vulnerabilities, two of which can be exploited by remote users without authentication.Oracle Enterprise Manager contains two vulnerabilities, both of which can be exploited by remote users without authentication.Oracle PeopleSoft Enterprise contains four vulnerabilities (two for PeopleTools, one for PeopleSoft Enterprise Human Capital Management, and one for JD Edwards EnterpriseOne and JD Edwards OneWorld Tools). None can be exploited remotely without authentication.Oracle has provided the following maximum CVSS base scores:* Oracle Database: 7.0* Oracle Application Server: 4.2* Oracle Collaboration Suite: 1.4* Oracle E-Business Suite: 4.2* Oracle Enterprise Manager: 2.3* Oracle PeopleSoft Enterprise: 2.4Oracle credits the following individuals and organizations with reporting these vulnerabilities:Vicente Aguilera Diaz of Internet Security Auditors, S.L.; Gerhard Eschelbeck of Qualys, Inc.; Esteban Martinez Fayo of Application Security, Inc.; Joxean Koret; Alexander Kornbrust of Red Database Security GmbH; David Litchfield and Paul M. Wright of Next Generation Security Software Ltd.; noderat ratty; and TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.
CVE-2007-2108.extra: The impact was not specified by the vendor.

CVE-2007-2138.title: PostgreSQL Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated SQL Privileges
CVE-2007-2138.body: A vulnerability was reported in PostgreSQL. A remote authenticated user can obtain elevated SQL privileges on the target system.A remote authenticated user can modify the search_path settings to gain the SQL privileges of the owner of any SECURITY DEFINER function that the user has privileges to call.
CVE-2007-2138.extra: A remote authenticated user can obtain elevated SQL privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-2217.title: Kodak Image Viewer Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2217.body: A vulnerability was reported in Kodak Image Viewer, as included with some Microsoft operating systems. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted image file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user or application.Applications that uses the Kodak Image Viewer library are affected.Rita Schappler of Global 360 and Cu Fang reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2217.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2222.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2222.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Specially crafted COM objects, CSS tags, code to install multiple language packs, code to access an uninitialized or deleted object, and code to launch a Speech Control ActiveX control can trigger remote code execution.A remote user can also create a URL that will modify the "Navigation to the webpage was canceled" page to spoof content in a browser window.Microsoft credits iDefense, Tom Cross of ISS, Sam Thomas, TippingPoint, Will Dorman of CERT/CC, and cocoruder of Fortinet Security Research with reporting these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-2222.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system or spoof content within the browser.

CVE-2007-2223.title: Microsoft Core XML Services Memory Corruption Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2223.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Core XML Services. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Microsoft Office Compatibility Pack for Word, Excel, and PowerPoint 2007 is affected. Microsoft Expression Web is affected. Microsoft Word Viewer 2003 is affected.The vendor was notified on May 17, 2006.Zero Day Initiative and iDefense separately reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2223.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2224.title: Microsoft OLE Automation Memory Corruption Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2224.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft OLE Automation. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. Visual Basic is affected. Office for Mac is affected.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in the object linking and embedding (OLE) automation protocol implementation and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Office 2004 for Mac is affected.Visual Basic 6 is affected.The vendor was notified on May 17, 2006.Zero Day Initiative and iDefense separately reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2224.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2229.title: Windows Vista Discloses Sensitive Information to Local Users
CVE-2007-2229.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows Vista. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.The system assigns weak permissions to certain local user information data stores. A local user can obtain information from local user information data stores within the registry and local file system. The information includes administrative passwords.Microsoft credits Robbie Sohlman with reporting this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2229.extra: A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information, including administrative passwords.

CVE-2007-2230.title: CleverPath Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
CVE-2007-2230.body: A vulnerability was reported in CleverPath. A remote user can inject SQL commands.The software does not properly validate user-supplied input in the search execute function. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:https://[target]/servlet/portal/search/ execute?CHARSET=UTF-8&showtemplate= false&OFINTEREST='%20and%20'a'<all(select %20table_name%20from%20iicolumns%20where %20table_name>'b')%20or%20'1'='1& showtemplate=falseThe following products are affected:BrightStor Portal 11.1CleverPath Aion 10, 10.1, 10.2CleverPath Portal 4.51, 4.7, 4.71eTrust Security Command Center (eTrust SCC) 1, 8Unicenter Argis Portfolio Asset Management 11Unicenter Database Management Portal 11, 11.1Unicenter Enterprise Job Manager (UEJM) 3, 11Unicenter Management Portal (UMP) 2, 3.1, 11The vendor was notified on January 18, 2007.Irene Abezgauz of Hacktics reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.hacktics.com/AdvCleverPathApr07.html
CVE-2007-2230.extra: A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2007-2244.title: Adobe Photoshop Buffer Overflow in Processing BMP/DIB/RLE Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2244.body: A vulnerability was reported in Adobe Photoshop. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted '.bmp', '.dib', or '.rle' file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.GoLive 9 and GoLive CS2 are also affected.Marsu discovered this vulnerability.The original advisory and exploit is available at:http://milw0rm.com/exploits/3793
CVE-2007-2244.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2244.title: Adobe Illustrator Input Validation Flaws in Processing BMP, DIB, RLE, or PNG Files Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2244.body: A vulnerability was reported in Adobe Illustrator. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted BMP, DIB, RLE, or PNG file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.GoLive 9 and GoLive CS2 are also affected.Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2244.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2246.title: HP-UX Sendmail Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-2246.body: A vulnerability was reported in sendmail on HP-UX. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can cause unspecified denial of service conditions.HP reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www2.itrc.hp.com/service/cki/docDisplay.do?docId=emr_na-c00841370-1[Editor's note: HP has confirmed that this vulnerability is unique to HP-UX.]
CVE-2007-2246.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-2248.title: Phorum Input Validation Holes Permits Cross-Site Scripting and SQL Injection Attacks
CVE-2007-2248.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Phorum. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can inject SQL commands. A remote user can determine the installation path.Several scripts do not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.The censorlist management function in 'admin.php' is affected.The banlist management function in 'admin.php' is affected.The groups management function in 'admin.php' is affected.The 'recipients' parameter in 'pm.php' is affected and can be exploited to retrieve the administrators The 'user_ids' parameter in 'include/controlcenter/users.php' is affected. A remote authenticated user with moderator privileges can gain administrative privileges by submitting a specially crafted POST request.The administrative interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Phorum software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The groups management module and the smiley management module are affected.Some demonstration exploit URLs are provided:http://[target]/phorum.5.1.20/admin.php?module=groups&edit=1&group_id="><script>alert(123);</script>http://[target]/phorum.5.1.20/admin.php?module=modsettings&mod=smileys&edit=1&smiley_id="><script>alert(123);</script>A remote user can invoke the 'admin.php' script to determine the installation path. A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]/phorum.5.1.20/admin.php?module[]=groupsThe vendor was notified on Marcy 25, 2007.Janek Vind "waraxe" discovered these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-2248.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Phorum software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.A remote user can determine the installation path.A remote authenticated moderator can gain administrator privileges.

CVE-2007-2263.title: RealPlayer Buffer Overflows in Processing MP3, RM, SWF, RAM, and PLS Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2263.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in RealPlayer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted MP3, RM, SWF, RAM, or PLS file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.John Heasman of NGS Software, Piotr Bania, and anonymous researchers working with TippingPoint reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-2263.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2264.title: RealPlayer Buffer Overflows in Processing MP3, RM, SWF, RAM, and PLS Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2264.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in RealPlayer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted MP3, RM, SWF, RAM, or PLS file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.John Heasman of NGS Software, Piotr Bania, and anonymous researchers working with TippingPoint reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-2264.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2279.title: Symantec VERITAS Storage Foundation Windows Scheduler Service Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Commands
CVE-2007-2279.body: A vulnerability was reported in VERITAS Storage Foundation. A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.A remote user can connect to the Windows Scheduler Service (VxSchedService.exe) to add arbitrary commands to the Windows registry that will be executed during scheduled runs.3Com's Zero Day Initiative reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2279.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.

CVE-2007-2280.title: HP OpenView Storage Data Protector Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2280.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP OpenView Storage Data Protector. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.Tenable Network Security via TippingPoint and Pedram Amini and Aaron Portnoy of TippingPoint DV Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2280.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-2281.title: HP OpenView Storage Data Protector Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2281.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP OpenView Storage Data Protector. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.Tenable Network Security via TippingPoint and Pedram Amini and Aaron Portnoy of TippingPoint DV Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2281.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-2292.title: Mozilla Firefox Digest Authentication Bug Lets Remote Users Conduct HTTP Request Splitting Attacks
CVE-2007-2292.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can conduct HTTP request splitting attacks.A remote user (server) can return a specially crafted HTTP Digest Authentication value to cause the target client to generate a split request.Stefano `Wisec` Di Paola discovered this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.wisec.it/vulns.php?id=3D11
CVE-2007-2292.extra: A remote server can send an HTTP response that will cause an arbitrary request to be generated by the target user's browser.

CVE-2007-2295.title: Apple QuickTime Heap Overflow in JVTCompEncodeFrame() Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2295.body: A vulnerability was reported in QuickTime. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted '.mov' file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow in JVTCompEncodeFrame() and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor was notified on March 28, 2006.Tom Ferris of security-protocols.com discovered this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://security-protocols.com/sp-x45-advisory.php
CVE-2007-2295.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2295.title: QuickTime Memory Corruption Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2295.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in QuickTime. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted movie, H.264 movie, '.m4v' file, SMIL file, HTML, or Java applet can trigger this flaw.Apple credits Tom Ferris of Security-Protocols.com, Matt Slot of Ambrosia Software, Inc., Jonathan 'Wolf' Rentzsch of Red Shed Software, David Vaartjes of ITsec Security Services, iDefense, and Adam Gowdiak with reporting these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-2295.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2296.title: Apple QuickTime Integer Overflow in FlipFileTypeAtom_BtoN() Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2296.body: A vulnerability was reported in QuickTime. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted '.mp4' file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer overflow in FlipFileTypeAtom_BtoN() and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Tom Ferris of security-protocols.com discovered this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://security-protocols.com/sp-x46-advisory.php
CVE-2007-2296.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2296.title: QuickTime Memory Corruption Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2296.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in QuickTime. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted movie, H.264 movie, '.m4v' file, SMIL file, HTML, or Java applet can trigger this flaw.Apple credits Tom Ferris of Security-Protocols.com, Matt Slot of Ambrosia Software, Inc., Jonathan 'Wolf' Rentzsch of Red Shed Software, David Vaartjes of ITsec Security Services, iDefense, and Adam Gowdiak with reporting these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-2296.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2356.title: GIMP Buffer Overflow in Processing Sun RAS Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2356.body: A vulnerability was reported in the GNU Image Manipulation Program (GIMP) application. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Sun RAS ('.RAS') file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the set_color_table() function and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A demonstration exploit is available at:http://milw0rm.com/exploits/3801Marsu discovered this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2356.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2365.title: Adobe Illustrator Input Validation Flaws in Processing BMP, DIB, RLE, or PNG Files Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2365.body: A vulnerability was reported in Adobe Illustrator. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted BMP, DIB, RLE, or PNG file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.GoLive 9 and GoLive CS2 are also affected.Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2365.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2388.title: QuickTime for Java Lets Remote Users Obtain Information and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2388.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in QuickTime. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can create specially crafted Java applet that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-2388]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Appled credits John McDonald, Paul Griswold, and Tom Cross of IBM Internet Security Systems X-Force and Dyon Balding of Secunia Research with reporting this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted Java applet that, when loaded by the target user, will access web browser memory on the target system [CVE-2007-2389].
CVE-2007-2388.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2007-2391.title: Apple Safari window.setTimeout() JavaScript Function Lets Remote Users Execute Scripting Code in Arbitrary Domains
CVE-2007-2391.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple Safari. A remote user can conduct cross-domain scripting attacks.A remote user can create specially crafted JavaScript that, when loaded by the target user, will execute on the target user's browser in the context of an arbitrary domain. This can be exploited to read cookies and display arbitrary content.The window.setTimeout() function will execute supplied code after the window.location property is changed.A demonstration exploit is available at:http://alt.swiecki.net/safc.htmlRobert Swiecki reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2391.extra: A remote user can conduct cross-domain scripting attacks.

CVE-2007-2400.title: Apple Safari Bugs Let Remote Users Modify the Address Bar and Conduct Cross-Domain Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-2400.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Safari. A remote user can modify the address bar. A remote user can conduct cross-domain scripting attacks.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will modify the contents of the address bar on the target user's browser [CVE-2007-2398].Mac OS X systems are not affected by this vulnerability.Robert Swiecki reported this vulnerability.A demonstration exploit is available at:http://alt.swiecki.net/saff.htmlA remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will exploit a race condition in the browser to enable Javascript running in the context of one page to modify a page in a different security domain [CVE-2007-2400].Both Windows and Mac OS X systems are affected.Apple credits Lawrence Lai, Stan Switzer, Ed Rowe of Adobe Systems, Inc with reporting this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2400.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will modify the address bar on the target user's browser.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with an arbitrary site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-2401.title: Mac OS X WebKit and WebCore Bugs Permit Cross-Domain Scripting Attacks and Remote Code Execution
CVE-2007-2401.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can conduct cross-domain scripting attacks.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an invalid conversion in the WebKit code when rendering frame sets and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-2399]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Apple credits Rhys Kidd of Westnet with reporting this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will inject HTTP code via XMLHttpRequest and cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2007-2401]. The code will run in the security context of an arbitrary site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Apple credits Richard Moore of Westpoint Ltd. with reporting this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2401.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with an arbitrary site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-2402.title: QuickTime Memory Corruption Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2402.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in QuickTime. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted movie, H.264 movie, '.m4v' file, SMIL file, HTML, or Java applet can trigger this flaw.Apple credits Tom Ferris of Security-Protocols.com, Matt Slot of Ambrosia Software, Inc., Jonathan 'Wolf' Rentzsch of Red Shed Software, David Vaartjes of ITsec Security Services, iDefense, and Adam Gowdiak with reporting these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-2402.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2435.title: Java Web Start Incorrect Use of System Classes Lets Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-2435.body: A vulnerability was reported in Java Web Start. A user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.The system does not properly use system classes. A Java application may be able to read and write local files with the privileges of the user running the Java Web Start application.Java Web Start in JDK and JRE 5.0 Update 10 and earlier and in SDK and JRE 1.4.2_13 and earlier are affected.Sun credits the Fujitsu security team with reporting this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2435.extra: A Java application can obtain privileges of the target user.

CVE-2007-2446.title: Samba Heap Overflows in Parsing NDR Data Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2446.body: A vulnerability was reported in Samba. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.Samba does not properly parse NDR data. A remote user can send specially crafted MS-RPC requests to trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The vendor was notified on April 25, 2007. An additional (related) bug was reported on May 5, 2007.Brian Schafer of TippingPoint Security Response discovered this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2446.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-2450.title: Tomcat Input Validation Holes in the JSP Examples, Manager, and Host Manager Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-2450.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Tomcat. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The JSP examples web application does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Tomcat software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]:[port]/jsp-examples/snp/snoop.jsp;<script>alert()</script>test.jspThis vulnerability was reported to JPCERT by a researcher.The Tomcat Manager and Host Manager web applications also do not properly filter HTML code. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks against authenticated target users.Daiki Fukumori, Secure Sky Technology, discovered this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2450.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Tomcat software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-2479.title: Trillian IRC and Display Engine Heap Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2479.body: A vulnerability was reported in Trillian. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can send a message containing an HTML font tag with a specially crafted 'face' attribute that will trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when highlighted by the target user within Trillian, will trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote system can send specially crafted CTCP PING messages containing UTF-8 characters to cause the target Trillian client to return some data to a remote user instead of the intended server.The vendor was notified on January 24, 2007.enhalos reported these vulnerabilities to iDefense.
CVE-2007-2479.extra: A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can obtain user information.

CVE-2007-2508.title: Trend Micro ServerProtect Buffer Overflows in EarthAgent and SpntSvc Daemons Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2508.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Trend Micro ServerProtect. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 5168 trigger a stack overflow in the SpntSvc.exe daemon (AgRpcCln.dll) and execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 3628 trigger a stack overflow in the EarthAgent.exe daemon and execute arbitrary code on the target system.The code will run with the privileges of the target services.The vendor was notified on February 1, 2007.Eric DETOISIEN discovered these vulnerabilities. TippingPoint reported these vulnerabilities.The original advisories are available at:http://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-07-024.htmlhttp://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-07-025.html
CVE-2007-2508.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-2509.title: PHP CRLF Injection Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary FTP Commands
CVE-2007-2509.body: A vulnerability was reported in PHP. A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary FTP commands.The PHP ftp function does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply specially crafted input to inject a CR/LF character string and execute arbitrary FTP commands on the target FTP server.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]/test.php?dir=loveshell%0D%0AMKD jnc%0D%0ADELE jnc.txt%0D%0Armd testloveshell[at]Bug.Center.Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2509.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary FTP commands on the target FTP server.

CVE-2007-2510.title: PHP Buffer Overflow in make_http_soap_request() May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2510.body: A vulnerability was reported in PHP. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote SOAP server can send a specially crafted HTTP redirect response to trigger a buffer overflow in the make_http_soap_request() function and execute arbitrary code on a connected target client system.Ilia Alshanetsky reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2510.extra: A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-2522.title: CA Anti-Virus for the Enterprise Buffer Overflows Let Remote and Local Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2522.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in CA Anti-Virus for the Enterprise (formally eTrust Antivirus). A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted login authentication to the Console Server to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-2522]. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.CA Threat Manager (formally eTrust Integrated Threat Management) and CA Anti-Spyware (formally eTrust PestPatrol) are also affected.A local user can modify the contents of a file mapping to trigger a stack overflow in 'InoCore.dll' and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-2523].CA Threat Manager is also affected by this second vulnerability.CA credits Tenable Network Security and TippingPoint with reporting the Console Server buffer overflow and binagres and iDefense with reporting the InoCore buffer overflow.
CVE-2007-2522.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-2581.title: Microsoft SharePoint Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-2581.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft SharePoint. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Microsoft SharePoint software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]/sharepoint/default.aspx/%22);}if(true){alert(%22qwertytisSolarius reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2581.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Microsoft SharePoint software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-2582.title: IBM DB2 DB2JDS Service Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2582.body: A vulnerability was reported in DB2. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the DB2JDS service to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.
CVE-2007-2582.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-2582.title: IBM DB2 Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2582.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in DB2. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the DB2JDS service on TCP port 6789 to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.A remote user can send a specially crafted LANG parameter value or a packet length over 32768 bytes to cause the target service to crash.The vendor was notified on November 9, 2006.TippingPoint reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-07-056.html
CVE-2007-2582.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-2719.title: HP Systems Insight Manager Session Fixation Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Administrative Access
CVE-2007-2719.body: A vulnerability was reported in the HP Systems Insight Manager. A remote user can gain administrative access to the target application.A remote user can obtain a JSESSIONID cookie and force an administrator to use that session cookie. Once the administrator has authenticated to the target console, the remote user can invoke the specified cookie to gain administrative access.Luka Treiber and Aljosa Ocepek of ACROS Security discovered this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.acrossecurity.com/aspr/ASPR-2007-05-14-1-PUB.txt
CVE-2007-2719.extra: A remote user can gain administrative access on the target console.

CVE-2007-2788.title: Sun Java Runtime Environment Buffer Overflow in Applet Image Parsing Lets Remote Users Gain Privileges
CVE-2007-2788.body: A vulnerability was reported in Sun Java Runtime Environment (JRE). A remote user can gain elevated privileges on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted applet that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the image parsing code and gain elevated privileges. The applet can read and write local files or execute local applications with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can also cause the Java Virtual Machine to hang.Chris Evans of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2788.extra: A remote user can create a Java applet that, when loaded by the target user, will gain privileges on the target user's system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-2789.title: Sun Java Runtime Environment Buffer Overflow in Applet Image Parsing Lets Remote Users Gain Privileges
CVE-2007-2789.body: A vulnerability was reported in Sun Java Runtime Environment (JRE). A remote user can gain elevated privileges on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted applet that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the image parsing code and gain elevated privileges. The applet can read and write local files or execute local applications with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can also cause the Java Virtual Machine to hang.Chris Evans of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2789.extra: A remote user can create a Java applet that, when loaded by the target user, will gain privileges on the target user's system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-2798.title: Kerberos kadmind Buffer Overflow in rename_principal_2_svc() Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2798.body: A vulnerability was reported in the krb5 Kerberos administration daemon (kadmind). A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow in the rename_principal_2_svc() function and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service (typically root privileges).Authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability, but administrative privileges are not required.The vendor was notified on May 15, 2007.iDefense reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2798.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-2799.title: file Integer Overflow in file_printf() May Let Local Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2799.body: A vulnerability was reported in file. A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.The fix for CVE-2007-1536 [Alert ID 1017796] introduced an integer overflow condition. A local user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.Colin Percival discovered this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2799.extra: A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-2834.title: OpenOffice Buffer Overflow in Processing TIFF Images Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2834.body: A vulnerability was reported in the OpenOffice.org Office Suite. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted TIFF image file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.\iDefense disclosed this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2834.extra: A remote user can create a TIFF image file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2867.title: Mozilla Firefox Bugs in Layout and Javascript Engines May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2867.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The layout engine and the JavaScript engine is affected.Igor Bukanov, Brendan Eich, Eli Friedman, Georgi Guninski, moz_bug_r_a4, Olli Pettay, Wladimir Palant, Jesse Ruderman, Martijn Wargers, and Boris Zbarsky reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-2867.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2867.title: Mozilla Seamonkey Bugs in Layout and Javascript Engines May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2867.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Seamonkey. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The layout engine and the JavaScript engine are affected.Igor Bukanov, Brendan Eich, Eli Friedman, Georgi Guninski, moz_bug_r_a4, Olli Pettay, Wladimir Palant, Jesse Ruderman, Martijn Wargers, and Boris Zbarsky reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-2867.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2868.title: Mozilla Firefox Bugs in Layout and Javascript Engines May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2868.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The layout engine and the JavaScript engine is affected.Igor Bukanov, Brendan Eich, Eli Friedman, Georgi Guninski, moz_bug_r_a4, Olli Pettay, Wladimir Palant, Jesse Ruderman, Martijn Wargers, and Boris Zbarsky reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-2868.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2868.title: Mozilla Thunderbird Bugs in Javascript Engines May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2868.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Thunderbird. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Thunderbird is affected if JavaScript is enabled (not the default configuration).Brendan Eich, Igor Bukanov, Jesse Ruderman, moz_bug_r_a4 and Wladimir Palant reported reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-2868.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2868.title: Mozilla Seamonkey Bugs in Layout and Javascript Engines May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2868.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Seamonkey. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The layout engine and the JavaScript engine are affected.Igor Bukanov, Brendan Eich, Eli Friedman, Georgi Guninski, moz_bug_r_a4, Olli Pettay, Wladimir Palant, Jesse Ruderman, Martijn Wargers, and Boris Zbarsky reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-2868.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2872.title: PHP Integer Overflow in chunk_split() Has Unspecified Impact
CVE-2007-2872.body: A vulnerability was reported in PHP in the chunk_split() function. The impact was not specified.A user may be able to trigger an integer overflow in the chunk_split() function.Gerhard Wagner reported this vulnerability.

CVE-2007-2875.title: Linux Kernel cpuset_tasks_read() Memory Disclosure Lets Local Users View Portions of Kernel Memory
CVE-2007-2875.body: A vulnerability was reported in Linux Kernel. A local user can view portions of kernel memory.A local user can exploit the cpuset_tasks_read() function to trigger an integer underflow, allowing the user to view potentially sensitive information from kernel memory.Only systems with the cpuset file system mounted are affected [not the default configuration].The vendor was notified on April 27, 2007.iDefense reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2875.extra: A local user can view portions of kernel memory.

CVE-2007-2931.title: MSN Messenger Buffer Overflow in Processing Webcam Streams Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2931.body: A vulnerability was reported in MSN Messenger. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted webcam stream that, when accepted by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Because the software supports one-way videochats, the target user does not need to have a webcam to be exploited.Version 7.0.0820 on Windows 2000 SP4 is not affected.Windows Live Messenger version 8.0 is vulnerable. Windows Live Messenger version 8.1 is not affected.The vendor was notified in January 2007.The original advisory is available at:http://www.team509.com/modules.php?name=News&file=article&sid=50A demontration exploit is available at:http://www.team509.com/exp_msn.rar/Wushi reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2931.extra: A remote user can create a webcam stream that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2952.title: K9 Web Protection Buffer Overflows in Processing HTTP Responses From the Centralized Server Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2952.body: A vulnerability was reported in K9 Web Protection. A remote user with the ability to masquerade as the central server can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user with the ability to masquerade as 'sp.cwfservice.net' can return specially crafted HTTP version information to the client to trigger a stack overflow in 'k9filter.exe' and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The vendor was notified on July 5, 2007.Carsten Eiram of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2952.extra: A remote user with the ability to masquerade as a certain centralized server can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-2952.title: K9 Web Protection Buffer Overflows in Processing HTTP Headers Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2952.body: A vulnerability was reported in K9 Web Protection. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will redirect the target user to the local web management interface and trigger a buffer overflow in 'k9filter.exe' and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted HTTP Referer header value will trigger the stack overflow.The vendor was notified on June 29, 2007.Carsten Eiram of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2952.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2954.title: Novell Client NWSPOOL.DLL Stack Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2954.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Novell Client. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted RPC data to trigger one of several stack overflows in NWSPOOL.DLL and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The RpcAddPrinterDriver and RpcGetPrinterDriverDirectory requests are affected. Other requests may be affected.The vendor was notified on August 9, 2007.JJ Reyes of Secunia Research discovered this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2954.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-2957.title: McAfee E-Business Server Heap Overflow in Processing Authentication Packets Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2957.body: A vulnerability was reported in McAfee E-Business Server. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted authentication data to trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.Windows-based systems are not affected.The vendor was notified on August 13, 2007.Dyon Balding of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://secunia.com/secunia_research/2007-69/advisory/
CVE-2007-2957.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-2966.title: F-Secure Internet Security Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-2966.body: A vulnerability was reported in F-Secure Internet Security. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote user can create a specially crafted LHA archive or other archive or packed executable that, when processed by the target application, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor credits Tavis Ormandy in Google Security Team and Sergio Alvarez of n.runs AG with discovering these vulnerabilities.A local user can send a specially crafted I/O request packet to exploit an access validation flaw in the Real-time Scanning function to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with elevated privileges. The vendor discovered this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2966.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when processed by the target application, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-2966.title: F-Secure Internet Gatekeeper Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2966.body: A vulnerability was reported in F-Secure Internet Gatekeeper. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted LHA archive or other archive or packed executable that, when processed by the target application, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor credits Tavis Ormandy in Google Security Team and Sergio Alvarez of n.runs AG with discovering these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-2966.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when processed by the target application, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2966.title: F-Secure Anti-Virus Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-2966.body: A vulnerability was reported in F-Secure Anti-Virus. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote user can create a specially crafted LHA archive or other archive or packed executable that, when processed by the target application, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor credits Tavis Ormandy in Google Security Team and Sergio Alvarez of n.runs AG with discovering these vulnerabilities.A local user can send a specially crafted I/O request packet to exploit an access validation flaw in the Real-time Scanning function to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with elevated privileges. The vendor discovered this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2966.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when processed by the target application, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-2967.title: F-Secure Internet Security Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-2967.body: A vulnerability was reported in F-Secure Internet Security. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote user can create a specially crafted LHA archive or other archive or packed executable that, when processed by the target application, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor credits Tavis Ormandy in Google Security Team and Sergio Alvarez of n.runs AG with discovering these vulnerabilities.A local user can send a specially crafted I/O request packet to exploit an access validation flaw in the Real-time Scanning function to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with elevated privileges. The vendor discovered this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2967.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when processed by the target application, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-2967.title: F-Secure Internet Gatekeeper Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-2967.body: A vulnerability was reported in F-Secure Internet Gatekeeper. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted LHA archive or other archive or packed executable that, when processed by the target application, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor credits Tavis Ormandy in Google Security Team and Sergio Alvarez of n.runs AG with discovering these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-2967.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when processed by the target application, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-2967.title: F-Secure Anti-Virus Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-2967.body: A vulnerability was reported in F-Secure Anti-Virus. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote user can create a specially crafted LHA archive or other archive or packed executable that, when processed by the target application, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor credits Tavis Ormandy in Google Security Team and Sergio Alvarez of n.runs AG with discovering these vulnerabilities.A local user can send a specially crafted I/O request packet to exploit an access validation flaw in the Real-time Scanning function to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with elevated privileges. The vendor discovered this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-2967.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when processed by the target application, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-3033.title: Windows Bugs in the Contacts, Feed Headlines, and Weather Gadgets Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3033.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Gadgets. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted contacts that, when imported by the target user, will trigger a validation error in the Contacts Gadget and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-3032]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can send a specially crafted RSS feed post to a subscribed target user to trigger a validation error in the Feed Headlines Gadget and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-3033]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user. The vendor was notified on March 21, 2007.A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML link that, when viewed by the target user via the Weather Gadget, will trigger a validation error in the Weather Gadget and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-3891]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Aviv Raff of Finjan reported Windows Vista Contacts Gadget vulnerability. Joshua J. Drake of iDefense Labs reported the Windows Vista Feed Headlines Gadget vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3033.extra: A remote user can create cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-3034.title: Microsoft GDI Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3034.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft GDI. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted image that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the Graphics Rendering Engine and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Windows XP Professional x64 Edition SP2 is not affected.The vendor was notified on March 27, 2007.A demonstration exploit is available at:http://www.milw0rm.com/exploits/4337eEye Digital Security reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3034.extra: A remote user can create an image that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-3036.title: Windows Services for UNIX Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-3036.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows Services for UNIX. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.The software does not properly process set user id (setuid) binary files. A local user can invoke one of the binaries to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with elevated privileges.Brian A. Reiter of WolfeReiter reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3036.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.[Editor's note: The advisory did not indicate the extent of privilege escalation.]

CVE-2007-3037.title: Windows Media Player Skin File Header Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3037.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows Media Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a skin file with a specially crafted header that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.One vulnerability occurs when decompressing skin files and another occurs when parsing skin files.Skin files are distributed in WMZ and WMD files.The vendor was notified of one vulnerability on March 19, 2007 and another on May 22, 2007.Piotr Bania and TippingPoint reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3037.extra: A remote user can create a skin file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-3039.title: Microsoft Message Queuing (MSMQ) Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3039.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Message Queuing (MSMQ). On Windows 2000 Server, a remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. On Windows 2000 Professional and Windows XP, a local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target Windows 2000 Server system. The code will run with Local System privileges.A local user can trigger a buffer overflow to execute arbitrary code on the target Windows 2000 Professional and Windows XP system with elevated privileges.TippingPoint and Venustech of ADLABS reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3039.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-3040.title: Microsoft Agent ActiveX Control Memory Corruption Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3040.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Agent. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in the Microsoft Agent ActiveX control and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The Vulnerability Research team of Assurent Secure Technologies, Yamata Li of Palo Alto Networks, and a researcher working with VeriSign iDefense separately reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3040.extra: A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-3056.title: WebSVN Input Validation Hole in 'filedetails.php' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-3056.body: A vulnerability was reported in WebSVN. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The 'filedetails.php' script does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'path' parameter before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the WebSVN software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2007-3056.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the WebSVN software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-3104.title: Linux Kernel sysfs_readdir() NULL Pointer Dereference Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-3104.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Linux kernel. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can invoke the sysfs_readdir() function to trigger a kernel oops.
CVE-2007-3104.extra: A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

CVE-2007-3115.title: MaraDNS Memory Leak Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-3115.body: A vulnerability was reported in MaraDNS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted request to cause trigger a memory leak.This vulnerability was discovered using the Predator tool from Jo o Antunes.
CVE-2007-3115.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-3147.title: Yahoo Messenger Buffer Overflows in Webcam ActiveX Controls Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3147.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Yahoo Messenger. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in some Wecam image upload and viewing ActiveX controls used by Yahoo Messenger and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CLSIDs of the affected controls are:DCE2F8B1-A520-11D4-8FD0-00D0B77302779D39223E-AE8E-11D4-8FD3-00D0B7730277Danny, server.exception at yahoo.com, reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-3147.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-3147.title: Yahoo Messenger Unspecified Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3147.body: A vulnerability was reported in Yahoo Messenger. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.Multiple flaws exist and can be exploited with "minimal user interaction."The vendor was notified on June 5, 2007.eEye Digital Security discovered these vulnerabilities.The original advisory is available at:http://research.eeye.com/html/advisories/upcoming/20070605.html
CVE-2007-3147.extra: A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-3148.title: Yahoo Messenger Buffer Overflows in Webcam ActiveX Controls Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3148.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Yahoo Messenger. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in some Wecam image upload and viewing ActiveX controls used by Yahoo Messenger and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CLSIDs of the affected controls are:DCE2F8B1-A520-11D4-8FD0-00D0B77302779D39223E-AE8E-11D4-8FD3-00D0B7730277Danny, server.exception at yahoo.com, reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-3148.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-3148.title: Yahoo Messenger Unspecified Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3148.body: A vulnerability was reported in Yahoo Messenger. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.Multiple flaws exist and can be exploited with "minimal user interaction."The vendor was notified on June 5, 2007.eEye Digital Security discovered these vulnerabilities.The original advisory is available at:http://research.eeye.com/html/advisories/upcoming/20070605.html
CVE-2007-3148.extra: A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-3180.title: HP Help and Support Center Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3180.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP Help and Support Center. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The software running on HP Notebook Computers with Microsoft Windows XP, XP Professional, XP Home Edition, and XP Tablet PC Edition is affected.HP credits Karl Lynn of Juniper Networks J-Security Research Labs with reporting this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3180.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-3184.title: Cisco Trust Agent User Notification Function Lets Physically Local Users Gain Administrative Privileges
CVE-2007-3184.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Trust Agent on Mac OS X. A physically local user can obtain administrative privileges on the target system.When the Cisco Trust Agent displays a user notification message from the Cisco Secure Access Control Server, the message may be displayed over top of the login screen. The popup message allows the user to access System Preferences and make changes to all non-root user accounts, including the administrator account. The user can change the password for the administrator account without entering the existing password.Microsoft Windows or Linux-based systems are not affected.Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsi58799 to this vulnerability.Adam Blake of Deloitte UK reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3184.extra: A local user can obtain administrator privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-3186.title: Apple Safari Protocol Handler Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Inject Arbitrary Commands
CVE-2007-3186.body: A vulnerability was reported in Safari for Windows. A remote user can cause arbitrary commands to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create HTML with a specially crafted protocol handler within an IFRAME that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
