The commands will run with the privileges of the target user.Only the Windows-based version is affected.Thor Larholm discovered this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://larholm.com/2007/06/12/safari-for-windows-0day-exploit-in-2-hours/
CVE-2007-3186.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary commands on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-3216.title: BrightStor ARCserve for Laptops and Desktops Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3216.body: A vulnerability was reported in BrightStor ARCserve for Laptops and Desktops. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code on the target system.Only the server installation is affected. The client installation is not affected.BrightStor ARCserve Backup is not affected.The vendor was notified on June 4, 2007.eEye Digital Security reported these vulnerabilities.The original advisory is available at:http://research.eeye.com/html/advisories/upcoming/20070604.html
CVE-2007-3216.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-3216.title: CA ARCserve Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Bypass Authentication, and Deny Service
CVE-2007-3216.body: A vulnerability was reported in CA ARCserve Backup. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system, bypass authentication, or cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code or cause denial of service conditions on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.Several command arguments processed by the LGServer service are affected [CVE-2007-3216].rxrLogin authentication credentials and a username value processed by the GetUserInfo() function are affected [CVE-2007-5003].An integer overflow exists in the processing of authentication information [CVE-2007-5004].File uploads are not properly validated by the NetBackup service [CVE-2007-5005].A remote user can supply specially crafted authorization credentials to bypass authentication [CVE-2007-5006].Client installations are not affected.CA Desktop Management Suite versions 11.0, 11.1, and 11.2 are also affected. CA Protection Suites r2 is also affected.eEye Digital Security, Sean Larsson of VeriSign iDefense Labs, and some anonymous researchers working with iDefense reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-3216.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can bypass authentication.

CVE-2007-3285.title: Mozilla Firefox May Interpret Local Files Differently Than the Underlying Operating System
CVE-2007-3285.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. The browser may incorrectly interpret a local 'file://' resource and launch the incorrect application.A local user can create a filename URL that contents an encoded null character ('%00'). When the filename URL is loaded, the browser will interpret the file extension differently than the underlying Windows operating system. As a result, the browser may launch an application or launch the incorrect application.The original advisory is available at:http://www.0x000000.com/?i=333The vendor credits Ronald van den Heetkamp with reporting this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3285.extra: A local user can cause the browser to launch an application or launch the incorrect application.

CVE-2007-3333.title: IBM AIX Buffer Overflow in capture Command Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-3333.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM AIX. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can invoke the capture command and trigger a stack overflow to execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the target system.The flaw resides in the code that parses terminal control sequences.The vendor was notified on June 5, 2007.The vendor credits iDefense with reporting this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3333.extra: A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-3374.title: Red Hat CMAN Buffer Overflow Lets Local Users Deny Service or Potentially Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-3374.body: A vulnerability was reported in Red Hat Cluster Manager (CMAN). A local user can deny service or obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can connect to the cman daemon and trigger a buffer overflow to crash the daemon or potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system with elevated privileges.
CVE-2007-3374.extra: A local user can deny service or obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-3381.title: GNOME Display Manager g_strsplit() Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-3381.body: A vulnerability was reported in GNOME Display Manager. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can send specially crafted commands to crash the target GDM daemon and cause GDM to stop managing any subsequent display sessions.The flaw resides in daemon/gdm.c, daemon/gdmconfig.c, gui/gdmconfig.c, gui/gdmflexiserver.c, and gui/gdmconfig.c.
CVE-2007-3381.extra: A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

CVE-2007-3382.title: Tomcat Single Quote Cookie Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Obtain Session Information
CVE-2007-3382.body: A vulnerability was reported in Tomcat. A remote user can obtain session information.The software incorrectly interprets a single quote (') character in a cookie value as a delimiter. A remote user may be able to exploit this to hijack sessions.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]:8080/servlets-examples/servlet/CookieExample?cookiename=BLOCKER&cookievalue=%5C%22A%3D%27%3B+Expires%3DThu%2C+1+Jan+2009+00%3A00%3A01+UTC%3B+Path%3D%2Fservlets-examples%2Fservlet+%3BTomasz Kuczynski, Poznan Supercomputing and Networking Center and CERT/CC reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3382.extra: A remote user can may be able to hijack sessions.

CVE-2007-3385.title: Tomcat Backslash Quote Cookie Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Obtain Session Information
CVE-2007-3385.body: A vulnerability was reported in Tomcat. A remote user can obtain session information.The software incorrectly interprets the backslash quote (\") character sequence in a cookie value. A remote user may be able to exploit this to obtain session information.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]:8080/examples/servlets/servlet/CookieExample?cookiename=HAHA&cookievalue=%5C%22FOO%3B+Expires%3DThu%2C+1+Jan+2009+00%3A00%3A01+UTC%3B+Path%3D%2F%3BTomasz Kuczynski, Poznan Supercomputing and Networking Center, and CERT/CC reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3385.extra: A remote user can may be able to hijack sessions.

CVE-2007-3386.title: Tomcat Host Manager Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-3386.body: A vulnerability was reported in Tomcat Host Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The Host Manager Servlet does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted request that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Tomcat Host Manager software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A demonstration exploit is provided:<form action="http://[target]:8080/host-manager/html/add" method="get"><input type="hidden" NAME='name' VALUE="aaa"><input type="hidden" NAME='aliases' VALUE="<script>alert()</script>"><input type="submit"></form>The NTT OSS CENTER and JPCERT/CC reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3386.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Tomcat Host Manager software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-3387.title: KDE kpdf/xpdf Integer Overflow in StreamPredictor() Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3387.body: A vulnerability was reported in KDE kpdf (and xpdf). A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted PDF file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer overflow in the StreamPredictor() and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user or application.The vulnerability resides in code share by xpdf and kpdf.The vendor credits Derek Noonburg with reporting this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3387.extra: A remote user can create a PDF file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-3389.title: Wireshark DHCP/BOOTP, MMS, SSL, DCP ETSI, iSeries, and HTTP Chunked Response Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-3389.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Wireshark. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target service to crash.An HTTP chunked response can trigger a crash.iSeries capture files can trigger a crash.A DCP ETSI packet can cause the system to consume all available memory.An SSL packet can cause the Wireshark to loop "excessively".A MMS packet can cause the Wireshark to loop "excessively".A specially crafted packet can trigger an off-by-one error in the DHCP/BOOTP dissector.
CVE-2007-3389.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-3391.title: Wireshark DHCP/BOOTP, MMS, SSL, DCP ETSI, iSeries, and HTTP Chunked Response Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-3391.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Wireshark. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target service to crash.An HTTP chunked response can trigger a crash.iSeries capture files can trigger a crash.A DCP ETSI packet can cause the system to consume all available memory.An SSL packet can cause the Wireshark to loop "excessively".A MMS packet can cause the Wireshark to loop "excessively".A specially crafted packet can trigger an off-by-one error in the DHCP/BOOTP dissector.
CVE-2007-3391.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-3410.title: Helix Player SMIL parseWallClockValue() Stack Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3410.body: A vulnerability was reported in Helix Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a SMIL file with a specially crafted time value that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow in the SmilTimeValue::parseWallClockValue() function and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor was notified on October 2, 2006.iDefense reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3410.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-3410.title: RealPlayer SMIL parseWallClockValue() Stack Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3410.body: A vulnerability was reported in RealPlayer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a SMIL file with a specially crafted time value that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow in the SmilTimeValue::parseWallClockValue() function and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor was notified on October 2, 2006.iDefense reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3410.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-3454.title: Trend Micro OfficeScan Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Console Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication
CVE-2007-3454.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Trend Micro OfficeScan. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can bypass authentication on the console.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target web service.A remote user can send specially crafted HTTP headers to bypass the OfficeScan Management Console logon password authentication process.
CVE-2007-3454.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can bypass authentication on the console.

CVE-2007-3455.title: Trend Micro OfficeScan Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Console Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication
CVE-2007-3455.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Trend Micro OfficeScan. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can bypass authentication on the console.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target web service.A remote user can send specially crafted HTTP headers to bypass the OfficeScan Management Console logon password authentication process.
CVE-2007-3455.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can bypass authentication on the console.

CVE-2007-3456.title: Adobe Flash Player Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code or Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2007-3456.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Flash Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted SWF file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-3456]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP Referer value to conduct cross-site request forgery attacks [CVE-2007-3457]. Flash Player 9 is not affected.Adobe credits Stefano DiPaola, Elia Florio, and Giorgio Fedon with reporting the input validation vulnerability and Daiki Fukumori of Secure Sky Technology, Inc. with reporting the HTTP Referer vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3456.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.

CVE-2007-3457.title: Adobe Flash Player Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code or Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2007-3457.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Flash Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted SWF file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-3456]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP Referer value to conduct cross-site request forgery attacks [CVE-2007-3457]. Flash Player 9 is not affected.Adobe credits Stefano DiPaola, Elia Florio, and Giorgio Fedon with reporting the input validation vulnerability and Daiki Fukumori of Secure Sky Technology, Inc. with reporting the HTTP Referer vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3457.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.

CVE-2007-3503.title: Sun JavaDoc Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-3503.body: A vulnerability was reported in Sun JavaDoc. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The JavaDoc tool in Sun JDK does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before generating documentation pages. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site hosting the Sun JavaDoc pages and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Sun credits Martin Straka with reporting this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3503.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site hosting the Sun JavaDoc pages, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-3504.title: Java Web Start Applet Privilege Escalation Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3504.body: A vulnerability was reported in Java Web Start. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A Java applet may be able to gain permissions to overwrite files with the privileges of the target user. The applet can modify the target user's '.java.policy' file to invoke arbitrary applets or Java Web Start applications, which in turn can execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the target user.Solaris and Linux systems are not affected.Sun credits John Heasman of NGSSoftware Limited with reporting this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3504.extra: A remote user can create an applet that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system with the privileges of the target user.

CVE-2007-3508.title: Glibc LD_HWCAP_MASK Integer Overflow Lets Local Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3508.body: A vulnerability was reported in Glibc. A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can set a specially crafted value for LD_HWCAP_MASK to trigger an integer overflow and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system.Tavis Ormandy of the Gentoo Linux Security Team discovered this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3508.extra: A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-3510.title: IBM Lotus Domino Server Buffer Overflow in IMAP Service Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3510.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Lotus Domino in the IMAP service. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote authenticated user can connect to the IMAP service and send specially crafted data trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.IBM has assigned SPR# PRAD74LKW5 to this vulnerability.The vendor was notified on June 27, 2007.Manuel Santamarina Suarez reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2007-3510.extra: A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-3654.title: NetBSD Display Driver Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-3654.body: A vulnerability was reported in NetBSD. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can invoke an ioctl call and pass specially crafted values to the display driver vga_allocattr() function to trigger a kernel panic.Other display driver functions are affected.Venustech AD-LAB reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3654.extra: A local user can cause a kernel panic.

CVE-2007-3655.title: Java Web Start JNLP Stack Overflow Lets Remote Users
CVE-2007-3655.body: A vulnerability was reported in Java Web Start. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted JNLP file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.This can be exploited via HTML without user interaction.The vendor was notified on January 19, 2007.Daniel Soeder of eEye Digital Security discovered this vulnerability.Brett Moore of Security-Assessment.com separately discovered this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3655.extra: A remote user can create a file or HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-3656.title: Mozilla Firefox 'wyciwyg://' Cache Contents Can Be Accessed By Remote Users
CVE-2007-3656.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can read cached content.A remote user can bypass the browser's same-origin checks and read cached 'wyciwyg://' using HTTP 302 redirects.A remote user can exploit this to view potentially sensitive data, conduct cache poisoning attacks, and spoof URLs or content of sites that render documents on the browser (client-side).Michal Zalewski reported this vulnerability.A demonstration exploit is available at:http://lcamtuf.coredump.cx/ffcache/
CVE-2007-3656.extra: A remote user can view potentially sensitive cached content, conduct cache poisoning attacks, and spoof URLs or content of sites that render documents on the browser (client-side).

CVE-2007-3670.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Bug in Firefox URL Protocol Handler Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Commands
CVE-2007-3670.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary commands to be executed on the target user's system.The browser does not properly process the 'FirefoxURL' URL protocol. A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary shell commands with arbitrary arguments on the target system. The commands will run with the privileges of the target user.The protocol handler for the FirefoxURL protocol will pass the user-supplied command and arguments to ShellExecute().Thor Larholm discovered this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://larholm.com/2007/07/10/internet-explorer-0day-exploit/[Editor's note: Some users report that this is not a vulnerability in Internet Explorer and that, instead, Mozilla Firefox is vulnerable.]
CVE-2007-3670.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-3670.title: Mozilla Firefox Bugs in URL Protocol Handlers Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Commands
CVE-2007-3670.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.The browser does not properly process the 'FirefoxURL' URL protocol. A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary shell commands with arbitrary arguments on the target system. The commands will run with the privileges of the target user.Billy (BK) Rios, Nate Mcfeters, and Raghav "the Pope" Dube reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.xs-sniper.com/sniperscope/IE-Pwns-Firefox.htmlThor Larholm originally reported this type of vulnerability as applied to Microsoft Internet Explorer:http://larholm.com/2007/07/10/internet-explorer-0day-exploit/[Editor's note: Some users dispute that Internet Explorer is at fault.]Jesper Johansson and others reported that other URI protocol handlers (e.g., mailto, news, nntp, snews, and telnet) are also affected and still vulnerable in Firefox 2.0.0.5.Firefox version 2.0.0.6 does not properly process %-encoded sequences.Some demonstration exploit code is available at:http://xs-sniper.com/blog/remote-command-exec-firefox-2005/
CVE-2007-3670.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-3676.title: IBM DB2 Universal Database Administration Server Memory Corruption Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3676.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM DB2 Universal Database Administration Server. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 523 to trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service ("dasusr1" on Linux and "db2admin" on Windows).The vendor was notified on June 18, 2007.This vulnerability was reported via iDefense.
CVE-2007-3676.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-3678.title: QuarkXPress Stack Overflow in Word Import Filter Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3678.body: A vulnerability was reported in QuarkXPress. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Word file that, when imported by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor was notified on Jun 24, 2007.Tan Chew Keong of vuln.sg discovered this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.vuln.sg/quarkxpress72-en.html
CVE-2007-3678.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when imported by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-3680.title: AIX Buffer Overflow in libodm May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-3680.body: A vulnerability was reported in libodm on IBM AIX. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can trigger a buffer overflow in the Object Data Manager library to execute arbitrary code on the target system with root privileges.The vendor was notified on April 2, 2007.iDefense reported this vulnerability to IBM.
CVE-2007-3680.extra: A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-3701.title: TippingPoint Intrusion Prevention System Alternate Unicode Character Encodings Lets Remote Users Evade Detection
CVE-2007-3701.body: A vulnerability was reported in TippingPoint Intrusion Prevention System. A remote user can evade detection.A remote user can send specially encoded data to avoid detection by the IPS. Specific Unicode encoding for the forward slash character can be used to cause the request to fail to match IPS signatures.Some web servers will properly decode these characters.Some demonstration exploit URLs are provided:http://[target]/scripts%c0%afcmd.exehttp://[target]/scripts%e0%80%afcmd.exehttp://[target]/scripts%c1%9ccmd.exeThe vendor was notified on January 18, 2006.Paul Craig of Security-Assessment.com discovered this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://security-assessment.com/files/advisories/2007-07-11_Tippingpoint_IPS_Signature_Evasion.pdf
CVE-2007-3701.extra: A remote user can evade intrusion detection.

CVE-2007-3711.title: TippingPoint Intrusion Prevention System Fragmented Packet Processing Lets Remote Users Evade Detection
CVE-2007-3711.body: A vulnerability was reported in TippingPoint Intrusion Prevention System. A remote user can evade detection.A remote user can send specially fragmented packets to evade detection.The vendor was notified on February 6, 2006.The vendor credits Andres Riancho of Cybsec Security Systems with reporting this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.cybsec.com/vuln/CYBSEC-Security_Pre-Advisory_3Com_TippingPoint_IPS_Detection_Bypass_2.pdf
CVE-2007-3711.extra: A remote user can evade detection.

CVE-2007-3716.title: Java Runtime Environment XSLT Stylesheet Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3716.body: A vulnerability was reported in Java Runtime Environment (JRE). A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system.The Java XML Digital Signature implementation does not properly process XSLT stylesheets contained in XSLT Transforms in XML Signatures. A remote user can create a specially crafted signature that, when processed by the target application, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.Sun credits Brad Hill of iSEC Partners with reporting this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3716.extra: A remote user can create a signature that, when processed by the target user or application, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-3743.title: Safari Buffer Overflow in Processing Bookmarks Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3743.body: A vulnerability was reported in Safari. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a bookmark with a specially crafted title that, when added by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Mac OS X systems are not affected.E.Azizov from ITDefence.ru reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3743.extra: A remote user can create a bookmark that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-3744.title: Mac OS X Heap Overflow in PCRE Library Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3744.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can spoof a site URL.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow in the Perl Compatible Regular Expressions (PCRE) library used by the Safari JavaScript engine and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-3944]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Apple credits Charlie Miller and Jake Honoroff of Independent Security Evaluators with reporting these vulnerabilities.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL containing International Domain Name (IDN) support and Unicode fonts that, when loaded by the target user, will direct the user to a spoofed site [CVE-2007-3742].Apple credits Tomohito Yoshino of Business Architects Inc. with reporting this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3744.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system or spoof the user interface.A remote user can spoof a site URL.

CVE-2007-3750.title: QuickTime Movie/PICT/QTVR/Java Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3750.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in QuickTime. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A movie with a specially crafted image description atom can trigger code execution [CVE-2007-2395]. Dylan Ashe of Adobe Systems Incorporated reported this vulnerability.A movie with specially crafted Sample Table Sample Descriptor (STSD) atoms can trigger code execution [CVE-2007-3750]. Tobias Klein of www.trapkit.de reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted Java applet can obtain potentially sensitive information or execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges on the target user's system [CVE-2007-3751]. Adam Gowdiak for reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted PICT image can trigger arbitrary code execution [CVE-2007-4672, CVE-2007-4676]. Ruben Santamarta of reversemode.com reported these vulnerabilities via TippingPoint.A movie file with a specially crafted movie atom can trigger arbitrary code execution [CVE-2007-4674]. Cody Pierce of TippingPoint DVLabs reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted QTVR movie can trigger arbitrary code execution [CVE-2007-4675]. Mario Ballano from 48bits.com reported this vulnerability via iDefense.A movie file with a specially crafted color table atom can trigger arbitrary code execution [CVE-2007-4677]. Ruben Santamarta of reversemode.com and Mario Ballano of 48bits.com reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint.
CVE-2007-3750.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-3752.title: iTunes Buffer Overflow in Processing Album Cover Artwork Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-3752.body: A vulnerability was reported in iTunes. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted music file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.David Thiel of iSEC Partners reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3752.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-3753.title: Apple iPhone Bugs Let Remote Users Dial Phone Numbers, Execute Arbitrary Code, and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-3753.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Apple iPhone. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user within Bluetooth networking range can send specially crafted Service Discovery Protocol packets to a Bluetooth-enabled device to trigger an input validation vulnerability and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2007-3753].Kevin Mahaffey and John Hering of Flexilis Mobile Security reported this vulnerability.The Mail application will not notify the user if the identity of the mail server has changed or is untrusted [CVE-2007-3754]. A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack without detection.A remote user can send mail with a 'tel:' link that, when loaded by the target user, will dial a telephone call without user confirmation [CVE-2007-3755].Andi Baritchi of McAfee reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2007-3758, CVE-2007-3760, CVE-2007-3761]. The code will originate from an arbitrary site and run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Michal Zalewski of Google Inc. reported two of these vulnerabilities and Secunia separately reported one vulnerability.A remote user can create HTML with a specially crafted 'tel:' link that, when loaded by the target user, will dial a different telephone number than displayed when confirmation is requested [CVE-2007-3757].Billy Hoffman and Bryan Sullivan of HP Security Labs (Formerly SPI Labs) and Eduardo Tang separately reported this vulnerability.When the user disabled JavaScript, the change does not take effect until Safari is restarted [CVE-2007-3759].A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, can access or manipulate the contents of documents served over HTTPS connections in the same domain [CVE-2007-4671].Keigo Yamazaki of Little eArth Corporation Co., Ltd. reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-3753.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can conduct man-in-the-middle attacks.A remote user can cause different telephone numbers to be dialed.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with an arbitrary site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can obtain the URL of a parent window.
