CVE-2007-4271.title: IBM DB2 Multiple Bugs Let Local Users Gain Root Privileges
CVE-2007-4271.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in IBM DB2. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can create a symbolic link (symlink) from a critical file on the system to files used by DB2 after DB2 has checked to see if a symlink exists and before the symlinked file is processed to modify arbitrary files with root privileges [CVE-2007-4270].A local user can modify a certain environment variable to trigger a directory traversal flaw and cause some DB2 binaries to create arbitrary files on the target system [CVE-2007-4271].A local user can set certain combinations of environment variables to cause some DB2 binaries to create arbitrary files on the target system or append to arbitrary files [CVE-2007-4272].A local user can cause certain DB2 binaries to create world-writable directories [CVE-2007-4273].A local user can exploit search path vulnerabilities to cause DB2 to load an alternate binary or library [CVE-2007-4275].A local user can set an environment variable to a specially crafted value to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2007-4276].The vendor was notified on March 22 and 23, 2007.The original advisories are available at:http://labs.idefense.com/intelligence/vulnerabilities/display.php?id=578http://labs.idefense.com/intelligence/vulnerabilities/display.php?id=579http://labs.idefense.com/intelligence/vulnerabilities/display.php?id=580http://labs.idefense.com/intelligence/vulnerabilities/display.php?id=581http://labs.idefense.com/intelligence/vulnerabilities/display.php?id=582http://labs.idefense.com/intelligence/vulnerabilities/display.php?id=583
CVE-2007-4271.extra: A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-4276.title: IBM DB2 Multiple Bugs Let Local Users Gain Root Privileges
CVE-2007-4276.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in IBM DB2. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can create a symbolic link (symlink) from a critical file on the system to files used by DB2 after DB2 has checked to see if a symlink exists and before the symlinked file is processed to modify arbitrary files with root privileges [CVE-2007-4270].A local user can modify a certain environment variable to trigger a directory traversal flaw and cause some DB2 binaries to create arbitrary files on the target system [CVE-2007-4271].A local user can set certain combinations of environment variables to cause some DB2 binaries to create arbitrary files on the target system or append to arbitrary files [CVE-2007-4272].A local user can cause certain DB2 binaries to create world-writable directories [CVE-2007-4273].A local user can exploit search path vulnerabilities to cause DB2 to load an alternate binary or library [CVE-2007-4275].A local user can set an environment variable to a specially crafted value to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2007-4276].The vendor was notified on March 22 and 23, 2007.The original advisories are available at:http://labs.idefense.com/intelligence/vulnerabilities/display.php?id=578http://labs.idefense.com/intelligence/vulnerabilities/display.php?id=579http://labs.idefense.com/intelligence/vulnerabilities/display.php?id=580http://labs.idefense.com/intelligence/vulnerabilities/display.php?id=581http://labs.idefense.com/intelligence/vulnerabilities/display.php?id=582http://labs.idefense.com/intelligence/vulnerabilities/display.php?id=583
CVE-2007-4276.extra: A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-4277.title: Trend Micro Scan Engine Buffer Overflow in 'Tmxpflt.sys' Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-4277.body: A vulnerability was reported in Trend Micro's Scan Engine. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can write to the '\\.\Tmfilter' device interface and trigger a buffer overflow to execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel level privileges.Client Server Messaging Security for SMB, Client Server Security for SMB, OfficeScan, and ServerProtect are affected.The vendor was notified on August 6, 2007.Ruben Santamarta of reversemode.com reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2007-4277.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-4278.title: ArcSDE Buffer Overflow in giomgr Process Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-4278.body: A vulnerability was reported in ArcSDE. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted numeric values to TCP port 5151 to trigger a buffer overflow and cause the target giomgr process to crash.A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code. However, the report did not confirm code execution.The vendor was notified on May 14, 2007.The original advisory is available at:http://labs.idefense.com/intelligence/vulnerabilities/display.php?id=577
CVE-2007-4278.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-4286.title: Cisco IOS Next Hop Resolution Protocol (NHRP) Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service or Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4286.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the Next Hop Resolution Protocol (NHRP) implementation. A remote user can cause the target device to restart or potentially execute arbitrary code.This can be exploited at the link layer, over GRE or mGRE tunnels, and directly via IP.Only devices configured for NHRP functionality are affected. NHRP is not enabled by default.Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCin95836 and CSCsi23231 to this vulnerability.Martin Kluge discovered this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4286.extra: A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target device.A remote user can cause the target device to restart.

CVE-2007-4324.title: Adobe Flash Player Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Scan Ports, and Conduct HTTP Request Splitting and Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-4324.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Flash Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting and request splitting attacks. A remote user can conduct port scans via the player.A remote user can create specially crafted Flash content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-4768, CVE-2007-6242, CVE-2007-6246]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user. Tavis Ormandy and Will Drewry of the Google Security Team, Aaron Portnoy of TippingPoint DVLabs, and Jesse Michael and Thomas Biege of SUSE reported these vulnerabilities.A remote user can conduct DNS rebinding attacks [CVE-2007-5275]. Dan Boneh, Adam Barth, Andrew Bortz, Collin Jackson, and Weidong Shao of Stanford University reported this vulnerability.Some SWF files do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2007-6244]. A remote user can create a specially crafted content using the asfunction: protocol that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. Flash Player 7 is not affected. Rich Cannings of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.The navigateToURL() function does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2007-6244]. Only systems with the Flash Player ActiveX Control and Internet Explorer are affected. Collin Jackson and Adam Barth of Stanford University reported this vulnerability.A remote user can conduct privilege escalation attacks against target web servers hosting Flash content and cross-domain policy files [CVE-2007-6243]. Toshiharu Sugiyama of UBsecure, Inc. and JPCERT/CC reported this vulnerability.A remote user can modify the HTTP headers of a request to conduct HTTP request splitting attacks [CVE-2007-6245]. Toshiharu Sugiyama of UBsecure, Inc. and JPCERT/CC reported this vulnerability.A remote user can cause the target user's Flash Player to conduct port scans [CVE-2007-4324].
CVE-2007-4324.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can execute scripting code in the context of arbitrary sites.A remote user can cause the target user's Flash Player to conduct port scans against arbitrary hosts.

CVE-2007-4337.title: Streamripper Buffer Overflows in httplib_parse_sc_header() Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4337.body: A vulnerability was reported in Streamripper. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote server can send specially crafted HTTP headers to trigger one of several buffer overflows and execute arbitrary code on the target system.The httplib_parse_sc_header() function in 'lib/http.c' is affected.
CVE-2007-4337.extra: A remote server can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the connected target system.

CVE-2007-4346.title: Symantec Backup Exec for Windows Servers Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-4346.body: Some vulnerabilities were reported in Symantec Backup Exec for Windows Servers. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the target Backup Exec for Windows Servers Job Engine service to trigger a null pointer dereference or an integer overflow. The target service may crash or enter an infinite loop.JJ Reyes of Secunia Research reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-4346.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to crash or enter an infinite loop and become unavailable.

CVE-2007-4347.title: Symantec Backup Exec for Windows Servers Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-4347.body: Some vulnerabilities were reported in Symantec Backup Exec for Windows Servers. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the target Backup Exec for Windows Servers Job Engine service to trigger a null pointer dereference or an integer overflow. The target service may crash or enter an infinite loop.JJ Reyes of Secunia Research reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-4347.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to crash or enter an infinite loop and become unavailable.

CVE-2007-4348.title: IBM Tivoli Storage Manager Input Validation Hole in CAD Service Permits Script Injection Attacks
CVE-2007-4348.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Tivoli Storage Manager. A remote user can conduct script injection attacks.The CAD service does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before writing the input to the 'dsmerror.log' file. A remote user can submit a specially crafted request. When the target user subsequently views the log file, arbitrary scripting code will be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Storage Manager software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor was notified on October 10, 2007.Carsten Eiram of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4348.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Storage Manager software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-4350.title: HP SiteScope Input Validation Hole in Displaying SNMP Traps Permits Script Injection Attacks
CVE-2007-4350.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP SiteScope. A remote user can conduct script injection attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied SNMP traps before displaying the input. A remote user can send a specially crafted SNMP trap request that, when viewed by a target user via the web interface, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the HP SiteScope software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor was notified on October 15, 2007.Dyon Balding of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4350.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the HP SiteScope software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-4351.title: CUPS Buffer Overflow in ippReadIO() Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4351.body: A vulnerability was reported in CUPS (Common UNIX Printing System). A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted IPP tags to trigger a buffer overflow in ippReadIO() and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The "textWithLanguage" and "nameWithLanguage" tags are affected.The vulnerability resides in 'cups/ipp.c'.Alin Rad Pop of the Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4351.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-4368.title: Rational ClearQuest Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands to Bypass Authentication
CVE-2007-4368.body: A vulnerability was reported in Rational ClearQuest. A remote user can inject SQL commands.The login page does not properly validate user-supplied input in the username field. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database. This can be exploited to bypass authentication.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]/cqweb/main?command=GenerateMainFrame&ratl_userdb=DATABASENAMEHERE,&test=&clientServerAddress=http://SERVERNAMEHERE/cqweb/login&username='INJECTIONGOESHERE&password=PASSWORDHERE&schema=SCHEMEAHERE&userDb=DATABASENAMEHEREsasquatch and rel1k of SecureState reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4368.extra: A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database. This can be exploited to bypass authentication.

CVE-2007-4390.title: Adonis Command Line Interface Lets Local Administrative Users Gain Root Privileges
CVE-2007-4390.body: A vulnerability was reported in Adonis. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.A local administrative user can enter a certain command sequence via the command line interface to execute a command with root privileges.A demonstration exploit is provided:set host-name ;bashadonis.katter.orgOther command sequences may also be affected.forloop of Template Security discovered this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4390.extra: A local administrative user can obtain root privileges on the target device.

CVE-2007-4391.title: Yahoo Messenger Heap Overflow in Processing Webcam Streams Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4391.body: A vulnerability was reported in Yahoo Messenger. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted Webcam data to the target user (after the target user has accepted a webcam invitation from the remote user) to trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vulnerability resides in version 3.2.0.2 of 'kdv_v32M.dll' and version 2.0.1.9 of 'ywcvwr.dll.Blocking outbound connections destined for TCP port 5100 may prevent the vulnerability from being exploited by blocking Yahoo Messenger webcam connections.
CVE-2007-4391.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-4423.title: IBM DB2 Buffer Overflow in auth_list_groups_for_authid() Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4423.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM DB2. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow in the auth_list_groups_for_authid() function and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.On Windows-based systems, the code will run with Administrator privileges.A value longer than 40 bytes can trigger the overflow.Ariel Sanchez of Application Security Inc. discovered this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.appsecinc.com/resources/alerts/db2/2007-01.shtml
CVE-2007-4423.extra: A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-4430.title: Cisco IOS Stack Overflow in Processing IP BGP Regex Commands Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-4430.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote authenticated user can cause the target device to crash and reload.A remote authenticated user can execute a specially crafted command line command containing a regular expression to trigger a stack overflow and cause the target device to crash.Regular expressions that use combined repetition operators and pattern recalls can trigger the overflow.A demonstration exploit command is of the following form:ip bgp regexp [regexp]A regular expression used as part of a filter receiving piped output.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsk14633 to this vulnerability.Cisco IOS XR is not affected.The original advisory is available at:http://www.heise.de/newsticker/meldung/94517https://puck.nether.net/pipermail/cisco-nsp/2007-August/043002.htmlSebastian Wiesinger reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4430.extra: A remote authenticated user can cause the target device to crash and reload.

CVE-2007-4440.title: Mercury Mail Transport System AUTH CRAM-MD5 Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4440.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mercury Mail Transport System. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted SMTP AUTH CRAM-MD5 data to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.eliteb0y reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4440.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-4459.title: Cisco 7940/7960 IP Phones Can Be Crashed By Remote Users
CVE-2007-4459.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco 7940/7960 IP Phones. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a sequence of specially crafted messages to cause the target device to reboot.A series of three SIP messages can cause the device to reboot due to a flaw in tracking SIP message state. The vendor was notified in March 2007.A series of ten SIP messages can cause the device to reboot due to a flaw in the SIP stack. The vendor was notified in April 2007.Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsi68191 to this vulnerability.Humberto J. Abdelnur, Radu State, and Olivier Festor discovered these vulnerabilities using the Madynes VoIP fuzzer KIPH.
CVE-2007-4459.extra: A remote user can cause the target device to reboot.

CVE-2007-4465.title: Apache Input Validation Hole in Mod_AutoIndex When the Character Set is Undefined May Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-4465.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apache. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can create a specially crafted request that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Apache software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Pages that are server-generated and do not have a character set defined may be affected.Browsers that do not properly implement RFC2616 may be affected.The original advisory is available at:http://securityreason.com/securityalert/3113Maksymilian Arciemowicz of SecurityReason reported this vulnerability in September 2007.
CVE-2007-4465.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Apache software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-4467.title: Oracle JInitiator ActiveX Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4467.body: A vulnerability was reported in Oracle JInitiator. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the 'beans.ocx' ActvieX control and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CLSID of the vulnerable control is:9b935470-ad4a-11d5-b63e-00c04faedb18The original advisory is available at:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/474433Will Dormann of the CERT/CC reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4467.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-4474.title: IBM Domino Web Access 'dwa7w.dll' ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4474.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Domino Web Access. A remote user may be able to cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will invoke the Domino Web Access Upload Module 'dwa7w.dll' ActiveX control and trigger a buffer overflow to potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The report did not confirm code execution.The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: E008A543-CEFB-4559-912F-C27C2B89F13BElazar Broad reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4474.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, may potentially execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-4496.title: VMware Lets Local Users Gain Privileges or Cause Denial of Service Conditions on the Host System
CVE-2007-4496.body: Some vulnerabilities were reported in VMware. A local user on a guest operating system can obtain elevated privileges on the host operating system. A local user on a guest operating system can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.A local user with administrative privileges on a guest operating system can trigger a memory corruption error in a host process and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-4496].A local user on a guest operating system can cause a host process to become unresponsive or crash [CVE-2007-4497].A local user can exploit an unquoted Windows search path in the Authorization service and other services to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges [CVE-2007-5618].VMware ESX 2.0.2, 2.1.3, 2.5.3, 2.5.4, 3.0.0, and 3.0.1 are affected. VMware ESX 3.0.2 is not affected.VMware ACE 1.0.3 and 2.0.0 are affected. VMware Server 1.0.3 is affected. VMware Player 1.0.4 and 2.0.0 are affected. VMware Workstation 5.5.4 and 6.0.0 are affected. Rafal Wojtczvk of McAfee reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-4496.extra: A local user on a guest operating system can obtain elevated privileges on the host operating system.A local user on a guest operating system can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

CVE-2007-4497.title: VMware Lets Local Users Gain Privileges or Cause Denial of Service Conditions on the Host System
CVE-2007-4497.body: Some vulnerabilities were reported in VMware. A local user on a guest operating system can obtain elevated privileges on the host operating system. A local user on a guest operating system can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.A local user with administrative privileges on a guest operating system can trigger a memory corruption error in a host process and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-4496].A local user on a guest operating system can cause a host process to become unresponsive or crash [CVE-2007-4497].A local user can exploit an unquoted Windows search path in the Authorization service and other services to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges [CVE-2007-5618].VMware ESX 2.0.2, 2.1.3, 2.5.3, 2.5.4, 3.0.0, and 3.0.1 are affected. VMware ESX 3.0.2 is not affected.VMware ACE 1.0.3 and 2.0.0 are affected. VMware Server 1.0.3 is affected. VMware Player 1.0.4 and 2.0.0 are affected. VMware Workstation 5.5.4 and 6.0.0 are affected. Rafal Wojtczvk of McAfee reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-4497.extra: A local user on a guest operating system can obtain elevated privileges on the host operating system.A local user on a guest operating system can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

CVE-2007-4513.title: IBM AIX Various Application Buffer Overflows Let Local Users Gain Root Privileges
CVE-2007-4513.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in IBM AIX in various applications and utilities. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can invoke bellmail with the 'm' command to trigger a stack overflow in the sendrmt() function and execute arbitrary code with root privileges [CVE-2007-4623]. The vendor was notified on August 28, 2007.A local user with 'system' group privileges can invoke the swcons command with the '-p' command switch to modify arbitrary files on the target system. The vendor was notified on December 21, 2004. The vendor issued a partial fix on February 22, 2007.A local user can invoke crontab with specially crafted command line arguments to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code with root privileges [CVE-2007-4621]. The vendor was notified on August 29, 2007.A local user can invoke the dig application with a specially crafted '-y' command line TSIG key parameter to trigger an integer overflow in the dns_name_fromtext() function in the 'libdns.a' library and potentially execute arbitrary code with root privileges [CVE-2007-4622]. The vendor was notified on August 30, 2007. Only AIX version 5.2 is affected.A local user can execute an ftp program macro with the '$' command to trigger a buffer overflow in the domacro() function and execute arbitrary code with root privileges [CVE-2007-4217]. The vendor was notified on August 15, 2007.A local user can invoke the lquerypv command with a specially crafted '-V' command line parameter or the lqueryvg command with a specially crafted '-p' command line parameter to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code with root privileges [CVE-2007-4513]. The vendor was notified on August 21, 2007.A local user can invoke the tftp command to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code with root privileges.Joshua J. Drake of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported the bellmail and ftp vulnerabilities. Alex DeLarge reported the swcons vulnerability via iDefense. Sean Larsson of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported the lquerypv and lqueryvg vulnerabilities. The dig vulnerability was reported via iDefense. IBM reported the tftp vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4513.extra: A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-4514.title: HP ProCurve Manager Bug Lets Remote Users Access Data
CVE-2007-4514.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP ProCurve Manager. A remote user can access data on the target system.A remote user can access data on the target ProCurve Manager server.HP ProCurve Manager Plus is also affected.
CVE-2007-4514.extra: A remote user can access data on the target system.

CVE-2007-4515.title: Yahoo! Messenger Buffer Overflow in ActiveX Control Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4515.body: A vulnerability was reported in Yahoo! Messenger. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: 64AA7031-C150-4118-8D31-FD273A2BB22CiDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4515.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-4516.title: VERITAS Storage Foundation Volume Manager Scheduler Service Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-4516.body: A vulnerability was reported in VERITAS Storage Foundation in the Volume Manager Scheduler Service. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target 'VxSchedService.exe' service to crash.The administrator must restart the service.iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4516.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-4517.title: Oracle Database XDB.XDB_PITRIG_PKG.PITRIG_DROPMETADATA Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4517.body: A vulnerability was reported in Oracle Database. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow in the XDB.XDB_PITRIG_PKG.PITRIG_DROPMETADATA procedure and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target database.Specially crafted OWNER and NAME parameters can trigger the overflow.The vendor was notified on February 1, 2007.The vulnerability was reported via iDefense.
CVE-2007-4517.extra: A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-4539.title: Bugzilla Bugs Let Remote Users Inject Commands, Obtain Restricted Information, and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-4539.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Bugzilla. A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can obtain restricted information.The software does not properly validate user-supplied input to the '-f' option of the Email::Send::Sendmail() function. A remote user can supply a specially crafted URL to cause the target system to execute arbitrary commands. The code will run with the privileges of the target web service.The guided form does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'buildid' parameter before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Bugzilla software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can invoke the WebService (XML-RPC) interface to access the time-tracking fields of all bugs, even if the user is not permitted to access the fields.
CVE-2007-4539.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary commands with the privileges of the target web service.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Bugzilla software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can obtain restricted information.

CVE-2007-4543.title: Bugzilla Bugs Let Remote Users Inject Commands, Obtain Restricted Information, and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-4543.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Bugzilla. A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can obtain restricted information.The software does not properly validate user-supplied input to the '-f' option of the Email::Send::Sendmail() function. A remote user can supply a specially crafted URL to cause the target system to execute arbitrary commands. The code will run with the privileges of the target web service.The guided form does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'buildid' parameter before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Bugzilla software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can invoke the WebService (XML-RPC) interface to access the time-tracking fields of all bugs, even if the user is not permitted to access the fields.
CVE-2007-4543.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary commands with the privileges of the target web service.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Bugzilla software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can obtain restricted information.

CVE-2007-4560.title: Clam AntiVirus clamav-milter for sendmail Unsafe popen() Call Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4560.body: A vulnerability was reported in Clam AntiVirus in clamav-milter when used with sendmail. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.clamav-milter makes an unsafe popen() function call. A remote user can create an e-mail message with a specially crafted recipient address. When the message is processed by the target system, arbitrary code will be executed with root privileges.If clamav-milter was started with the black hole mode activated, the system is vulnerable.The vendor was notified on August 10, 2007.Nikolaos Rangos of n.runs AG discovered this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4560.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with root privileges.

CVE-2007-4561.title: Helix DNA Server RTSP Require Header Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4561.body: A vulnerability was reported in Helix DNA Server. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted RTSP data with multiple Require headers to trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The vendor was notified on April 6, 2007.The Mu Security research team discovered this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4561.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-4566.title: SIDVault Login Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4566.body: Joxean Koret reported a vulnerability in SIDVault. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the login mechanism to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service (root or System privileges).
CVE-2007-4566.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-4568.title: X Font Server Overflows in QueryXBitmaps and QueryXExtents Requests Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4568.body: A vulnerability was reported in X.org's X Font Server. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target X Font Server.Specially crafted QueryXBitmaps and QueryXExtents protocol requests can trigger an integer overflow.Specially crafted QueryXBitmaps and QueryXExtents protocol requests can trigger a heap overflow.On some systems, this vulnerability cannot be exploited remotely, depending on whether the X Font Server listens to a network port or not.The vendor was notified on September 5, 2007.Sean Larsson of VeriSign iDefense Labs discovered these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-4568.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-4569.title: KDE Autologin Authentication Bug May Let Remote Users Login Without a Password
CVE-2007-4569.body: A vulnerability was reported in KDE. A remote user can gain access to the target system.A remote user may be able to login without a password when autologin is configured and 'shutdown with password' is enabled.Kees Huijgen reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4569.extra: A remote user can gain access to the target system.

CVE-2007-4572.title: Samba nmbd Buffer Overflow in Processing GETDC mailslot Requests Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4572.body: A vulnerability was reported in Samba. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted GETDC mailslot requests to trigger a buffer overflow in nmbd and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The vendor discovered this vulnerability on September 13, 2007.
CVE-2007-4572.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-4573.title: Linux Kernel IA32 System Call Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-4573.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Linux Kernel, affecting the x86_64 architecture. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.The IA32 system call emulation function on AMD64 and Intel 64 platforms does not properly validate the %RAX register. A local user may be able to exploit this to access the system call table and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.The vendor was notified on September 18, 2007.Wojciech Purczynski of COSEINC PTE Ltd. and iSEC Security Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4573.extra: A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-4575.title: OpenOffice Bug in HSQLDB Database Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Java Code
CVE-2007-4575.body: A vulnerability was reported in OpenOffice. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will exploit a flaw in the included HSQLDB database and execute arbitrary Java code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.
CVE-2007-4575.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary Java code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-4577.title: Sophos Anti-Virus UPX Processing Bug May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and GZip Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-4577.body: A vulnerability was reported in Sophos Anti-Virus. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create a specially crafted UPX file that, when loaded by the target user, will potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted GZip file to cause the target service to enter an infinite loop.The vendor was notified on May 7, 2007.Sergio Alvarez of n.runs AG discovered this vulnerability.[Editor's note: The vendor's advisory indicates that the impact is limited to denial of service.]
CVE-2007-4577.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when processed by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-4578.title: Sophos Anti-Virus UPX Processing Bug May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and GZip Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-4578.body: A vulnerability was reported in Sophos Anti-Virus. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create a specially crafted UPX file that, when loaded by the target user, will potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted GZip file to cause the target service to enter an infinite loop.The vendor was notified on May 7, 2007.Sergio Alvarez of n.runs AG discovered this vulnerability.[Editor's note: The vendor's advisory indicates that the impact is limited to denial of service.]
CVE-2007-4578.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when processed by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-4592.title: Rational ClearQuest Input Validation Holes Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-4592.body: A vulnerability was reported in Rational ClearQuest. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Rational ClearQuest software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The 'contextid', 'schema', 'userNameVal', and 'username' parameters are affected.sasquatch of SecureState reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4592.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Rational ClearQuest software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-4599.title: RealPlayer Buffer Overflows in Processing MP3, RM, SWF, RAM, and PLS Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4599.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in RealPlayer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted MP3, RM, SWF, RAM, or PLS file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.John Heasman of NGS Software, Piotr Bania, and anonymous researchers working with TippingPoint reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-4599.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-4619.title: FLAC Integer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4619.body: A vulnerability was reported in Free Lossless Audio Codec (FLAC). A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted FLAC media file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer overflow in libFLAC and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Winamp is also affected.The vendor was notified on August 29, 2007.Sean de Regge reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2007-4619.extra: A remote user can create a FLAC media file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-4620.title: CA Threat Manager Buffer Overflows in 'Alert.exe' Let Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4620.body: A vulnerability was reported in CA Threat Manager in the Alert Notification Server. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.Several procedures are affected.CA Anti-Virus for the Enterprise is also affected.An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2007-4620.extra: A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-4620.title: BrightStor ARCserve Backup Buffer Overflows in 'Alert.exe' Let Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4620.body: A vulnerability was reported in BrightStor ARCserve Backup. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.Several procedures are affected.CA Anti-Virus for the Enterprise is also affected.An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2007-4620.extra: A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-4621.title: IBM AIX Various Application Buffer Overflows Let Local Users Gain Root Privileges
CVE-2007-4621.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in IBM AIX in various applications and utilities. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can invoke bellmail with the 'm' command to trigger a stack overflow in the sendrmt() function and execute arbitrary code with root privileges [CVE-2007-4623]. The vendor was notified on August 28, 2007.A local user with 'system' group privileges can invoke the swcons command with the '-p' command switch to modify arbitrary files on the target system. The vendor was notified on December 21, 2004. The vendor issued a partial fix on February 22, 2007.A local user can invoke crontab with specially crafted command line arguments to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code with root privileges [CVE-2007-4621]. The vendor was notified on August 29, 2007.A local user can invoke the dig application with a specially crafted '-y' command line TSIG key parameter to trigger an integer overflow in the dns_name_fromtext() function in the 'libdns.a' library and potentially execute arbitrary code with root privileges [CVE-2007-4622]. The vendor was notified on August 30, 2007. Only AIX version 5.2 is affected.A local user can execute an ftp program macro with the '$' command to trigger a buffer overflow in the domacro() function and execute arbitrary code with root privileges [CVE-2007-4217]. The vendor was notified on August 15, 2007.A local user can invoke the lquerypv command with a specially crafted '-V' command line parameter or the lqueryvg command with a specially crafted '-p' command line parameter to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code with root privileges [CVE-2007-4513]. The vendor was notified on August 21, 2007.A local user can invoke the tftp command to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code with root privileges.Joshua J. Drake of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported the bellmail and ftp vulnerabilities. Alex DeLarge reported the swcons vulnerability via iDefense. Sean Larsson of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported the lquerypv and lqueryvg vulnerabilities. The dig vulnerability was reported via iDefense. IBM reported the tftp vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4621.extra: A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

The vendor was notified on December 21, 2004. The vendor issued a partial fix on February 22, 2007.A local user can invoke crontab with specially crafted command line arguments to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code with root privileges [CVE-2007-4621]. The vendor was notified on August 29, 2007.A local user can invoke the dig application with a specially crafted '-y' command line TSIG key parameter to trigger an integer overflow in the dns_name_fromtext() function in the 'libdns.a' library and potentially execute arbitrary code with root privileges [CVE-2007-4622]. The vendor was notified on August 30, 2007. Only AIX version 5.2 is affected.A local user can execute an ftp program macro with the '$' command to trigger a buffer overflow in the domacro() function and execute arbitrary code with root privileges [CVE-2007-4217]. The vendor was notified on August 15, 2007.A local user can invoke the lquerypv command with a specially crafted '-V' command line parameter or the lqueryvg command with a specially crafted '-p' command line parameter to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code with root privileges [CVE-2007-4513]. The vendor was notified on August 21, 2007.A local user can invoke the tftp command to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code with root privileges.Joshua J. Drake of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported the bellmail and ftp vulnerabilities. Alex DeLarge reported the swcons vulnerability via iDefense. Sean Larsson of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported the lquerypv and lqueryvg vulnerabilities. The dig vulnerability was reported via iDefense. IBM reported the tftp vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4623.extra: A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-4633.title: Cisco CallManager/Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Holes Permit Cross-Site Scripting and SQL Injection Attacks
CVE-2007-4633.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco CallManager/Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can inject SQL commands.The admin and user logon pages do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'lang' parameter.A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsi64265 to this vulnerability.A remote user can also create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco CallManager software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsi10728 to this vulnerability.Gama SEC and Elliot Kendall from Brandeis University separately reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4633.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco CallManager software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2007-4646.title: Hexamail Server Buffer Overflow in POP3 USER Command May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4646.body: A vulnerability was reported in Hexamail Server. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted POP3 USER value to trigger a buffer overflow and cause the service to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system.A demonstration exploit is available at:http://milw0rm.com/exploits/4344rgod reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4646.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-4648.title: Norman Virus Control nvcoaft51.sys Driver Bugs Let Local Users Gain System Privileges
CVE-2007-4648.body: A vulnerability was reported in Norman Virus Control. A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.A local user can invoke the nvcoaft51 driver to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with kernel-level privileges.The driver creates a device named NvcOa without a restrictive security descriptor. A local user can send arbitrary data to the device, which does not properly validate some user-supplied input.A demonstration exploit is available at:http://www.48bits.com/exploits/nvc.rarInocraM of 48Bits I+D Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4648.extra: A local user can obtain kernel-level privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-4651.title: Adobe Connect Enterprise Server Discloses Administrative Pages to Remote Users
CVE-2007-4651.body: A vulnerability was reported in Adobe Connect Enterprise Server. A remote user can view administrative pages on the target system.A remote user can exploit an input validation flaw to view certain administrator-only pages.Acrobat Connect and Acrobat Connect Professional Hosted customers are not affected.
CVE-2007-4651.extra: A remote user can view certain administrator-only pages.

CVE-2007-4656.title: Backup Manager Discloses the Upload Site's FTP Password to Local Users
CVE-2007-4656.body: A vulnerability was reported in Backup Manager. A local user can view certain passwords.When an FTP upload is in progress, a local user can view the process list to view the FTP username and password for the target upload site.Micha Lenk reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4656.extra: A local user can view FTP passwords.

CVE-2007-4671.title: Apple iPhone Bugs Let Remote Users Dial Phone Numbers, Execute Arbitrary Code, and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-4671.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Apple iPhone. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user within Bluetooth networking range can send specially crafted Service Discovery Protocol packets to a Bluetooth-enabled device to trigger an input validation vulnerability and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2007-3753].Kevin Mahaffey and John Hering of Flexilis Mobile Security reported this vulnerability.The Mail application will not notify the user if the identity of the mail server has changed or is untrusted [CVE-2007-3754]. A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack without detection.A remote user can send mail with a 'tel:' link that, when loaded by the target user, will dial a telephone call without user confirmation [CVE-2007-3755].Andi Baritchi of McAfee reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2007-3758, CVE-2007-3760, CVE-2007-3761]. The code will originate from an arbitrary site and run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Michal Zalewski of Google Inc. reported two of these vulnerabilities and Secunia separately reported one vulnerability.A remote user can create HTML with a specially crafted 'tel:' link that, when loaded by the target user, will dial a different telephone number than displayed when confirmation is requested [CVE-2007-3757].Billy Hoffman and Bryan Sullivan of HP Security Labs (Formerly SPI Labs) and Eduardo Tang separately reported this vulnerability.When the user disabled JavaScript, the change does not take effect until Safari is restarted [CVE-2007-3759].A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, can access or manipulate the contents of documents served over HTTPS connections in the same domain [CVE-2007-4671].Keigo Yamazaki of Little eArth Corporation Co., Ltd. reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4671.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can conduct man-in-the-middle attacks.A remote user can cause different telephone numbers to be dialed.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with an arbitrary site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can obtain the URL of a parent window.

CVE-2007-4672.title: QuickTime Movie/PICT/QTVR/Java Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4672.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in QuickTime. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A movie with a specially crafted image description atom can trigger code execution [CVE-2007-2395]. Dylan Ashe of Adobe Systems Incorporated reported this vulnerability.A movie with specially crafted Sample Table Sample Descriptor (STSD) atoms can trigger code execution [CVE-2007-3750]. Tobias Klein of www.trapkit.de reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted Java applet can obtain potentially sensitive information or execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges on the target user's system [CVE-2007-3751]. Adam Gowdiak for reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted PICT image can trigger arbitrary code execution [CVE-2007-4672, CVE-2007-4676]. Ruben Santamarta of reversemode.com reported these vulnerabilities via TippingPoint.A movie file with a specially crafted movie atom can trigger arbitrary code execution [CVE-2007-4674]. Cody Pierce of TippingPoint DVLabs reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted QTVR movie can trigger arbitrary code execution [CVE-2007-4675]. Mario Ballano from 48bits.com reported this vulnerability via iDefense.A movie file with a specially crafted color table atom can trigger arbitrary code execution [CVE-2007-4677]. Ruben Santamarta of reversemode.com and Mario Ballano of 48bits.com reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint.
CVE-2007-4672.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-4679.title: Mac OS X Kernel and Networking Bugs Let Remote and Local Users Deny Service or Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4679.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X. A remote or local user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote or local user can cause denial of service conditions.A user can create a specially crafted disk image that, when mounted by the target user, will trigger a null pointer dereference in AppleRAID and cause the system to shutdown [CVE-2007-4678]. Mark Tull of SSAM1 at University of Hertfordshire and Joel Vink of Zetera Corporation reported this vulnerability.A remote user can send specially crafted replies to the target user's client FTP PASV commands to cause the target user's client to connect to arbitrary hosts [CVE-2007-4679]. Dr. Bob Lopez, PhD, reported this vulnerability.A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack against a target user and target site with a valid SSL certificate and then redirect the target user to an arbitrary site that appears to be trusted but is not [CVE-2007-4680]. Marko Karppinen, Petteri Kamppuri, and Nikita Zhuk of MK&C reported this vulnerability.A local user can read a specially crafted directory hierarchy to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2007-4681].A remote user can create specially crafted text content that, when viewed by the target user, will trigger an uninitialized pointer flaw and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2007-4682]. Will Dormann of the CERT/CC reported this vulnerability.A local user running a chrooted process can access arbitrary files by changing the working directory using a relative path [CVE-2007-4683]. Johan Henselmans and Jesper Skov reported this vulnerability.A local user can trigger an an integer overflow in the i386_set_ldt() system call to execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2007-4684]. RISE Security reported this vulnerability.A local user can execute a set user id (setuid) program with standard file descriptors to execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2007-4685]. Ilja van Sprundel formerly of Suresec Inc. reported this vulnerability.A local user can issue a specially crafted ioctl request to cause the system to shutdown or execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2007-4686]. Tobias Klein of www.trapkit.de reported this vulnerability.The '/private/tftpboot/private' directory contains a symbolic link to the root directory by default. If tftpd is enabled on the target system, a TFTP client can access any path on the target system [CVE-2007-4687]. James P. Javery of Stratus Data Systems, Inc. reported this vulnerability.A remote user can exploit a flaw in the Node Information Query mechanism to query for all addresses of the target host, including link-local addresses [CVE-2007-4688]. Arnaud Ebalard of EADS Innovation Works reported this vulnerability.A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 packets to trigger a double free flaw and execute arbitrary code or cause the system to shutdown [CVE-2007-4689]. Bhavesh Davda of VMware and Brian "chort" Keefer of Tumbleweed Communications reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will exploit a case sensitive comparison bug in NSURL and potentially execute local applications or applications on network volumes with providing the target user with appropriate warning [CVE-2007-4691].If AppleTalk is enabled and configured for routing mode, a local user can send a specially crafted ioctl request to an AppleTalk socket to trigger a stack overflow or memory allocation error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-4267]. This vulnerability was reported via VeriSign iDefense.If AppleTalk is enabled, a local user can trigger a heap overflow or integer overflow and execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2007-4268, CVE-2007-4269]. Sean Larsson of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4679.extra: A remote or local user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote or local user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can obtain address information from the target system.

Sean Larsson of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4682.extra: A remote or local user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote or local user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can obtain address information from the target system.

CVE-2007-4683.title: Mac OS X Kernel and Networking Bugs Let Remote and Local Users Deny Service or Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4683.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X. A remote or local user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote or local user can cause denial of service conditions.A user can create a specially crafted disk image that, when mounted by the target user, will trigger a null pointer dereference in AppleRAID and cause the system to shutdown [CVE-2007-4678]. Mark Tull of SSAM1 at University of Hertfordshire and Joel Vink of Zetera Corporation reported this vulnerability.A remote user can send specially crafted replies to the target user's client FTP PASV commands to cause the target user's client to connect to arbitrary hosts [CVE-2007-4679]. Dr. Bob Lopez, PhD, reported this vulnerability.A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack against a target user and target site with a valid SSL certificate and then redirect the target user to an arbitrary site that appears to be trusted but is not [CVE-2007-4680]. Marko Karppinen, Petteri Kamppuri, and Nikita Zhuk of MK&C reported this vulnerability.A local user can read a specially crafted directory hierarchy to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2007-4681].A remote user can create specially crafted text content that, when viewed by the target user, will trigger an uninitialized pointer flaw and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2007-4682]. Will Dormann of the CERT/CC reported this vulnerability.A local user running a chrooted process can access arbitrary files by changing the working directory using a relative path [CVE-2007-4683]. Johan Henselmans and Jesper Skov reported this vulnerability.A local user can trigger an an integer overflow in the i386_set_ldt() system call to execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2007-4684]. RISE Security reported this vulnerability.A local user can execute a set user id (setuid) program with standard file descriptors to execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2007-4685]. Ilja van Sprundel formerly of Suresec Inc. reported this vulnerability.A local user can issue a specially crafted ioctl request to cause the system to shutdown or execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2007-4686]. Tobias Klein of www.trapkit.de reported this vulnerability.The '/private/tftpboot/private' directory contains a symbolic link to the root directory by default. If tftpd is enabled on the target system, a TFTP client can access any path on the target system [CVE-2007-4687]. James P. Javery of Stratus Data Systems, Inc. reported this vulnerability.A remote user can exploit a flaw in the Node Information Query mechanism to query for all addresses of the target host, including link-local addresses [CVE-2007-4688]. Arnaud Ebalard of EADS Innovation Works reported this vulnerability.A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 packets to trigger a double free flaw and execute arbitrary code or cause the system to shutdown [CVE-2007-4689]. Bhavesh Davda of VMware and Brian "chort" Keefer of Tumbleweed Communications reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will exploit a case sensitive comparison bug in NSURL and potentially execute local applications or applications on network volumes with providing the target user with appropriate warning [CVE-2007-4691].If AppleTalk is enabled and configured for routing mode, a local user can send a specially crafted ioctl request to an AppleTalk socket to trigger a stack overflow or memory allocation error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-4267]. This vulnerability was reported via VeriSign iDefense.If AppleTalk is enabled, a local user can trigger a heap overflow or integer overflow and execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2007-4268, CVE-2007-4269]. Sean Larsson of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4683.extra: A remote or local user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote or local user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can obtain address information from the target system.

CVE-2007-4690.title: NFS AUTH_UNIX RPC Double Free Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4690.body: A vulnerability was reported in NFS. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted AUTH_UNIX RPC call to trigger a double free bug and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.Mac OS X is affected.Alan Newson of NGSSoftware, and Renaud Deraison of Tenable Network Security, Inc. reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4690.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-4693.title: Mac OS X SecurityAgent Lets Physically Local Users Bypass the Screen Saver Password Mechanism
CVE-2007-4693.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X. A physically local user may be able to bypass the screen saver authentication mechanism.A physically local user may be able to send keystrokes to a process on the system that is running behind the screen saver authentication dialog.Faisal N. Jawdat reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4693.extra: A physically local user may be able to bypass the screen saver authentication mechanism.

CVE-2007-4694.title: Mac OS X WebCore/WebKit Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4694.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in the Mac OS X WebCore and WebKit components. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can obtain files or information from the target system. A local user can obtain PDF file data.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will access the content of files on the target user's system [CVE-2007-4694]. lixlpixel reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when uploaded by the target user, can modify the values of form fields [CVE-2007-4695]. Bodo Ruskamp of Itchigo Communications GmbH reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will obtain form data from the target user's system [CVE-2007-4696]. Ryan Grisso of NetSuite reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in the processing of browser history and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2007-4697]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user. David Bloom reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted Javascript that, when loaded by the target user, will execute in the context of another site [CVE-2007-4698].Arbitrary applications can access private keys added to the keychain by Safari [CVE-2007-4699].A remote user can cause the target user's Safari browser to send data specified by the remote user to arbitrary TCP ports [CVE-2007-4700]. Kostas G. Anagnostakis of Institute for Infocomm Research, Singapore, and Spiros Antonatos of FORTH-ICS, Greece reported this vulnerability.The system creates unsafe temporary files when Safari previews a PDF file. A local user can view PDF files of other users [CVE-2007-4701]. Moritz Borgmann of ETH Zurich and Jean-Luc Giraud reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4694.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can obtain files from the target system.A local user can obtain PDF file data.Applications can obtain certain private keys.

CVE-2007-4695.title: Mac OS X WebCore/WebKit Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-4695.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in the Mac OS X WebCore and WebKit components. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can obtain files or information from the target system. A local user can obtain PDF file data.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will access the content of files on the target user's system [CVE-2007-4694]. lixlpixel reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when uploaded by the target user, can modify the values of form fields [CVE-2007-4695]. Bodo Ruskamp of Itchigo Communications GmbH reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will obtain form data from the target user's system [CVE-2007-4696]. Ryan Grisso of NetSuite reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in the processing of browser history and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2007-4697]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user. David Bloom reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted Javascript that, when loaded by the target user, will execute in the context of another site [CVE-2007-4698].Arbitrary applications can access private keys added to the keychain by Safari [CVE-2007-4699].A remote user can cause the target user's Safari browser to send data specified by the remote user to arbitrary TCP ports [CVE-2007-4700]. Kostas G. Anagnostakis of Institute for Infocomm Research, Singapore, and Spiros Antonatos of FORTH-ICS, Greece reported this vulnerability.The system creates unsafe temporary files when Safari previews a PDF file. A local user can view PDF files of other users [CVE-2007-4701]. Moritz Borgmann of ETH Zurich and Jean-Luc Giraud reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-4695.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can obtain files from the target system.A local user can obtain PDF file data.Applications can obtain certain private keys.
