A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted attach, create, or service attach requests to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The following functions are affected:INET_connectSVC_attachisc_attach_databaseisc_create_databaseAdriano Lima and Ramon de Carvalho Valle of RISE Security reported these vulnerabilities.The original advisory is available at:http://risesecurity.org/advisory/RISE-2007003/
CVE-2007-5246.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-5252.title: NetSupport Manager Client Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-5252.body: A vulnerability was reported in NetSupport Manager. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 5405 on the target client to trigger a buffer overflow and cause denial of service conditions.[Editor's note: The report states that remote code execution may be possible. The vendor's advisory states that remote code execution is not possible.]The vendor was notified on September 9, 2007.sxkeebler and r@b13$ of the Digital Defense, Inc. Vulnerability Research Team discovered this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5252.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-5255.title: Google Mini Search Appliance Input Validation Hole in 'ie' Parameter Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-5255.body: A vulnerability was reported in Google Mini Search Appliance. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The device does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'ie' parameter before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Google Mini Search Appliance device and will run in the security context of that device. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]/search?ie=%22%3E%3Cscript%3Ealert(document.cookie)%3C/script%3E&site=x&output=xml_no_dtd'&client=x&proxystylesheet=x'The original advisory is available at:http://websecurity.com.ua/1368/
CVE-2007-5255.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Google Mini Search Appliance device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-5269.title: libpng Chunk Handling Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-5269.body: A vulnerability was reported in libpng. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create a specially crafted image that, when loaded by the target application, will trigger an out-of-bounds read error in certain chunk handlers and cause the target application to crash.The png_handle_pCAL(), png_handle_sCAL(), png_push_read_tEXt(), png_handle_iTXt(), and png_handle_ztXt() functions are affected.George Cook and Jeff Phillips reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5269.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-5275.title: Adobe Flash Player Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Scan Ports, and Conduct HTTP Request Splitting and Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-5275.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Flash Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting and request splitting attacks. A remote user can conduct port scans via the player.A remote user can create specially crafted Flash content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-4768, CVE-2007-6242, CVE-2007-6246]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user. Tavis Ormandy and Will Drewry of the Google Security Team, Aaron Portnoy of TippingPoint DVLabs, and Jesse Michael and Thomas Biege of SUSE reported these vulnerabilities.A remote user can conduct DNS rebinding attacks [CVE-2007-5275]. Dan Boneh, Adam Barth, Andrew Bortz, Collin Jackson, and Weidong Shao of Stanford University reported this vulnerability.Some SWF files do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2007-6244]. A remote user can create a specially crafted content using the asfunction: protocol that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. Flash Player 7 is not affected. Rich Cannings of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.The navigateToURL() function does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2007-6244]. Only systems with the Flash Player ActiveX Control and Internet Explorer are affected. Collin Jackson and Adam Barth of Stanford University reported this vulnerability.A remote user can conduct privilege escalation attacks against target web servers hosting Flash content and cross-domain policy files [CVE-2007-6243]. Toshiharu Sugiyama of UBsecure, Inc. and JPCERT/CC reported this vulnerability.A remote user can modify the HTTP headers of a request to conduct HTTP request splitting attacks [CVE-2007-6245]. Toshiharu Sugiyama of UBsecure, Inc. and JPCERT/CC reported this vulnerability.A remote user can cause the target user's Flash Player to conduct port scans [CVE-2007-4324].
CVE-2007-5275.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can execute scripting code in the context of arbitrary sites.A remote user can cause the target user's Flash Player to conduct port scans against arbitrary hosts.

CVE-2007-5290.title: MailBee WebMail Pro Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-5290.body: A vulnerability was reported in MailBee WebMail Pro. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the MailBee WebMail software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Some demonstration exploit URLs are provided:http://[target]/[PATH]/login.php?mode=[XSS]http://[target]/[PATH]/default.asp?mode=advanced_login&mode2=[XSS]Ivan Sanchez and Maximiliano Soler reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5290.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the MailBee WebMail software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-5302.title: HP System Management Homepage Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-5302.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP System Management Homepage. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the HP System Management Homepage software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Thijs Bosschert (Fox-IT) reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5302.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the HP System Management Homepage software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-5323.title: EMC RepliStor Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5323.body: A vulnerability was reported in EMC RepliStor. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 7144 to trigger a buffer overflow in the RepliStor Server Service and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The vendor was notified on July 20, 2007.Aaron Portnoy reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint.The original advisory is available at:http://dvlabs.tippingpoint.com/advisory/TPTI-07-18
CVE-2007-5323.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-5325.title: CA BrightStor ARCserve Backup Buffer Overflows and Memory Corruption Errors Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5325.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in BrightStor ARCserve Backup. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The Message Engine and AScore.dll components are affected [CVE-2007-5325].The RPC and rpcx.dll components are affected [CVE-2007-5326].The Message Engine is affected [CVE-2007-5327].A remote user can access certain privileged functions [CVE-2007-5328].A remote user can send specially crafted RPC data to trigger memory corruption errors, causing denial of service conditions or potentially executing arbitrary code.The dbasvr component is affected [CVE-2007-5329].The RPC service component is affected [CVE-2007-5330].The lqserver and media server components are affected [CVE-2007-5331].The mediasvr and caloggerd components are affected [CVE-2007-5332].Dyon Balding of Secunia Research, cocoruder of Fortinet Security Research Team, Tenable Network Security, Pedram Amini of DV Labs, eEye Digital Security, shirkdog, and a researcher working with iDefense reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-5325.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-5337.title: Mozilla Firefox May Disclose Files or Information to Remote Users
CVE-2007-5337.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user may be able to obtain certain files or information from the target user's system. A remote user may be able to spoof elements of the browser interface.A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will obtain files or information.OnUnload event handlers can access to the address of certain other pages [CVE-2007-1095]. A remote user can exploit this to obtain bookmarks.A file upload control can be automatically filled out by a remote user to steal known files from the target user's system [CVE-2006-2894, CVE-2007-3511].An XUL markup language page can hide the page window's titlebar [CVE-2007-5334].A remote user can create a page on an SMB share or SFTP site that, when loaded by the target user, will access files on the target system with the privileges of the target user [CVE-2007-5337]. Linux machines with gnome-vfs are affected.Michal Zalewski, hong, Eli Friedman, and Georgi Guninski reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-5337.extra: A remote user obtain certain files or information from the target user's system.A remote user can spoof elements of the browser interface.

CVE-2007-5338.title: Mozilla Firefox XPCNativeWraper Modification Via Script Object Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5338.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user. HTML that that invokes the Script object can modify XPCNativeWrappers so that, when the target user subsequently executes a chrome function, arbitrary Javascript can be executed.This vulnerability is similar to MFSA 2007-25 (CVE-2007-3738; Alert ID 1018414).moz_bug_r_a4 reproted this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5338.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5339.title: Mozilla Thunderbird Memory Corruption Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5339.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Thunderbird. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML e-mail that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger memory corruption errors in the browser or Javascript engine and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.L. David Baron, Boris Zbarsky, Georgi Guninski, Paul Nickerson, Olli Pettay, Jesse Ruderman, Vladimir Sukhoy, Daniel Veditz, Martijn Wargers, Igor Bukanov, and Eli Friedman reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-5339.extra: A remote user can create an e-mail that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

David Baron, Boris Zbarsky, Georgi Guninski, Paul Nickerson, Olli Pettay, Jesse Ruderman, Vladimir Sukhoy, Daniel Veditz, Martijn Wargers, Igor Bukanov, and Eli Friedman reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-5340.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5344.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Object Access Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5344.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vulnerabilities can be triggered by HTML that accesses objects that have not been initialized or have been deleted and by HTML that makes certain unexpected method calls to HTML objects.Peter Vreugdenhil, Sam Thomas, and an anonymous researcher reported these vulnerabilities via iDefense and/or TippingPoint.
CVE-2007-5344.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5347.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Object Access Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5347.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vulnerabilities can be triggered by HTML that accesses objects that have not been initialized or have been deleted and by HTML that makes certain unexpected method calls to HTML objects.Peter Vreugdenhil, Sam Thomas, and an anonymous researcher reported these vulnerabilities via iDefense and/or TippingPoint.
CVE-2007-5347.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5348.title: Microsoft GDI+ Heap Overflow in Processing Gradient Sizes Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5348.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft GDI+. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create an image file with specially crafted gradient sizes that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Greg MacManus of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5348.extra: A remote user can create an image file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5350.title: Windows Vista Kernel ALPC Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-5350.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Windows Vista kernel. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.The kernel's Windows Advanced Local Procedure Call (ALPC) does not properly validate certain conditions in legacy reply paths. A local user can exploit this to gain elevated privileges on the target system.Thomas Garnier of SkyRecon reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5350.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-5351.title: Windows Vista Server Message Block v2 Signature Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5351.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows Server Message Block. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.The system does not properly compute SMBv2 packet digital signatures. A remote user can modify valid SMBv2 packets to spoof a trusted system and gain access on the target system.
CVE-2007-5351.extra: A remote user can access the target system and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-5352.title: Microsoft Windows LSASS Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-5352.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows in the Local Security Authority Subsystem Service (LSASS). A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.The LSASS service does not properly handle local procedure call (LPC) requests. A local user can send a specially crafted LPC request to execute arbitrary code on the target system with system level privileges.Windows Vista is not affected.Thomas Garnier of SkyRecon reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5352.extra: A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-5358.title: Asterisk IMAP Voicemail Buffer Overflows Let Remote and Local Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5358.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Asterisk. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A local user with write access to the 'asterisk.conf' file can set specially crafted values for the astspooldir parameter in 'asterisk.conf', the voicemail context, and voicemail mailbox to trigger a buffer overflow when a message is played or forwarded.A remote user can set a specially crafted Content-type or Content-description header on an e-mail containing a voicemail message to trigger a buffer overflow when the message is played via a telephone. Voicemail messages received via e-mail are not affected.Systems using IMAP storage are affected by these vulnerabilities.Russell Bryant and Mark Michelson reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-5358.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-5365.title: OpenBSD dhcpd Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5365.body: A vulnerability was reported in dhcpd on OpenBSD. A remote user on the local network can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Other operating systems may be affected.A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted DHCP data to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.A specially crafted maximum message size that is less than the minimum IP MTU can trigger the overflow in dhcpd(8).dhcpd(8) is not enabled by default.Nahuel Riva and Gerardo Richarte of Core Security Technologies reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5365.extra: A remote user on the local network can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-5365.title: Solaris DHCP Daemon Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-5365.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Sun Solaris DHCP daemon. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted DHCP request data to cause the target DHCP service (in.dhcpd(1M)) to crash. The daemon will exit with an "Assertion failed" error message.
CVE-2007-5365.extra: A remote user can cause the DHCP daemon to crash.

CVE-2007-5367.title: Solaris Virtual File System Bug Lets Local Users Consume Kernel Memory
CVE-2007-5367.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Solaris Virtual File System. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can exploit a flaw in VFS to consume all available kernel memory.
CVE-2007-5367.extra: A local user can consume all available kernel memory on the target system.

CVE-2007-5381.title: Cisco IOS LPD Protocol Stack Overflow May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5381.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user with the ability to set the hostname of the router can send specially crafted data to the Line Printer Daemon (LPD) port to trigger a buffer overflow and cause the router to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code.A hostname of longer than 99 characters can trigger the overflow.The system is affected only if the LPD functionality is enabled (not the default configuration).Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID to this vulnerability CSCsj86725.Andy Davis of Information Risk Management (irm) reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.irmplc.com/index.php/155-Advisory-024
CVE-2007-5381.extra: A remote user can cause the target router to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2007-5382.title: Cisco Wireless Control System Conversion Utility Sets Default Administrative Accounts and Passwords
CVE-2007-5382.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless Control System. A remote user can access the target system.When an administrator of the CiscoWorks Wireless LAN Solution Engine (WLSE) uses a Cisco conversion utility to convert to a Cisco Wireless Control System (WCS), the conversion utility creates administrative accounts with default passwords. A Linux root user account and a Cisco WCS root user account are created.A remote user can access the target system using the default passwords.Cisco WCS systems that have not been converted from a CiscoWorks WLSE using the conversion utility are not affected.
CVE-2007-5382.extra: A remote user can gain root or administrative access on the target system.

CVE-2007-5391.title: HP Select Identity Lets Remote Users Gain Access
CVE-2007-5391.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP Select Identity. A remote user can gain access to the target application.A remote user can exploit an unspecified flaw to gain remote access.
CVE-2007-5391.extra: A remote user can gain remote access.

CVE-2007-5392.title: Xpdf Bugs in streams and t1lib Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5392.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Xpdf. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted PDF file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted Type 1 font filename can trigger a flaw in the t1lib library and cause code execution [CVE-2007-4033]Specially crafted data can trigger a memory corruption error in the DCTStream::readProgressiveDataUnit() function in 'xpdf/Stream.cc' [CVE-2007-4352].Specially crafted data can trigger an integer overflow in the DCTStream::reset() function in 'xpdf/Stream.cc' [CVE-2007-5392].A specially crafted CCITTFaxDecode filter can trigger a heap overflow in the CCITTFaxStream::lookChar() function in 'xpdf/Stream.cc' [CVE-2007-5393].The vendor was notified on October 17, 2007.Alin Rad Pop of Secunia Research reported three of these vulnerabilities. r0ut3r discovered one of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-5392.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5393.title: Xpdf Bugs in streams and t1lib Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5393.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Xpdf. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted PDF file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted Type 1 font filename can trigger a flaw in the t1lib library and cause code execution [CVE-2007-4033]Specially crafted data can trigger a memory corruption error in the DCTStream::readProgressiveDataUnit() function in 'xpdf/Stream.cc' [CVE-2007-4352].Specially crafted data can trigger an integer overflow in the DCTStream::reset() function in 'xpdf/Stream.cc' [CVE-2007-5392].A specially crafted CCITTFaxDecode filter can trigger a heap overflow in the CCITTFaxStream::lookChar() function in 'xpdf/Stream.cc' [CVE-2007-5393].The vendor was notified on October 17, 2007.Alin Rad Pop of Secunia Research reported three of these vulnerabilities. r0ut3r discovered one of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-5393.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5394.title: Adobe PageMaker PMD File Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5394.body: A vulnerability was reported in Adobe PageMaker. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted PMD file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted font structure can trigger an overflow. Other overflows may occur.The vendor was notified on October 23, 2007.JJ Reyes of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5394.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5398.title: Samba nmbd Buffer Overflow in reply_netbios_packet() Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5398.body: A vulnerability was reported in Samba. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a series of name registration requests followed by a specially crafted name query request to trigger a buffer overflow in the reply_netbios_packet() function in nmbd and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The system is affected when the WINS server daemon (nmbd) is configured.The vendor was notified on October 30, 2007.Alin Rad Pop of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5398.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-5399.title: IBM Lotus Notes Heap Overflows in EML Reader Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5399.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Lotus Notes in the EML reader. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted e-mail message that, when viewed by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vulnerability resides in 'emlsr.cll' and 'mimesr.dll', depending on the version of Lotus Notes.Certain headers (including "To:", "Cc:", "Bcc:", "From:", "Date:", "Subject:", "Priority:", "Importance:", and "X-MSMail-Priority:") in EML files can trigger a heap overflow.RFC2047 encoded-words in headers can trigger a heap overflow.A filename based on the subject in an EML file can trigger a heap overflow.The vendor was notified on August 11, 2007.The vendor has assigned SPRs PRAD78SMQM and PRAD78SN3A to this vulnerability.Carsten Eiram of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5399.extra: A remote user can create an e-mail message that, when viewed by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5400.title: RealPlayer Heap Overflow in Processing SWF File Frames Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5400.body: A vulnerability was reported in RealPlayer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a Shockwave Flash (SWF) file containing specially crafted frames that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor was notified on November 16, 2007.Real Player Enterprise is also affected.Rhapsody 4 is not afffected.Dyon Balding of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5400.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5405.title: Symantec Mail Security Buffer Overflows in Autonomy KeyView Module Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5405.body: A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Mail Security. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted e-mail attachment to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.On the SMS for SMTP and SMS Appliance, the overflow will result in a child process crash.The vulnerability resides in the third party Autonomy KeyView module.Secunia reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5405.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-5405.title: IBM Lotus Notes Buffer Overflows in Applix Viewer Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5405.body: Some vulnerabilities were reported in IBM Lotus Notes in the processing of Applix documents. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create a specially crafted Applix (.ag) file that, when viewed by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-5405]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted *BEGIN tag and *BEGIN tage ENCODING attribute value can trigger a stack overflow.Specially crafted tokens from an input file can trigger a heap overflow.Specially crafted tokens can cause the software to enter an infinite loop and consume excessive CPU resources [CVE-2007-5406].The vulnerability resides in the third party Autonomy Keyview utility.The vendor has assigned SPR# PRAD79EMMB to this vulnerability.The vendor was notified on November 21, 2007.Dyon Balding of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5405.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when viewed by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can create a file that, when viewed by the target user, will cause the target application to consume excessive CPU resources.

CVE-2007-5413.title: HP OpenView Configuration Management (CM) Infrastructure (Radia) and Client Configuration Manager Lets Remote Users Access Data
CVE-2007-5413.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP OpenView Configuration Management Infrastructure and Client Configuration Manager. A remote user can access files on the target system.A remote user can supply a specially crafted URL containing path names (e.g., '-root') to 'httpd.tkd' to gain access to files on the target system.The vendor was notified on December 18, 2006.TippingPoint reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5413.extra: A remote user can access files on the target system.

CVE-2007-5438.title: VMware Workstation/ACE/Player/Server ActiveX Controls Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5438.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in VMware Workstation/ACE/Player/Server. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will invoke a VMware ActiveX control and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Julien Bachmann, Shennan Wang, Shinnai, and Michal Bucko reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-5438.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5461.title: Tomcat WebDAV Servlet Lets Remote Users View Arbitrary Files
CVE-2007-5461.body: A vulnerability was reported in Tomcat. A remote user can view files on the target system.If a WebDAV servlet is configured and enabled for write, a remote user can supply a specially crafted request containing a SYSTEM tag to view the contents of arbitrary files on the target system.eliteb0y reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5461.extra: A remote user can view the contents of arbitrary files on the target system.

CVE-2007-5462.title: Solaris librpcsvc RPC Bug Lets Remote and Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-5462.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Solaris RPC services library. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can exploit a flaw in librpcsvc(3LIB) and invoke the automountd(1M) service to access a remote NFS server that exports a large number of file systems, causing the automountd(1M) daemon to consume all available stack memory and crash.A remote user on an NFS server that exports a large number of file systems can exploit this flaw to crash the mountd(1M) daemon.
CVE-2007-5462.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

CVE-2007-5472.title: CA Host-Based Intrusion Prevention System Input Validation Hole Permits Script Injection Attacks
CVE-2007-5472.body: A vulnerability was reported in CA Host-Based Intrusion Prevention System. A remote user can conduct script injection attacks.The log viewer does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can submit a specially crafted request. When the target administrative user views the log, arbitrary scripting code will be executed by the target user's browser. The code will run in the security context of the administrative user. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the system, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the system, or take actions on the system acting as the target user.Only the server installation is affected.David Maciejak reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5472.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the CA Host-Based Intrusion Prevention System software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-5488.title: Asterisk-Addons Input Validation Flaw in cdr_addon_mysql Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
CVE-2007-5488.body: A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk-Addons. A remote user can inject SQL commands.The cdr_addon_mysql module does not properly validate user-supplied input in the source and destination numbers within a call. A remote user can supply a specially crafted destination number to an Asterisk system that is running the affected module to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.Humberto Abdelnur reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5488.extra: A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2007-5493.title: Windows Mobile SMS Handler Bug Lets Remote Users Obfuscate SMS Message Source Addresses
CVE-2007-5493.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows Mobile. A remote user can obfuscate the SMS source address.A remote user can send a specially crafted WAP PUSH message to hide the sender of the message as received on Windows Mobile 2005.Ollie Whitehouse of Symantec Vulnerability Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5493.extra: A remote user can obfuscate the SMS source address.

CVE-2007-5494.title: Red Hat Content Accelerator Kernel Patch open(O_ATOMICLOOKUP) Function Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-5494.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Red Hat Content Accelerator kernel patch. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can trigger a memory leak in the open(O_ATOMICLOOKUP) function and consume all available memory on the target system.Vasily Averin reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5494.extra: A local user can consume all available memory on the target system.

CVE-2007-5496.title: SETroubleShoot Input Validation Hole Permits Local Scripting Code Injection Attacks
CVE-2007-5496.body: A vulnerability was reported in SETroubleShoot. A local user can inject scripting code.The 'sealert' utility does not properly filter HTML code from the setroubleshoot database before displaying the input. A local user can trigger AVC denial events with specially crafted file or process names containing HTML code. When the target user runs the utility, arbitrary scripting code may be executed by the target user's browser.
CVE-2007-5496.extra: A local user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser when the target user runs the application.

CVE-2007-5497.title: E2fsprogs Buffer Overflow in libext2fs Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-5497.body: A vulnerability was reported in E2fsprogs. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can modify a filesystem so that when a target user or application executes libext2fs, a heap overflow will occur and arbitrary arbitrary code will be executed. The code will run with the privileges of the target user or application.McAfee AVERT Research group reported this vulnerability in December 2007.
CVE-2007-5497.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-5502.title: OpenSSL FIPS Object Module Self-Test Error Causes the System to Generate More Predictable Pseudo Random Data
CVE-2007-5502.body: A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL in the FIPS Object Module. The PRNG is not properly seeded.Auto-seeding does not occur due to an error in the FIPS self-test. As a result, the system generates pseudo random data that is more predictable than intended.Geoff Lowe of Secure Computing Corporation reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5502.extra: The system generates pseudo random data that is more predictable than intended.

CVE-2007-5503.title: Cairo Integer Overflow in Processing PNG Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5503.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cairo. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted PNG file that, when loaded by the target user or application, will trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user or application.The vulnerability resides in the read_png() function in 'cairo-png.c'.Peter Valchev of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5503.extra: A remote user can create a PNG file that, when loaded by the target user or application, will execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-5506.title: Oracle Database and Other Products Have Unspecified Vulnerabilities With Unspecified Impact
CVE-2007-5506.body: Numerous vulnerabilities were reported in Oracle Database and other Oracle products. The impact was not specified by the vendor.Oracle released their Critical Patch Update for October 2007, addressing numerous vulnerabilities in Oracle Database, Oracle Application Server, Oracle Collaboration Suite, Oracle E-Business Suite, Oracle Enterprise Manager Database Control, Oracle Enterprise Manager Grid Control, Oracle PeopleSoft Enterprise PeopleTools, and Oracle PeopleSoft Enterprise Human Capital Management.The following product versions are affected:* Oracle Database 10g Release 2, versions 10.2.0.2, 10.2.0.3* Oracle Database 10g, versions 10.1.0.5* Oracle Database 9i Release 2, versions 9.2.0.8, 9.2.0.8DV* Oracle Application Server 10g Release 3 (10.1.3), versions 10.1.3.0.0, 10.1.3.1.0, 10.1.3.2.0, 10.1.3.3.0* Oracle Application Server 10g Release 2 (10.1.2), versions 10.1.2.0.1 - 10.1.2.0.2, 10.1.2.1.0, 10.1.2.2.0* Oracle Application Server 10g (9.0.4), version 9.0.4.3* Oracle Collaboration Suite 10g Release 1, version 10.1.2* Oracle E-Business Suite Release 12, versions 12.0.0 - 12.0.3* Oracle E-Business Suite Release 11i, versions 11.5.8 - 11.5.10 CU2* Oracle Enterprise Manager Database Control 10g Release 2, versions 10.2.0.2, 10.2.0.3* Oracle Enterprise Manager Database Control 10g Release 1, version 10.1.0.5* Oracle Enterprise Manager Grid Control 10g Release 1, versions 10.1.0.5, 10.1.0.6* Oracle PeopleSoft Enterprise PeopleTools versions 8.22, 8.47, 8.48, 8.49* Oracle PeopleSoft Enterprise Human Capital Management version 8.9, 9.0 (Absence Management Module)* Oracle Database 9i, version 9.0.1.5 FIPS+* Oracle Application Server 9i Release 1, version 1.0.2.2Oracle has provided no specifics regarding the nature of these vulnerabilities.Oracle Database products contain 27 vulnerabilities, five of which can be exploited by remote users without authentication. None of the vulnerabilities apply to Oracle Database client-only installations (that do not have the Oracle Database installed).The affected Database components include: Import, Export, Oracle Text, Spatial, Workspace Manager, Advance Security Manager, Core RDBMS, Database Control, Oracle Database Vault, Oracle Net Services, XML DB, Oracle Help for Web, Advance Queuing, and SQL Execution.Oracle Internet Directory contains one vulnerability.Oracle Application Server contains 11 vulnerabilities, seven of which can be exploited by remote users without authentication.Oracle E-Business Suite contains eight vulnerabilities, one of which can be exploited by remote users without authentication.Oracle Enterprise Manager contains two vulnerabilities.Oracle PeopleSoft Enterprise PeopleTools contains two vulnerabilities.Oracle PeopleSoft Enterprise Human Capital Management contains one vulnerability.Oracle has provided the following maximum CVSS base scores:* Oracle Database: 6.5* Oracle Application Server: 6.8* Oracle Collaboration Suite: 5.8* Oracle E-Business Suite: 6.0* Oracle Enterprise Risk Manager: 5.0* Oracle PeopleSoft Enterprise: 4.9Oracle credits the following individuals and organizations with reporting these vulnerabilities:Esteban Martinez Fayo of Application Security, Inc.; Johannes Greil of SEC Consult; Joxean Koret; Joxean Koret working with Tipping Point's Zero Day Initiative; Alexander Kornbrust of Red Database Security GmbH; and David Litchfield of Next Generation Security Software Ltd.

CVE-2007-5507.title: Oracle Database and Other Products Have Unspecified Vulnerabilities With Unspecified Impact
CVE-2007-5507.body: Numerous vulnerabilities were reported in Oracle Database and other Oracle products. The impact was not specified by the vendor.Oracle released their Critical Patch Update for October 2007, addressing numerous vulnerabilities in Oracle Database, Oracle Application Server, Oracle Collaboration Suite, Oracle E-Business Suite, Oracle Enterprise Manager Database Control, Oracle Enterprise Manager Grid Control, Oracle PeopleSoft Enterprise PeopleTools, and Oracle PeopleSoft Enterprise Human Capital Management.The following product versions are affected:* Oracle Database 10g Release 2, versions 10.2.0.2, 10.2.0.3* Oracle Database 10g, versions 10.1.0.5* Oracle Database 9i Release 2, versions 9.2.0.8, 9.2.0.8DV* Oracle Application Server 10g Release 3 (10.1.3), versions 10.1.3.0.0, 10.1.3.1.0, 10.1.3.2.0, 10.1.3.3.0* Oracle Application Server 10g Release 2 (10.1.2), versions 10.1.2.0.1 - 10.1.2.0.2, 10.1.2.1.0, 10.1.2.2.0* Oracle Application Server 10g (9.0.4), version 9.0.4.3* Oracle Collaboration Suite 10g Release 1, version 10.1.2* Oracle E-Business Suite Release 12, versions 12.0.0 - 12.0.3* Oracle E-Business Suite Release 11i, versions 11.5.8 - 11.5.10 CU2* Oracle Enterprise Manager Database Control 10g Release 2, versions 10.2.0.2, 10.2.0.3* Oracle Enterprise Manager Database Control 10g Release 1, version 10.1.0.5* Oracle Enterprise Manager Grid Control 10g Release 1, versions 10.1.0.5, 10.1.0.6* Oracle PeopleSoft Enterprise PeopleTools versions 8.22, 8.47, 8.48, 8.49* Oracle PeopleSoft Enterprise Human Capital Management version 8.9, 9.0 (Absence Management Module)* Oracle Database 9i, version 9.0.1.5 FIPS+* Oracle Application Server 9i Release 1, version 1.0.2.2Oracle has provided no specifics regarding the nature of these vulnerabilities.Oracle Database products contain 27 vulnerabilities, five of which can be exploited by remote users without authentication. None of the vulnerabilities apply to Oracle Database client-only installations (that do not have the Oracle Database installed).The affected Database components include: Import, Export, Oracle Text, Spatial, Workspace Manager, Advance Security Manager, Core RDBMS, Database Control, Oracle Database Vault, Oracle Net Services, XML DB, Oracle Help for Web, Advance Queuing, and SQL Execution.Oracle Internet Directory contains one vulnerability.Oracle Application Server contains 11 vulnerabilities, seven of which can be exploited by remote users without authentication.Oracle E-Business Suite contains eight vulnerabilities, one of which can be exploited by remote users without authentication.Oracle Enterprise Manager contains two vulnerabilities.Oracle PeopleSoft Enterprise PeopleTools contains two vulnerabilities.Oracle PeopleSoft Enterprise Human Capital Management contains one vulnerability.Oracle has provided the following maximum CVSS base scores:* Oracle Database: 6.5* Oracle Application Server: 6.8* Oracle Collaboration Suite: 5.8* Oracle E-Business Suite: 6.0* Oracle Enterprise Risk Manager: 5.0* Oracle PeopleSoft Enterprise: 4.9Oracle credits the following individuals and organizations with reporting these vulnerabilities:Esteban Martinez Fayo of Application Security, Inc.; Johannes Greil of SEC Consult; Joxean Koret; Joxean Koret working with Tipping Point's Zero Day Initiative; Alexander Kornbrust of Red Database Security GmbH; and David Litchfield of Next Generation Security Software Ltd.

CVE-2007-5537.title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager SIP INVITE Processing Lets Remote Users Deny Service and TFTP Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5537.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a flood of SIP INVITE messages to UDP port 5060 to consume all available resources and trigger a kernel panic on the target system.Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsi75822 to this vulnerability.Cisco Unified CallManager versions 3.x, 4.0 and 4.1, Communications Manager 4.2 and 4.3, and Cisco CallManager Express are not affected.A remote user can send a specially crafted filename to trigger a buffer overflow in the TFTP service and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The vulnerability can also be triggered via the Centralized TFTP File Locator Service (via HTTP) on TCP port 6970.Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsh47712 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5537.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-5538.title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager SIP INVITE Processing Lets Remote Users Deny Service and TFTP Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5538.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a flood of SIP INVITE messages to UDP port 5060 to consume all available resources and trigger a kernel panic on the target system.Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsi75822 to this vulnerability.Cisco Unified CallManager versions 3.x, 4.0 and 4.1, Communications Manager 4.2 and 4.3, and Cisco CallManager Express are not affected.A remote user can send a specially crafted filename to trigger a buffer overflow in the TFTP service and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The vulnerability can also be triggered via the Centralized TFTP File Locator Service (via HTTP) on TCP port 6970.Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsh47712 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5538.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-5562.title: NETGEAR ProSafe SSL VPN Concentrator Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-5562.body: A vulnerability was reported in the NETGEAR ProSafe SSL VPN Concentrator 25. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The web interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the NETGEAR Router software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor was notified on October 9, 2007.A demonstration exploit request is provided:/cgi-bin/welcome/XYZ?err=<script>alert('XSS');</script>"SkyOut reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5562.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the NETGEAR Router software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-5568.title: Cisco Firewall Service Module HTTPS and MGCP Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-5568.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Firewall Service Module. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user may be able to bypass access control lists.A remote user can send specially crafted HTTPS requests to cause the target device to reload if the HTTPS server is enabled (not the default configuration). Versions 3.1(5) and prior and version 3.2(1) are affected by the HTTPS vulnerability.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsi77844 to this vulnerability.A remote user can send specially crafted Media Gateway Control Protocol (MGCP) packets to cause the target device to reload if MGCP application layer protocol inspection is enabled (not the default configuration). Version 3.1(5) and prior 3.1 versions are affected. Versions 2.3.x and 3.2.x are not affected.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsi00694 to this vulnerability.The PIX 500 Series Security Appliances and the Cisco ASA 5500 Series Adaptive Security Appliances are affected by the MGCP vulnerability.The access control list may not work properly after being modified by an authenticated administrator. This may allow a remote user to bypass the firewall or may deny traffic that should otherwise be permitted. Deleting and re-adding access control entries can trigger this vulnerability.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsj52536 to this vulnerability. Cisco and Cisco customers discovered these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-5568.extra: A remote user can cause the target device to reload.A remote user may be able to bypass access controls in certain cases.

CVE-2007-5568.title: Cisco PIX Firewall TLS and MGCP Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-5568.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco PIX Firewall. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted TLS requests to cause the target device to reload if certain TLS-based functions (e.g., clientless WebVPN, HTTPS management, cut-through proxy for network access, and TLS proxy for encrypted voice inspection) are enabled.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsg43276 and CSCsh97120 to this vulnerability.A remote user can send specially crafted Media Gateway Control Protocol (MGCP) packets to cause the target device to reload if MGCP application layer protocol inspection is enabled (not the default configuration).Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsi90468 to this vulnerability.Cisco and Cisco customers discovered these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-5568.extra: A remote user can cause the target device to reload.

CVE-2007-5580.title: Cisco Security Agent for Windows Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5580.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Security Agent for Windows. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 139 or 445 on the target system to trigger a buffer overflow in the 'Csatdi.sys' driver and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with kernel level privileges.The following Cisco products include the agent software and are affected:Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CallManager)Cisco Conference Connection (CCC)Emergency ResponderIPCC ExpressIPCC EnterpriseIPCC HostedIP Interactive Voice Response (IP IVR)IP Queue ManagerIntelligent Contact Management (ICM)Cisco Voice Portal (CVP)Cisco Unified Meeting PlaceCisco Personal Assistant (PA)Cisco UnityCisco Unity ConnectionCisco Unity BridgeCisco Internet Service Node (ISN)Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsl00618 to this vulnerability.NSFocus Security Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5580.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-5581.title: Cisco Unified MeetingPlace Web Conferencing Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-5581.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified MeetingPlace Web Conferencing. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The login screen does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Unified MeetingPlace software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The FirstName or LastName parameters are affected.Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsk17122 to this vulnerability.Joren McReynolds reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5581.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Unified MeetingPlace software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-5582.title: CiscoWorks Input Validation Hole in Login Page Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-5582.body: A vulnerability was reported in CiscoWorks. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The login page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the CiscoWorks software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor was notified on September 24, 2007.Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsk69289 to this vulnerability.CiscoWorks Common Management Foundation is not affected.CiscoWorks products that do not use CiscoWorks Common Services are not affected.Dave Lewis of Liquidmatrix.org reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5582.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the CiscoWorks software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-5583.title: Cisco 7940 IP Phone Can Be Crashed By Remote Users Sending a Sequence of SIP INVITE Requests
CVE-2007-5583.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco 7940 IP Phone. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user with knowledge of the userid and IP address of the target device can send a series of six specially crafted SIP INVITE requests to cause the target device to hang. Additional requests can be sent to cause the target device to crash and reboot.Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsl63427 to this vulnerability.Cisco was unable to reproduce the device reboot behavior.The system is not affected when the target SIP phone is registered to a Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CUCM) server.The vendor was notified on August 31, 2007.Humberto J. Abdelnur, Radu State, and Olivier Festor of the Madynes research team at INRIA Lorraine reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5583.extra: A remote user can cause the target device to hang or crash.

CVE-2007-5587.title: Windows Macromedia Security Driver Buffer Overflow Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-5587.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can trigger a buffer overflow in the Macromedia Security Driver (secdrv.sys) to execute arbitrary code on the target system with System level privileges.A demonstration exploit is available at:http://kartoffel.reversemode.com/downloads.phpThis vulnerability is being actively exploited.Symantec and Ruben from reversemode.com reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.symantec.com/enterprise/security_response/weblog/2007/10/privilege_escalation_exploit_i.html
CVE-2007-5587.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-5601.title: RealPlayer Input Validation Flaw in 'ierpplug.dll' Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5601.body: A vulnerability was reported in RealPlayer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will load an ActiveX control and trigger a flaw in 'ierpplug.dll' to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: FDC7A535-4070-4B92-A0EA-D9994BCC0DC5Linux and Macintosh versions of the player are not affected.This vulnerability is being actively exploited.
CVE-2007-5601.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5602.title: SwiftView Buffer Overflow in ActiveX Control and Plug-in Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5602.body: A vulnerability was reported in SwiftView. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the ActiveX control (svocx.ocx) and plug-in (npsview.dll) and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: 7DD62E58-5FA8-11D2-AFB7-00104B64F126Will Dormann of the CERT/CC reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5602.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5603.title: SonicWALL SSL-VPN Client Buffer Overflows in WebCacheCleaner/NeLaunchCtrl ActiveX Controls Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5603.body: A vulnerability was reported in the SonicWALL SSL-VPN Client software and NetExtender devices. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the WebCacheCleaner ActiveX control or the NeLaunchCtrl ActiveX control and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CLSIDs of the vulnerable controls are: 6EEFD7B1-B26C-440D-B55A-1EC677189F30 and 79D6214F-CFCE-480F-9901-27950E78F1E6The NetExtender devices and SSL-VPN client software are affected.The vendor was notified on May 21, 2007.Will Dormann of CERT/CC reported one of these vulnerabilities. lofi42 independently reported both vulnerabilities via SEC Consult.The original advisories are available at:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/298521http://www.sec-consult.com/fileadmin/Advisories/20071101-0_sonicwall_multiple.txt
CVE-2007-5603.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5604.title: HP Instant Support ActiveX Controls in 'HPISDataManager.dll' Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5604.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in HP Instant Support. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will invoke ActiveX controls in 'HPISDataManager.dll' and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Dennis Rand of CSIS Security Research and Intelligence reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-5604.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Dennis Rand of CSIS Security Research and Intelligence reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-5607.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5612.title: IBM Director Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-5612.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Director. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can initiate a number of connections to the target service to consume all available connections and prevent management connections.US-CERT notes that Juniper reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5612.extra: A remote user can prevent management connections.

CVE-2007-5649.title: SocketMail Input Validation Hole in 'lost_id' Parameter Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-5649.body: A vulnerability was reported in SocketMail. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The 'lostpwd.php' script does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'lost_id' parameter before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the SocketMail software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]/[PATH]/lostpwd.php?lost_id=[XSS]Ivan Sanchez and Maximiliano Soler reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://packetstormsecurity.org/0710-exploits/socketmail-xss.txt
CVE-2007-5649.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the SocketMail software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-5655.title: TIBCO SmartSockets Untrusted Pointer and Pointer Offset Values and Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5655.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in TIBCO SmartSockets. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. TIBCO RTworks and TIBCO Enterprise Message Service are also affected.A remote user can send specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The software accepts untrusted pointer and pointer offset values. The software also contains heap overflows.The following SmartSockets components are affected:TIBCO SmartSockets Server (rtserver)TIBCO SmartSockets Cache (scache)TIBCO SmartSockets Gateway (rtgateway)TIBCO SmartSockets LiveWeb (rtweb)TIBCO SmartSockets client libraries (rtipc, rtmsg, rtutil)TIBCO SmartMQ Server (mqserver)TIBCO SmartSockets Product Family (RTworks) versions prior to 4.0.4 are also affected.TIBCO Enterprise Message Service (EMS) versions 4.0.0 through 4.4.1 are also affected.The vendor was notified on October 23, 2007.McSlibin reported some of these vulnerabilities via iDefense. Sean Larsson of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported some of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-5655.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-5656.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in TIBCO SmartSockets. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. TIBCO RTworks and TIBCO Enterprise Message Service are also affected.A remote user can send specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The software accepts untrusted pointer and pointer offset values. The software also contains heap overflows.The following SmartSockets components are affected:TIBCO SmartSockets Server (rtserver)TIBCO SmartSockets Cache (scache)TIBCO SmartSockets Gateway (rtgateway)TIBCO SmartSockets LiveWeb (rtweb)TIBCO SmartSockets client libraries (rtipc, rtmsg, rtutil)TIBCO SmartMQ Server (mqserver)TIBCO SmartSockets Product Family (RTworks) versions prior to 4.0.4 are also affected.TIBCO Enterprise Message Service (EMS) versions 4.0.0 through 4.4.1 are also affected.The vendor was notified on October 23, 2007.McSlibin reported some of these vulnerabilities via iDefense. Sean Larsson of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported some of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-5656.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

TIBCO RTworks and TIBCO Enterprise Message Service are also affected.A remote user can send specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The software accepts untrusted pointer and pointer offset values.
