CVE-2007-5661.title: InstallShield ActiveX Control Lets Remote Users Load and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5661.body: A vulnerability was reported in InstallShield. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will load an untrusted remote library and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: 53D40FAA-4E21-459f-AA87-E4D97FC3245AThe vendor was notified on January 8, 2007.iDefense reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://labs.idefense.com/intelligence/vulnerabilities/display.php?id=649
CVE-2007-5661.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5665.title: Novell ZENworks Unsafe Executable Path Lets Local Users Gain System Privileges
CVE-2007-5665.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell ZENworks. A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.A local user can create an alternate command shell in a temporary directory used by the ZENworks Endpoint Security Management client and then cause the 'STEngine.exe' process to execute the alternate command shell program on the target system with system privileges.The vendor was notified on September 24, 2007.Stephen Fewer of Harmony Security reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2007-5665.extra: A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-5667.title: Novell Client Lets Local Users Gain Kernel Level Privileges
CVE-2007-5667.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell Client for Windows. A local user can obtain kernel level privileges on the target system.The 'NWFILTER.SYS' driver does not properly validate user-supplied data. A local user can supply specially crafted data to 'NWFILTER.SYS' to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with kernel level privileges.The vendor was notified on September 25, 2007.Stephen Fewer of Harmony Security reported this vulnerability via VeriSign iDefense.
CVE-2007-5667.extra: A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-5671.title: VMware Tools Input Validation Flaw in Windows Guest OS Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-5671.body: A vulnerability was reported in VMware Tools. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the Windows-based target guest operating systems.A local user can exploit an input validation flaw in the Windows-based VMware 'HGFS.sys' driver to execute arbitrary code on the guest system.Systems with HGFS disabled and no shared folders are still affected.Only Windows-based guests are affected.VMware Workstation, VMware Player, VMware ACE, VMware Server, and VMware ESX are affected.Stephen Fewer of Harmony Security reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2007-5671.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target guest system.

CVE-2007-5690.title: [Vendor Disputes Security Impact] Zaptel Buffer Overflow in 'sethdlc.c' May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-5690.body: A vulnerability was reported in Zaptel. A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system. [Editor's note: The vendor has disputed the privilege escalation claim.]A local user can trigger a buffer overflow in 'sethdlc.c' to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with elevated privileges on some systems.Michael Bucko reported this vulnerability.[Editor's note: The vendor notes that the sethdlc application requires root privileges to access, so no privilege escalation is possible and, therefore, this is not a vulnerability.]
CVE-2007-5690.extra: A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-5703.title: RSA Keon Registration Authority Input Validation Holes Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-5703.body: A vulnerability was reported in the RSA Keon Registration Authority. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the RSA Keon PKI software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The 'Request-spk.xuda' and 'Add-msie-request.xuda' components are affected.Fatih Ozavci and Caglar Cakici from GamaTEAM reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.gamasec.net/english/gs07-02.html
CVE-2007-5703.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the RSA Keon PKI software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-5707.title: OpenLDAP Lets Remote Users Crash the slapd Daemon With Specially Crafted objectClasses Attributes
CVE-2007-5707.body: A vulnerability was reported in OpenLDAP. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send an LDAP request with a specially crafted objectClasses attribute to cause the target slapd service to crash.Thomas Sesselmann reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5707.extra: A remote user can cause the slapd daemon to crash.

CVE-2007-5745.title: OpenOffice Heap Overflow in Processing Quattro Pro Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5745.body: A vulnerability was reported in OpenOffice.org Office Suite. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Quattro Pro file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2007-5745.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5746.title: OpenOffice Heap Overflow in Processing EMF Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5746.body: A vulnerability was reported in OpenOffice.org Office Suite in the processing of EMF files. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted EMF file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2007-5746.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5747.title: OpenOffice Heap Overflow in Processing Quattro Pro Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5747.body: A vulnerability was reported in OpenOffice.org Office Suite. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Quattro Pro file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2007-5747.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5755.title: AOL Radio Buffer Overflow in AmpX ActiveX Control Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5755.body: A vulnerability was reported in an ActiveX control used by AOL Radio. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Several buffer overflows exist.The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: B49C4597-8721-4789-9250-315DFBD9F525The vendor was notified on April 24, 2007.This vulnerability was reported via iDefense.
CVE-2007-5755.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5756.title: WinPcap Bug in bpf_filter_init() Function Lets Local Users Gain Kernel Level Privileges
CVE-2007-5756.body: A vulnerability was reported in WinPcap. A local user can obtain kernel level privileges on the target system.A local user can submit a specially crafted IOCTL request to the 'NPF.SYS' driver to trigger a memory access error in the bpf_filter_init() function and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with kernel level privileges.The driver can be accessed by local users once an administrator has loaded a WinPcap-based application.The vendor was notified on October 30, 2007.This vulnerability was reported via iDefense.
CVE-2007-5756.extra: A local user can obtain kernel level privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-5757.title: IBM DB2 Alternate Path Bug Lets Local Users Gain Root Privileges
CVE-2007-5757.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM DB2. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.A local user with privileges to run 'db2pd' can set the DB2INSTANCE environment variable to cause the libdb2 library to load and execute files containing arbitrary code. The code will run with root privileges.The vendor was notified on March 22, 2007.This vulnerability was reported via iDefense.
CVE-2007-5757.extra: A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-5758.title: IBM DB2 Administration Server Buffer Overflow Lets Local Users Gain Root Privileges
CVE-2007-5758.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM DB2. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user with privileges to execute 'db2dasrrm' can supply a specially crafted 'DASPROF' environment variable to trigger a buffer overflow in 'db2dasrrm' and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with root privileges.The vendor was notified on November 29, 2007.An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2007-5758.extra: A local user can execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-5761.title: netOctopus 'nantsys.sys' Driver Lets Local Users Gain Kernel Level Privileges
CVE-2007-5761.body: A vulnerability was reported in netOctopus. A local user can obtain kernel level privileges on the target system.A local user can write to the '\\.\NantSys' device and modify the SYSENTER_EIP_MSR register to execute arbitrary code.The device is loaded by the 'nantsys.sys' driver.Only the Windows-based agent is affected.The vendor was notified on September 7, 2007.Stephen Fewer of Harmony Security reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2007-5761.extra: A local user can obtain kernel level privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-5762.title: NetWare 'nicm.sys' Driver Lets Local Users Gain Kernel Level Privileges
CVE-2007-5762.body: A vulnerability was reported in NetWare. A local user can obtain kernel level privileges on the target system.A local user can write to the '\\.\nicm' device and issue IOCTLs to execute arbitrary code.The device is loaded by the 'nicm.sys' driver.Only the Windows-based client is affected.The vendor was notified on October 30, 2007.Stephen Fewer of Harmony Security reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2007-5762.extra: A local user can obtain kernel level privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-5764.title: AIX Buffer Overflow in pioout Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-5764.body: A vulnerability was reported in AIX. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can supply a specially crafted command line option to trigger a buffer overflow in '/usr/lib/lpd/pio/etc/pioout' and execute arbitrary code on the target system with root level privileges.IBM has assigned APAR numbers IZ10840, IZ10841, IZ10842, and IZ10844 to this vulnerability.The vendor was notified on November 29, 2007.An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2007-5764.extra: A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-5767.title: Novell BorderManager Buffer Overflow in clntrust.exe Lets Remote Users Execute
CVE-2007-5767.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell BorderManager in the Client Trust component. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted Novell tree name to the Novell Client Trust component on UDP port 3024 to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The vendor was notified on July 17, 2007.uvinc reported this vulnerability via Tipping Point.
CVE-2007-5767.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-5770.title: Ruby SSL Certificate Attribute Verification Bugs Let Remote Users Conduct Man-in-the-Middle Attacks
CVE-2007-5770.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Ruby in the verification of SSL certificate attributes. A remote user may be able to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks.Several ruby net::* modules do not properly verify the commonName (CN) attribute of SSL certificate provided by remote server against the requested hostname.The net::http(s) module is affected [CVE-2007-5162].The net::ftptls, net::telnets, and net::imap modules and the CVS versions of net::pop and net::smtp are also affected [CVE-2007-5770].iSEC Partners reported the net::http(s) vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.isecpartners.com/advisories/2007-006-rubyssl.txt
CVE-2007-5770.extra: A remote user may be able to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks against encrypted sessions.

CVE-2007-5796.title: Blue Coat ProxySG Management Console Input Validation Hole in Processing CRLs Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-5796.body: A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat ProxySG. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The management console does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Blue Coat ProxySG software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Adrian Pastor of ProCheckUp reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5796.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Blue Coat ProxySG software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-5798.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server Input Validation Hole in 'uddigui/navigateTree.do' Page Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-5798.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM WebSphere Application Server. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting and cross-site request forgery attacks.The 'uddigui/navigateTree.do' page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the keyField, nameField, valueField, and frameReturn parameters before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the IBM WebSphere software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2007-5798.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the IBM WebSphere software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-5799.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server Input Validation Hole in 'uddigui/navigateTree.do' Page Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-5799.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM WebSphere Application Server. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting and cross-site request forgery attacks.The 'uddigui/navigateTree.do' page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the keyField, nameField, valueField, and frameReturn parameters before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the IBM WebSphere software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2007-5799.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the IBM WebSphere software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-5829.title: Norton Anti-Virus for Macintosh Mount Scan Feature Lets Local Users Gain Root Privileges
CVE-2007-5829.body: A vulnerability was reported in Norton Anti-Virus for Macintosh. Certain local users can obtain root privileges on the target system.A local user with 'admin' group privileges can modify an executable used by the Mount Scan feature. The modified executable will run with root privileges.William Carrel reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5829.extra: A local user with 'admin' group privileges can obtain root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-5829.title: Symantec Anti Virus for Macintosh Mount Scan Feature Lets Local Users Gain Root Privileges
CVE-2007-5829.body: A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Anti Virus for Macintosh. Certain local users can obtain root privileges on the target system.A local user with 'admin' group privileges can modify an executable used by the Mount Scan feature. The modified executable will run with root privileges.William Carrel reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5829.extra: A local user with 'admin' group privileges can obtain root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-5846.title: Net-snmp GETBULK Request Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-5846.body: A vulnerability was reported in Net-snmp. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a GETBULK request with a large max-repeaters value to the agent to consume excessive CPU and memory resources on the target system.
CVE-2007-5846.extra: A remote user can cause excessive CPU and memory consumption on the target system.

CVE-2007-5850.title: Mac OS X Multiple Bugs Permit Remote Code Execution, Local Privilege Escalation, Cross-Site Scripting Attacks, and Information Disclosure
CVE-2007-5850.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A local user can invoke the mount_smbfs and smbutil applications to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2007-3876]. Versions 10.5 and later are not affected. Sean Larsson of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a format string flaw in the Address Book URL handler and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-4708]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user. Versions 10.5 and later are not affected.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a path traversal flaw in CFNetwork and cause files to be automatically downloaded to arbitrary locations with the privileges of the target user [CVE-2007-4709]. Versions prior to 10.5 are not affected. Sean Harding reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create an image with a specially crafted embedded ColorSync profile that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-4710]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user. Versions 10.5 and later are not affected. Tom Ferris of Adobe Secure Software Engineering Team (ASSET) reported this vulnerability.Launch Services does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2007-5854]. A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will be able to access information on the target user's system. Michal Zalewski of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.A local user can exploit a race condition in the CoreFoundation CFURLWriteDataAndPropertiesToResource API to cause files to be created with insecure permissions [CVE-2007-5847]. As a result, a local user may be able to obtain potentially sensitive information. Versions 10.5 and later are not affected.A remote user can create a specially crafted '.DS_Store file' that, when opened via Finder by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow in Desktop Services and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2007-5850]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user. Versions 10.5 and later are not affected.A remote user can create a disk image with specially crafted GUID partition maps that, when opened by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in the IO Storage Family code and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2007-5853]. Versions 10.5 and later are not affected.A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML file that, when previewed by the target user with QuickLook, will allow the remote user to initiate network requests to access potentially sensitive information [CVE-2007-5856]. Versions prior to 10.5 are not affected.A remote user can create a specially crafted movie file that, when previewed by the target user with QuickLook, will allow URLs within the movie to be accessed [CVE-2007-5857]. Versions prior to 10.5 are not affected. Versions prior to 10.5 are not affected. Also, systems with QuickTime 7.3 are not affected. Lukhnos D. Liu of Lithoglyph Inc. reported this vulnerability.A local user can exploit a flaw in SpinTracer's handling of output files to execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2007-5860]. Versions prior to 10.5 are not affected. Kevin Finisterre of DigitalMunition reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create a specially crafted '.xls' file that, when downloaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in the Microsoft Office Spotlight Importer and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-5861]. Versions 10.5 and later are not affected.A remote user may be able to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack to hijack a target user's Software Update download session and execute arbitrary commands on the target user's system [CVE-2007-5863]. Moritz Jodeit reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create a specially crafted email attachment that, when opened by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system without warning due to a flaw in Launch Services [CVE-2007-6165]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user. Versions prior to 10.5 are not affected. Xeno Kovah reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5850.extra: A remote user can create HTML or a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.A remote user can access information on the target user's system.A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2007-5851.title: iChat Lets Remote Users on the Local Network Initiate Unauthorized Video Chats
CVE-2007-5851.body: A vulnerability was reported in iChat. A user can initiate an unauthorized video chat.A remote user on the local network can initiate a video conference with the target user without the target user's approval.Mac OS X versions 10.5 and later are not affected.
CVE-2007-5851.extra: A remote user on the local network can initiate a video conference with the target user without the target user's approval.

CVE-2007-5854.title: Mac OS X Multiple Bugs Permit Remote Code Execution, Local Privilege Escalation, Cross-Site Scripting Attacks, and Information Disclosure
CVE-2007-5854.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A local user can invoke the mount_smbfs and smbutil applications to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2007-3876]. Versions 10.5 and later are not affected. Sean Larsson of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a format string flaw in the Address Book URL handler and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-4708]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user. Versions 10.5 and later are not affected.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a path traversal flaw in CFNetwork and cause files to be automatically downloaded to arbitrary locations with the privileges of the target user [CVE-2007-4709]. Versions prior to 10.5 are not affected. Sean Harding reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create an image with a specially crafted embedded ColorSync profile that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-4710]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user. Versions 10.5 and later are not affected. Tom Ferris of Adobe Secure Software Engineering Team (ASSET) reported this vulnerability.Launch Services does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2007-5854]. A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will be able to access information on the target user's system. Michal Zalewski of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.A local user can exploit a race condition in the CoreFoundation CFURLWriteDataAndPropertiesToResource API to cause files to be created with insecure permissions [CVE-2007-5847]. As a result, a local user may be able to obtain potentially sensitive information. Versions 10.5 and later are not affected.A remote user can create a specially crafted '.DS_Store file' that, when opened via Finder by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow in Desktop Services and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2007-5850]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user. Versions 10.5 and later are not affected.A remote user can create a disk image with specially crafted GUID partition maps that, when opened by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in the IO Storage Family code and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2007-5853]. Versions 10.5 and later are not affected.A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML file that, when previewed by the target user with QuickLook, will allow the remote user to initiate network requests to access potentially sensitive information [CVE-2007-5856]. Versions prior to 10.5 are not affected.A remote user can create a specially crafted movie file that, when previewed by the target user with QuickLook, will allow URLs within the movie to be accessed [CVE-2007-5857]. Versions prior to 10.5 are not affected. Versions prior to 10.5 are not affected. Also, systems with QuickTime 7.3 are not affected. Lukhnos D. Liu of Lithoglyph Inc. reported this vulnerability.A local user can exploit a flaw in SpinTracer's handling of output files to execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2007-5860]. Versions prior to 10.5 are not affected. Kevin Finisterre of DigitalMunition reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create a specially crafted '.xls' file that, when downloaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in the Microsoft Office Spotlight Importer and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-5861]. Versions 10.5 and later are not affected.A remote user may be able to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack to hijack a target user's Software Update download session and execute arbitrary commands on the target user's system [CVE-2007-5863]. Moritz Jodeit reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create a specially crafted email attachment that, when opened by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system without warning due to a flaw in Launch Services [CVE-2007-6165]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user. Versions prior to 10.5 are not affected. Xeno Kovah reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5854.extra: A remote user can create HTML or a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.A remote user can access information on the target user's system.A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2007-5855.title: Apple Mail May Use Plaintext Authentication When SMTP Authentication is Selected
CVE-2007-5855.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple Mail. A remote user may be able to obtain an e-mail password.When an SMTP account is set up using Account Assistant and SMTP authentication is selected, the mail client will send the password in plaintext to the mail server if the server supports only MD5 Challenge-Response authentication and plaintext authentication. A remote user monitoring the network may be able to obtain the target user's mail password.Mac OS X versions 10.5 and later are not affected.
CVE-2007-5855.extra: A remote user monitoring the network may be able to obtain the target user's mail password.

CVE-2007-5858.title: Safari SubFrame Navigation and RSS Feed URL Bugs Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5858.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Safari. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will cause WebKit to navigate the subframes of arbitrary pages and execute arbitrary scripting code in the context of those pages [CVE-2007-5858]. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted RSS feed that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2007-5859]. Mac OS X versions 10.5 and later are not affected.
CVE-2007-5858.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Perl software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5900.title: PHP Buffer Overflows, Filtering Bypass, and Configuration Bypass Bugs May Let Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-5900.body: A vulnerability was reported in PHP. A user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A user may be able to trigger a buffer overflow in the fnmatch(), setlocale() and glob() functions. Laurent Gaffie reported this vulnerability.A user can supply partial multibyte sequences to the htmlentities() and htmlspecialchars() functions to potentially bypass the filtering functions. Rasmus Lerdorf reported this vulnerability.A user can invoke the ini_set() function to overwrite values set with php_admin_* in the 'httpd.conf' file. samy-delux at gmx dot de reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5900.extra: A user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-5904.title: Linux Kernel Buffer Overflow in CIFS VFS May Let Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5904.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Linux kernel. A remote authenticated user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow in the SendReceive() function in 'transport.c' to cause the target system to crash.It may be possible to execute arbitrary code on the target system.Przemyslaw Wegrzyn reported this vulnerability in November 2007.
CVE-2007-5904.extra: A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote authenticated user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-5909.title: IBM Lotus Notes Buffer Overflows in File Attachment Viewer Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5909.body: Tan Chew Keong of vuln.sg reported several vulnerabilities in IBM Lotus Notes in the file attachment viewer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when viewed by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the file attachment viewer and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted DOC, SAM, WPD, or MIF file attachment can trigger an overflow.IBM has assigned SPR numbers KEMG6X9QED, KEMG6XAS48, KEMG6XPK6A, and KEMG6XTLDN to these vulnerabilities.The vendor was notified on January 5, 2007.The original advisory is available at:http://vuln.sg/lotusnotes702-en.htmlhttp://vuln.sg/lotusnotes702-jp.html
CVE-2007-5909.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when viewed by the target user via the file attachment viewer, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5909.title: Symantec Mail Security Buffer Overflows in KeyView Module Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5909.body: A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Mail Security in the Autonomy KeyView module. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system.A remote user can send an e-mail message with a specially crafted attachment that, when processed by the target application, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.The vulnerabilities reside in the underlying Autonomy KeyView module.The following file types are affected: * Adobe Acrobat FrameMaker (.mif) * Ami Pro (.sam) * Applix Words (.aw) * Applix Presents (.ag) * Dynamic Link Library (.dll) * FrameMaker (.mif) * Microsoft Rich Text Format (.rtf) * Microsoft Word - (.doc) * Microsoft Word for DOS (.doc) * Portable Executable (.exe) * WordPerfect (.wpd)Secunia reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5909.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when processed by the target application, will execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-5910.body: Tan Chew Keong of vuln.sg reported several vulnerabilities in IBM Lotus Notes in the file attachment viewer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when viewed by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the file attachment viewer and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted DOC, SAM, WPD, or MIF file attachment can trigger an overflow.IBM has assigned SPR numbers KEMG6X9QED, KEMG6XAS48, KEMG6XPK6A, and KEMG6XTLDN to these vulnerabilities.The vendor was notified on January 5, 2007.The original advisory is available at:http://vuln.sg/lotusnotes702-en.htmlhttp://vuln.sg/lotusnotes702-jp.html
CVE-2007-5910.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when viewed by the target user via the file attachment viewer, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-5910.title: Symantec Mail Security Buffer Overflows in KeyView Module Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5910.body: A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Mail Security in the Autonomy KeyView module. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system.A remote user can send an e-mail message with a specially crafted attachment that, when processed by the target application, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.The vulnerabilities reside in the underlying Autonomy KeyView module.The following file types are affected: * Adobe Acrobat FrameMaker (.mif) * Ami Pro (.sam) * Applix Words (.aw) * Applix Presents (.ag) * Dynamic Link Library (.dll) * FrameMaker (.mif) * Microsoft Rich Text Format (.rtf) * Microsoft Word - (.doc) * Microsoft Word for DOS (.doc) * Portable Executable (.exe) * WordPerfect (.wpd)Secunia reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5910.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when processed by the target application, will execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-5925.title: MySQL convert_search_mode_to_innobase() Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-5925.body: A vulnerability was reported in MySQL. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted request to trigger an assertion error in the convert_search_mode_to_innobase() function and cause the target service to crash.The vulnerable function resides in 'ha_innodb.cc'.A specially crafted CONTAINS operation on an indexed column can trigger the flaw.Artem Russakovskii reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5925.extra: A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

CVE-2007-5933.title: Pioneers Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-5933.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Pioneers (formerly Gnocatan). A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target service to free session objects that are still in use [CVE-2007-5933].Roland Clobus reported this vulnerability.A remote user can close connections to trigger a failed assertion [CVE-2007-6010].Bas Wijnen reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5933.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-5935.title: teTeX Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Unsafe Temporary Files Let Local Users Overwrite Files
CVE-2007-5935.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in teTeX. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can gain elevated privileges.A remote user can create a specially crafted dvi file that, when loaded by the target user or application, will trigger a buffer overflow in dvips and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-5935]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user or application.The dviljk utilities create unsafe temporary files [CVE-2007-5936]. A local user can exploit this to create or overwrite files with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted dvi file that, when loaded by the target user or application, will trigger a buffer overflow in the dviljk utilities and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-5937]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user or application.Bastien Roucaries reported the dvips buffer overflow and Joachim Schrod reported the other two vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-5935.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user or application, will execute arbitrary code on the target system.A local user can create or modify files with the privileges of the target user.

CVE-2007-5936.title: teTeX Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Unsafe Temporary Files Let Local Users Overwrite Files
CVE-2007-5936.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in teTeX. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can gain elevated privileges.A remote user can create a specially crafted dvi file that, when loaded by the target user or application, will trigger a buffer overflow in dvips and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-5935]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user or application.The dviljk utilities create unsafe temporary files [CVE-2007-5936]. A local user can exploit this to create or overwrite files with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted dvi file that, when loaded by the target user or application, will trigger a buffer overflow in the dviljk utilities and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-5937]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user or application.Bastien Roucaries reported the dvips buffer overflow and Joachim Schrod reported the other two vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-5936.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user or application, will execute arbitrary code on the target system.A local user can create or modify files with the privileges of the target user.

CVE-2007-5937.title: teTeX Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Unsafe Temporary Files Let Local Users Overwrite Files
CVE-2007-5937.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in teTeX. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can gain elevated privileges.A remote user can create a specially crafted dvi file that, when loaded by the target user or application, will trigger a buffer overflow in dvips and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-5935]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user or application.The dviljk utilities create unsafe temporary files [CVE-2007-5936]. A local user can exploit this to create or overwrite files with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted dvi file that, when loaded by the target user or application, will trigger a buffer overflow in the dviljk utilities and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2007-5937]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user or application.Bastien Roucaries reported the dvips buffer overflow and Joachim Schrod reported the other two vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-5937.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user or application, will execute arbitrary code on the target system.A local user can create or modify files with the privileges of the target user.

CVE-2007-5939.title: Heimdal Kerberos Uninitialized Variable in ftpd Application Has Unspecified Impact
CVE-2007-5939.body: A vulnerability was reported in the ftpd application distributed with Heimdal Kerberos. The impact was not specified.The gss_userok() function may free an uninitialized parameter.The report did not indicate the specific impact.Venustech AD-LAB reported this vulnerability.

CVE-2007-5944.title: IBM WebSphere Input Validation Hole in 'Expect' Header Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-5944.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM WebSphere. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The server does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in an 'Expect' header before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted 'Expect' header that, when submitted by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the IBM WebSphere software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2007-5944.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the IBM WebSphere software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-5947.title: Mozilla Firefox Input Validation Hole in jar: Protocol Handler Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-5947.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The jar: protocol handler does not properly validate the MIME types of archive contents. A remote user can upload a specially crafted zip file (or certain other files). Then, when the target user loads a jar: URL that points to the zip file, arbitrary scripting code will be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site permitting the file upload and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Jesse Ruderman, pdp, and beford.org separately reported this vulnerability.The original reports are available at:https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=369814http://www.gnucitizen.org/blog/web-mayhem-firefoxs-jar-protocol-issues
CVE-2007-5947.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with an arbitrary site that allows certain types of file uploads, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-5958.title: X Server Bugs in XFree86, Xinput, TOG-CUP, MIT-SHM, and EVI Extensions Let Local Users Gain Root Privileges
CVE-2007-5958.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in X. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system. A local user can determine whether certain files or directories exist on the target system.A local user can exploit any of several memory corruption errors in the X server to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the target X server (typically root level privileges).A local user can supply a specially PassMessage request to cause an out-of-bounds array index error and trigger a pointer dereference in the XFree86 Misc extension [CVE-2007-5760].A local user can supply a certain type of command ('X :1 -sp <file>') specifying an arbitrary file or directory to identify whether the specified file exists in access-restricted directories based on the error message returned by the system [CVE-2007-5958].A local user can trigger a heap corruption error in the Xinput extension [CVE-2007-6427].A local user can read arbitrary memory contents by exploiting the ProcGetReservedColormapEntries() function in the TOG-CUP extension [CVE-2007-6428].A local user can supply a specially crafted request to trigger an integer overflow in the pixmap creation process in the MIT-SHM and EVI extensions [CVE-2007-6429].A local user can supply a specially crafted PCF font to trigger a buffer overflow [CVE-2008-0006].regenrecht reported CVE-2007-5760, CVE-2007-6427, CVE-2007-6428, and CVE-2007-6429 via iDefense. Takuya Shiozaki of CodeBlog reported CVE-2008-0006. An anonymous researcher reported CVE-2007-5859.
CVE-2007-5958.extra: A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.A local user can determine whether files or directories exist on the target system.

CVE-2007-5960.title: Mozilla Firefox Referer Header Spoofing Bug Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2007-5960.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.A remote user can exploit a race condition when setting the 'window.location' property to spoof the HTTP Referer header value. This allows the remote user to potentially cause scripting code to be executed in a window (or a frame), where the Referer value is set to the URI of the window instead of the calling page.This can be used to bypass a web site's Referer checks.Gregory Fleischer reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-5960.extra: A remote user can bypass a web site's HTTP Referer checks in certain cases.

CVE-2007-5961.title: Red Hat Network Satellite Server Input Validation Hole in RHN Channel Search Feature Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-5961.body: A vulnerability was reported in Red Hat Network Satellite Server. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.Tthe Red Hat Network channel search feature does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Red Hat Network Satellite Server software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Version 4.2 and prior versions are not affected.Version 5.1 is not affected.
CVE-2007-5961.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Red Hat Network Satellite Server software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-5962.title: vsftpd Memory Leak in 'deny_file' Option Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-5962.body: A vulnerability was reported in vsftpd on Red Hat Enterprise Linux. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.When the system is configured with the 'deny_file' option in 'vsftpd.conf', a remote authenticated user (including anonymous users) can trigger a memory leak and consume all available memory.The vulnerability resides in a Red Hat-specific filter and not in the upstream version.
CVE-2007-5962.extra: A remote authenticated user can consume all available memory on the target system.

CVE-2007-5969.title: MySQL Rename Table Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Modify System Table Information
CVE-2007-5969.body: A vulnerability was reported in MySQL. A remote authenticated user can modify system table information.A remote authenticated user can invoke the RENAME TABLE command with specific DATA DIRECTORY and INDEX DIRECTORY options to replace a symlinked file, overwriting system table information.
CVE-2007-5969.extra: A remote authenticated user can modify system table information.

CVE-2007-5979.title: F5 FirePass Input Validation Hole in 'download_plugin.php3' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-5979.body: A vulnerability was reported in F5 FirePass. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The 'download_plugin.php3' script does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'backurl' parameter before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the F5 FirePass device and will run in the security context of that device. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.Jan Fry and Adrian Pastor of ProCheckUp Ltd. reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.procheckup.com/Vulnerability_PR07-13.php
CVE-2007-5979.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the device running the F5 FirePass software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-5989.title: Skype Memory Corruption Error in 'skype4com' URI Handler Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-5989.body: A vulnerability was reported in Skype. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in the 'skype4com' URI handler and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor was notified on November 2, 2007.TippingPoint reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-07-070.html
CVE-2007-5989.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-6010.title: Pioneers Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-6010.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Pioneers (formerly Gnocatan). A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target service to free session objects that are still in use [CVE-2007-5933].Roland Clobus reported this vulnerability.A remote user can close connections to trigger a failed assertion [CVE-2007-6010].Bas Wijnen reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-6010.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-6013.title: WordPress Cookie Authentication Flaw Lets Remote Users Access Accounts in Certain Cases
CVE-2007-6013.body: A vulnerability was reported in WordPress. A remote user can access arbitrary user accounts in certain cases.A remote user with read-only access to the Wordpress database wp_user table can generate a valid authentication cookie for arbitrary users on the target application.This vulnerability is being actively exploited.The vendor was notified on October 29, 2007, without response.The original advisory is available at:http://www.cl.cam.ac.uk/users/sjm217/advisories/wordpress-cookie-auth.txtSteven J. Murdoch reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-6013.extra: A remote user with read-only access to the Wordpress database can generate a valid authentication cookie for arbitrary users on the target application.

CVE-2007-6014.title: Beehive Forum Input Validation Flaw in 't_dedupe' Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
CVE-2007-6014.body: A vulnerability was reported in Beehive Forum. A remote user can inject SQL commands.The 'post.php' page does not properly validate user-supplied input in the 't_dedupe' parameter. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.Nick Bennett and Robert Brown from Symantec Vulnerability Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-6014.extra: A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2007-6015.title: Samba Buffer Overflow in nmbd send_mailslot() Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-6015.body: A vulnerability was reported in Samba. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted GETDC mailslot requests to trigger a buffer overflow in nmbd and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The vulnerability resides in the send_mailslot() function.The system is affected if the "domain logons" parameter is enabled in the 'smb.conf' configuration file.The vendor was notified on November 22, 2007.Alin Rad Pop of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-6015.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-6016.title: Symantec Backup Exec for Windows Server ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-6016.body: A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Backup Exec for Windows Server. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will invoke an ActiveX control and trigger a buffer overflow to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The ActiveX control is part of the scheduler component.The Symantec Backup Exec Media Server if affected. Remote client agents are not affected.JJ Reyes of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-6016.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-6017.title: Symantec Backup Exec for Windows Server ActiveX Control Unsafe Methods Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-6017.body: A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Backup Exec for Windows Server. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will invoke an ActiveX control and exploit some unsafe methods to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The ActiveX control is part of the scheduler component.The Symantec Backup Exec Media Server if affected. Remote client agents are not affected.JJ Reyes of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-6017.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-6020.title: Symantec Mail Security Buffer Overflows in Autonomy KeyView Module Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-6020.body: A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Mail Security. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted e-mail attachment to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.On the SMS for SMTP and SMS Appliance, the overflow will result in a child process crash.The vulnerability resides in the third party Autonomy KeyView module.Secunia reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-6020.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-6020.title: IBM Lotus Notes Stack Overflows in Folio Flat File Viewer Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-6020.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Lotus Notes in the Folio Flat File viewer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Folio Flat File (.fff) file that, when viewed by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vulnerability resides in 'foliosr.dll' in the processing of certain tags, including the DI, FD, FT, JD, JL, LE, OB, OD, OL, PN, PS, PW, RD, QL, and TS tags.The vendor was notified on December 28, 2007.The vendor has assigned SPR# PRAD7AM3LG to this vulnerability.Dyon Balding of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-6020.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when viewed by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-6021.title: Adobe PageMaker PMD File Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-6021.body: A vulnerability was reported in Adobe PageMaker. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted PMD file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted font structure can trigger an overflow. Other overflows may occur.The vendor was notified on October 23, 2007.JJ Reyes of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-6021.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-6026.title: Microsoft Jet Engine Stack Overflow May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-6026.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Jet Engine. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted '.mdb' file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow in 'msjet40.dll' and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A demonstration exploit is available at:http://ruder.cdut.net/attach/MS_MDB_Vul/Microsoft_Jet_Engine_MDB_File_Parsing_Exploit.rarThe vendor was notified on November 6, 2007.cocoruder reported this vulnerability.[Editor's note: Juha-Matti Laurio reported that this is the same vulnerability as CVE-2005-0944, Alert ID 1013618. It may also be the same as CVE-2007-6357.]
CVE-2007-6026.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-6035.title: Cacti Unspecified Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
CVE-2007-6035.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cacti. A remote user can inject SQL commands.The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to potentially execute SQL commands on the underlying database.No details were provided.
CVE-2007-6035.extra: A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2007-6037.title: Citrix NetScaler Input Validation Hole in 'generic_api_call' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-6037.body: A vulnerability was reported in Citrix NetScaler. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The web management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Citrix NetScaler device and will run in the security context of that device. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.The '/ws/generic_api_call.pl' script is affected.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]/ws/generic_api_call.pl?function=statns&standalone=%3c/script%3e%3cscript%3ealert(document.cookie)%3c/script%3e%3cscript%3ennposter reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-6037.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Citrix NetScaler device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-6055.title: Novell Teaming Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-6055.body: Some vulnerabilities reported in Novell Teaming. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can determine valid usernames on the target system.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'p_p_state' and 'p_p_mode' parameters before displaying the input [CVE-2009-1294]. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Novell Teaming software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:https://[target]/web/guest/home?p_p_id=82&p_p_action=1&p_p_state=%3Cscript%3Ealert('xss+vulnerability')%3C/script%3E&p_p_mode=view&p_p_col_id=column-2&p_p_col_pos=1&p_p_col_count=2&_82_struts_action=%2Flanguage%2Fview&_82_languageId=de_DEThe vulnerability resides in the included third party Liferay portal.The login page indicates whether authentication failures are due to an invalid username or an invalid password [CVE-2009-1293]. A remote user can valid usernames on the target application.The vendor was notified on February 19, 2009.Michael Kirchner of SEC Consult Vulnerability Lab reported these vulnerabilities.The original advisory is available at:https://www.sec-consult.com/files/20090415-0-novell-teaming.txt
CVE-2007-6055.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Novell Teaming software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can determine valid usernames on the target application.

CVE-2007-6060.title: AhnLab V3 Internet Security ZIP File Memory Error May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-6060.body: A vulnerability was reported in AhnLab V3 Internet Security. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted ZIP file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The original advisory is available at:http://secway.org/advisory/AD20071116.txtSowhat of Nevis Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-6060.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-6067.title: PostgreSQL Bugs Let Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service and Obtain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-6067.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in PostgreSQL. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target database. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote authenticated user can invoke certain index functions to gain elevated privileges [CVE-2007-6600]. The VACUUM and ANALYZE functions can be executed with superuser privileges. The SET ROLE and SET SESSION AUTHORIZATION functions can be accessed within index functions.A remote authenticated user can submit SQL queries containing specially crafted regular expressions to cause the database to enter an infinite loop, consume excessive memory, or crash [CVE-2007-4772, CVE-2007-6067, CVE-2007-4769].A remote authenticated user can invoke DBLink functions (combined with local trust or ident authentication) to gain superuser privileges [CVE-2007-3278, CVE-2007-6601].
CVE-2007-6067.extra: A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target database.A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

CVE-2007-6110.title: ht://Dig Input Validation Hole in 'sort' Parameter Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-6110.body: A vulnerability was reported in ht://Dig. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'sort' parameter before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the ht//Dig software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]/cgi-bin/htsearch?config=&restrict=&exclude=&method=and&format=builtin-long&sort=<script>alert("foo")</script>&words=fooMichael Skibbe reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-6110.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the ht://Dig software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-6112.title: Wireshark Wireshark MP3, DNP, SSL, ANSI MAP, Firebird/Interbase, NCP, HTTP, MEGACO, DCP ETSI, OS/400, PPP, Bluetooth SDP, and RPC Portmap Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-6112.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Wireshark. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target service to crash.A specially crafted MP3 file can trigger a crash.A specially crafted DNP packet can cause Wireshark to loop excessively. Beyond Security reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted SSL data can trigger a buffer overflow. Stefan Esser reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted ANSI MAP data can trigger a buffer overflow on some platforms.A specially crafted Firebird/Interbase packet can trigger a crash or cause Wireshark to enter an infinite loop.A specially crafted NCP packet can trigger a crash.A specially crafted HTTP chunked message can trigger a crash.A specially crafted MEGACO packet can cause Wireshark to enter a large loop and consume excessive system resources.A specially crafted DCP ETSI packet can cause Wireshark to enter a large loop and consume excessive system resources.A specially crafted iSeries (OS/400) Communication trace file can trigger a buffer overflow. Fabiodds reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted PPP packet can trigger a buffer overflow.A specially crafted Bluetooth SDP packet can cause Wireshark to enter an infinite loop.A specially crafted RPC Portmap packet can trigger a crash.
CVE-2007-6112.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-6113.title: Wireshark DNP3 Dissector Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-6113.body: A vulnerability was reported in Wireshark. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted DNP3 data to cause the target service to enter an infinite loop.The original advisory is available at:http://www.securiteam.com/securitynews/5LP0V00MAI.htmlbeSTORM reported this vulnerability (www.beyondsecurity.com/bestorm_overview.html).
CVE-2007-6113.extra: A remote user can cause Wireshark to enter an infinite loop.
