CVE-2007-6524.title: Opera BMP Handling Bug Lets Remote Users Access Portions of Kernel Memory
CVE-2007-6524.body: A vulnerability was reported in Opera. A remote user can view portions of kernel memory.A remote user create a specially crafted BMP file that, when loaded by the target user, will access uninitialized kernel memory.The information can be extracted using certain <canvas> methods.Gynvael Coldwind reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-6524.extra: A remote user can view portions of kernel memory.

CVE-2007-6530.title: XUpload Control Buffer Overflow in AddFolder() Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-6530.body: A vulnerability was reported in XUpload. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will load the XUpload ActiveX control trigger a buffer overflow in the AddFolder() function and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Elazar Broad reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-6530.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-6593.title: IBM Lotus Notes Buffer Overflows in Processing Lotus 1-2-3 Attachments Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-6593.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Lotus Notes. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Lotus 1-2-3 file that, when viewed by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Only Windows-based Notes clients are affected. The Domino server is not affected.The vulnerability resides in the 3rd party Autonomy Verity KeyView SDK, which is used by Lotus Notes to process Lotus 1-2-3 file attachments.Other applications that use the Verity KeyView SDK may be affected.The vendor was notified on September 17, 2007.Sebastian Muniz from the CORE IMPACT Exploit Writers Team (EWT) reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.coresecurity.com/?action=item&id=2008[Editor's note: A separate Alert (Alert ID 1019054) has been issued covering the Autonomy Verity KeyView SDK.]
CVE-2007-6593.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when viewed by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2007-6593.title: Symantec Mail Security Buffer Overflows in Processing Lotus 1-2-3 Attachments Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-6593.body: A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Mail Security. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Lotus 1-2-3 attachment that, when processed by the target application, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target application.The vulnerability resides in the 3rd party Autonomy Verity KeyView SDK, which is used by Symantec Mail Security to process Lotus 1-2-3 file attachments.Other applications that use the Verity KeyView SDK may be affected.
CVE-2007-6593.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when processed by the target application, will execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-6594.title: IBM Lotus Notes for Linux Has Unsafe Folder Permissions Let Local Users Gain Root Privileges
CVE-2007-6594.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in IBM Lotus Notes for Linux. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.The Lotus Notes 8 for Linux installer program creates files with unsafe permissions.Notes 8 for Linux installation files may be assigned unsafe permissions if extracted by a root user in a directory that allows non-root users to read and execute files. A local user may be able to modify the installation kit so that when a root user performs subsequent installations, arbitrary code will be executed with root privileges.The 'setup.sh' script sets the permissions on the 'installdata' file to world read, write, and execute (777 permissions). A local user can modify the file so that when a root user executes the script, arbitrary code will be executed with root privileges.
CVE-2007-6594.extra: A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2007-6596.title: Clam AntiVirus Unsafe File Access Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-6596.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Clam AntiVirus. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A remote user can bypass the scanning function.The cli_gentempfd() function in 'libclamav/others.c' creates temporary files in an unsafe manner. A local user that can guess the temporary filename can exploit a race condition and create a symbolic link (symlink) from a critical file on the system to the temporary filename to cause clamav to overwrite the symlinked file.Clamav fails to detect Bse64-UUEncoded encoding. A remote user can send content that is Base64-UUEncoded to bypass the scanning function.A local user can invoke Sigtool with the 'utf16-decode' option to overwrite certain files on the target system.
CVE-2007-6596.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote user can bypass the content scanning function.

CVE-2007-6600.title: PostgreSQL Bugs Let Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service and Obtain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-6600.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in PostgreSQL. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target database. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote authenticated user can invoke certain index functions to gain elevated privileges [CVE-2007-6600]. The VACUUM and ANALYZE functions can be executed with superuser privileges. The SET ROLE and SET SESSION AUTHORIZATION functions can be accessed within index functions.A remote authenticated user can submit SQL queries containing specially crafted regular expressions to cause the database to enter an infinite loop, consume excessive memory, or crash [CVE-2007-4772, CVE-2007-6067, CVE-2007-4769].A remote authenticated user can invoke DBLink functions (combined with local trust or ident authentication) to gain superuser privileges [CVE-2007-3278, CVE-2007-6601].
CVE-2007-6600.extra: A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target database.A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

CVE-2007-6601.title: PostgreSQL Bugs Let Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service and Obtain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2007-6601.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in PostgreSQL. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target database. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote authenticated user can invoke certain index functions to gain elevated privileges [CVE-2007-6600]. The VACUUM and ANALYZE functions can be executed with superuser privileges. The SET ROLE and SET SESSION AUTHORIZATION functions can be accessed within index functions.A remote authenticated user can submit SQL queries containing specially crafted regular expressions to cause the database to enter an infinite loop, consume excessive memory, or crash [CVE-2007-4772, CVE-2007-6067, CVE-2007-4769].A remote authenticated user can invoke DBLink functions (combined with local trust or ident authentication) to gain superuser privileges [CVE-2007-3278, CVE-2007-6601].
CVE-2007-6601.extra: A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target database.A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

CVE-2007-6637.title: Adobe Flash Content May Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-6637.body: Adobe Flash content on numerous web sites contain input validation vulnerabilities. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. [Editor's note: This is not a vulnerability in Flash player.]Some Adobe Flash content ('.swf' files) may not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site hosting the Adobe Flash content and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Pre-generated SWF files distributed with Adobe Dreamweaver CS3 and Adobe Acrobat Connect are affected. Other SWF files may also be affected.These vulnerabilities were reported in a pending book by Rich Cannings of Google and Himanshu Dwivedi and Zane Lackey of iSEC Partners.[Editor's note: This is not a vulnerability in Flash Player, per se. Because the issues may numerous web sites, the issue is reported here so that content creators can analyze their code for input validation flaws.]
CVE-2007-6637.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site hosting the Adobe Flash content, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-6642.title: Joomla! Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2007-6642.body: Armando Romeo (aka Zinho) from Hackers Center Security Group reported a vulnerability in Joomla!. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks to gain administrative privileges.Several administrative components do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target authenticated administrator, will cause arbitrary requests to be executed by the target user's browser. The requests can take actions on the site acting as the target administrator.This can be exploited to modify the application's configuration. This can also be exploited to upload arbitrary PHP code and subsequently execute arbitrary commands on the target system.The vendor separately reported other vulnerabilities: A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges; A fixed administrator can include other users in the administrator group; a remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks via com_poll.
CVE-2007-6642.extra: A remote user can take actions on the site acting as the target administrative user, including modifying the application's configuration or database and uploading and executing arbitrary PHP code.

CVE-2007-6643.title: Joomla! Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2007-6643.body: Armando Romeo (aka Zinho) from Hackers Center Security Group reported a vulnerability in Joomla!. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks to gain administrative privileges.Several administrative components do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target authenticated administrator, will cause arbitrary requests to be executed by the target user's browser. The requests can take actions on the site acting as the target administrator.This can be exploited to modify the application's configuration. This can also be exploited to upload arbitrary PHP code and subsequently execute arbitrary commands on the target system.The vendor separately reported other vulnerabilities: A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges; A fixed administrator can include other users in the administrator group; a remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks via com_poll.
CVE-2007-6643.extra: A remote user can take actions on the site acting as the target administrative user, including modifying the application's configuration or database and uploading and executing arbitrary PHP code.

A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks to gain administrative privileges.Several administrative components do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. The requests can take actions on the site acting as the target administrator.This can be exploited to modify the application's configuration. This can also be exploited to upload arbitrary PHP code and subsequently execute arbitrary commands on the target system.The vendor separately reported other vulnerabilities: A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges; A fixed administrator can include other users in the administrator group; a remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks via com_poll.
CVE-2007-6645.extra: A remote user can take actions on the site acting as the target administrative user, including modifying the application's configuration or database and uploading and executing arbitrary PHP code.

CVE-2007-6646.title: LiveCart Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-6646.body: A vulnerability was reported in LiveCart. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the LiveCart software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Some demonstration exploit URLs are provided:http://[target]/user/remindPassword?return=XSShttp://[target]/category?id=1&q=XSShttp://[target]/order?return=order/XSShttp://[target]/user/remindComplete?email=XSSDoz from Hackers Center Security Group reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.hackerscenter.com/archive/view.asp?id=28144
CVE-2007-6646.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the LiveCart software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-6698.title: OpenLDAP Lets Remote Authenticated Users Crash the slapd Daemon With Specially Crafted Modify Operations
CVE-2007-6698.body: A vulnerability was reported in OpenLDAP. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted modify operation with the NOOP control set to critical to cause the target slapd service to crash.Jonathan Clarke reported this vulnerability.[Editor's note: This vulnerability was originally reported in April 2007.]
CVE-2007-6698.extra: A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

CVE-2007-6699.title: AOL YGP Picture Editor Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2007-6699.body: A vulnerability was reported in AOL's YGP Picture Editor ActiveX control. A remote user can cause the target user's browser to crash.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory error in the AIM PicEditor Control and crash the target user's browser.The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: 085891E5-ED86-425F-8522-C10290FA8309Elazar Broad reported this vulnerability.[Editor's note: This was originally reported as a remote code execution vulnerability. On December 27, 2007, the author indicated that remote code execution is not possible based on analysis by Carsten Eiram from Secunia Research.]
CVE-2007-6699.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will cause the target user's browser to crash.

CVE-2007-6700.title: OpenBGPD Input Validation Hole in 'bgplg' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-6700.body: A vulnerability was reported in OpenBGPD's 'bgplg' looking glass. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The 'bgplg' script does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the OpenBGPD software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Anton Karpov reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.mail-archive.com/misc@openbsd.org/msg49057.htmlhttp://www.toxahost.ru/images/funny/obsd_xss.JPG
CVE-2007-6700.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the OpenBGPD software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-6701.title: Novell Client 'NWSPOOL.DLL' Stack Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-6701.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell Client. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A user can trigger a buffer overflow in 'NWSPOOL.DLL' to execute arbitrary code on the target system.The vendor was notified on February 7, 2007.The vendor credits TippingPoint Technologies with reporting this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-6701.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2007-6704.title: F5 FirePass Input Validation Holes in 'my.logon.php3' and 'my.activation.php3' Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2007-6704.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in F5 FirePass. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the F5 FirePass device and will run in the security context of that device. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.Some demonstration exploit URLs are provided:https://[target]/my.logon.php3?"></script><textarea>HTML_injection_test
CVE-2007-6704.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the F5 FirePass device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.

CVE-2007-6705.title: IBM WebSphere MQ Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges in COM+ or .NET Environments
CVE-2007-6705.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM WebSphere MQ. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can connect to a queue manager in a COM+ or .NET environment and obtain PROCESS_DUP_HANDLE permissions. The local user can duplicate a handle owned by the target process and potentially take control of the process.WebSphere MQ clients running in MTS or COM+ environments are affected.IBM has assigned APAR IC50431 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-6705.extra: A local user can gain control of a process on the target system.

CVE-2007-6706.title: IBM Lotus Notes SMTP Message Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2007-6706.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Lotus Notes. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted e-mail to execute arbitrary code on the target system or cause the target Notes client to crash.A specially crafted e-mail message body or e-mail attachment can trigger this vulnerability.SPRs SNES6NMVG7 and ABUI76AJAM were assigned to this vulnerability.Dan Ritter and the VCC reported this vulnerability.[Editor's note: The e-mail body vulnerability was originally reported in October 2007. The e-mail attachment vulnerability was reported on February 20, 2008.]
CVE-2007-6706.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2007-6714.title: DBMail LDAP Authentication Bug Lets Remote Users Access Arbitrary Mail Accounts
CVE-2007-6714.body: A vulnerability was reported in DBMail. A remote user can bypass authentication and access arbitrary IMAP accounts on the target system.A remote user can send an empty password string to login to arbitrary IMAP accounts without authenticating.Systems using the authldap module and an Active Directory LDAP server configured for anonymous logins are affected.The vulnerability resides in the ldap_bind_s() function in 'modules/authldap.c'.vugluskr reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2007-6714.extra: A remote user can access arbitrary IMAP accounts on the target system.

CVE-2007-6750.title: Apple macOS Server Bugs Let Remote Users Den Service and Determine Valid Usernames on the Target System
CVE-2007-6750.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Apple macOS Server. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote user can determine valid usernames on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted partial HTTP requests to cause denial of service conditions on the target HTTP server [CVE-2007-6750].A remote user can exploit an access permissions flaw in Wiki Server to determine valid usernames on the target system [CVE-2017-2382].Maris Kocins of SEMTEXX LTD reported the username disclosure vulnerability.
CVE-2007-6750.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can determine valid usernames on the target system.
